Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ViktoriaW
Reviews.Content: Are Eiffel is a very nice hotel just 5 min walking from the Eiffel Tower (the park), we bought breakfast from the nearby Starbucks and ate in the park in the morning! The location is also very good with several cafes, bistros and restaurants around that doesn't feel like it's in the tourism-area. The metro station is 2min away and has three lines that stop there, making it easy to get around to the various neighborhood. The room was quite small (standard in Paris) but did not feel that small, thanks to good lighting and layout of the room. The bathroom was relatively large in comparison with the size of the room, including a large shower and bath products by Hermés. Our room was very nicely decorated and felt modern. The only bad thing was the pillows and there was no conditioner for the hair in the bathroom. The street outside was very calm and quiet. The receptionists were very helpful and could be ok English

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: All_you_can_trip
Reviews.Content: The Ares is a great boutique hotel, conveniently located minutes away from Champ de Mars and the Eiffel Tower and very close to the metro station (La Motte Piquet). The area is quiet and has plenty of restaurants to choose from (a valuable help in this difficult choice will come from the staff!). Rooms are gorgeous with an outstanding bathroom an the sleep quality is excellent. This hotel is in the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Roshni0830
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of March. After extensive research we chose Ares Eiffel and were utterly impressed. The service is amazing! We felt as if we were visiting family. The rooms are of course smaller than typical 4-star North American style rooms, but we were impressed with the effective use of space and amazing decor. The 5 euro-a-day for drinks in the minibar (non alcoholic) is a great deal! Hotel also very helpful in arranging shuttle to airport & you can also check-in on their computer in the lobby and print the boarding passes which was very convenient. Wifi service was available in rooms but not fast enough to play videos, only for Internet searches & checking email (we were on 4th floor). Only thing lacking was a coffee brewer in the room and lack of iron as well. But that is very minor ---- recommend Ares .... 4-star service & facilities at a very reasonable price (check for sales through Expedia!!)

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: GILLANDJIM
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, a 10 minutes stroll to the Eiffel Tower. A 4 star, boutique hotel, where the staff were very helpful and friendly. The owner, a very pleasant Italian gentleman, introduced himself on our first morning. The metro station at La Motte Pique Grenelle is just 2 minutes away. We were recommended a pleasant, reasonably price, place to eat.This was the Cafe Du Marche on Rue Cler, about a 10 minutes stroll along the Avenue La Motte Pique.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: BBale
Reviews.Content: My trip to France included the Ares Eiffel as our hotel in Paris. Everything turned out to be great while staying there. The room was clean and very nice looking, the decoration absolutely stunning. A nice surprise is the minibar, just 5 euros/day flat. The area surrounding the hotel is quite and just 2 minutes away from metro and bus station. Lot of good reaturants around and the staff always gave us the right suggestions. My next stop in Paris wiil be again at Ares.

Reviews.Title: “Still loved it on return”
Reviews.Author: CarolineRoma
Reviews.Content: returned to Paris and stayed again at the Ares Eiffel -- enjoyed the stay just as much as the first time, even if the room was smaller, the comfort, service and location were all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet base for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ian P
Reviews.Content: Once again Tripadvisor steered us right! We were looking for a quiet, but central location for a week in Paris and this was perfect. Hotel is clean and well appointed with friendly and helpful staff. There are numerous excellent restaurants close by to take care of breakfast (if you don't want to pay the 16 euros for the decent hotel one), lunch or dinner. Even has a Starbucks around the corner if you need a more familiar caffeine fix. It is one of several cafes, bistros and wine bars that offer good spots to people watch on a sunny afternoon or evening. The hotel is on a quiet backstreet, within a block of the main thoroughfare and the only noise was of children in the local school playground at around 8.30 in the morning. As others have pointed out, the Eiffel Tower is no more than a 10 minute walk away. The Rodin museum, Military museum, Napoleon's tomb and Rue Cler are also within 10 to 15 minutes and if you are going to the other main museums and sights, the 3 lines served by the La Motte - Picquet metro station can get you to most of them directly within 15 minutes. We also found the #69 bus, which leaves from Champs de Mars in front of the Eiffel Tower, to be a very convenient way to get to the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Pompidou Center, etc if you prefer your travel above ground. The train for Versailles leaves from Javel, just 3 stops beyond La Motte - Picquet. We will definitely use this well priced gem again on any future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jerry S
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because my travel agent suggested me to do so. It has certainly been a nice surprise. Excellent location, clean rooms, gorgeous decorations. The area is surrounded by restaurants and cafe's, the La Motte - Picquet metro station is just a 2 minute walk and the Eiffel Tower probably less than 10. The great staff makes the difference, always nice and ready to help. Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Comfort, Style”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer1NewZealand
Reviews.Content: We live on the outskirts of Paris and I just took my husband in for a weekend under the Eiffel Tower for his birthday. Chose this hotel based on location and trip advisor reviews and couldn't have been more pleased. Stayed in room 72 ( a junior suite) on the top floor with a view of the top half of the Eiffel tower from our very comfortable circular bed, the tower all lit up and sparkling at night. Very romantic. The room had plenty of space, Versace bathroom and deco and very clean.The staff were very friendly and helpful. This was the best part of our experience- excellent service. A complementary bottle of champagne was waiting for us in the room. The hotel was super quiet at night. The breakfast was a little expensive but good. Easy walk to bars, metro, Eiffel Tower, cafes and the Seine. In the middle of the Suisse Village, an area for antique stores. No bar or restaurant but there is a good room service menu that they must source from somewhere local. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great small and personal hotel”
Reviews.Author: carlton96816
Reviews.Content: this was a great small and personal hotel. Very friendly staff and in a very convenient location near the metro. Will definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Philippe J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ares for 4 nights visiting relatives in Paris. The hotel is conveniently located in a quiet and nice area. The metro station is around the corner and the Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk. Our room was perfect, clean and beautifully decorated. The staff made our stay super, very very friendly. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: nel T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel between the 14th and 18th of March i have to say this is my new favourite place. We arrived at 10.30 and our room was ready for early check in. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Are room was lovely decorated, clean and had a good view. The hotel is situated in a good place as it is 5 mins walk to the eiffel tower but still in a quiet little street. This hotel was extra special to us as we got engaged here while also celebrating my birthday. We will defo be back and will recommend to others. Thanks Ares

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Suzybvmt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March. Clean, comfortable, well appointed rooms. very friendly staff, quiet location. close to metro line and about 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and a touch of indulgence”
Reviews.Author: steveboi
Reviews.Content: we stay for one night last summer and got a great deal from Michelle the receptionist very pleasant. On arrival we where upgraded to a top floor suite amazing view of the Eiffel tower and the bathrooms had Hermes soaps etc wonderful and the room was compact but that is paris but the comfort made up for the small space wonderful wonderful little hotel never stay anywhere else in paris!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillCrawford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ares Eiffel from 7th to 9th March 2012 while visiting Paris for my wife's 50th birthday. What we found was a fantastic hotel in a great location that was quiet but near everything you would want and the staff were first class. I have read the negative comments and can only say that these people need to get a life. It seems there is no pleasing some people and/or they are very difficult. The public areas and rooms were spotless and seemed to be cleaned throughout the day. The whole hotel is very well furnished and the attention to detail like slippers and Hermes toiletries add that finishing touch. We took a Classic room which is on the small side but I am assured this is typical of Paris hotels but for the two of us it was fine. How big does a room have to be to sleep in, relax in, wash and change? The minibar was also a great bonus. Only soft drinks and mineral water but only 5 Euro per day regardless of how much you use. The staff couldn't do enough for you and were very friendly even including the night porter when we came back from the Moulin Rouge at 1.30 am. They helped arrange taxis on the day of my wife's birthday and also confirming our airport return transfer too. We were sitting at a cafe having a drink and one of the staff stopped to speak to us when out for her lunch, now that is a great touch!! There are a number of lovely bars and bistros a short walk away. We particularly liked Le Pierrot on Ave De La Motte Picquet and Le Beujolais on Ave De Suffren. There are some very nice shops, going by my wife's interest, along Rue Du Commerce just past the Metro station. The Metro at Le Motte-Picquet Grenelle is a 5 min walk and takes you to Charles De Gaulle Etoile where you can connect to anywhere in Paris. The Metro system is first class and easy to master and navigate. Only tip is to remember which destination you are heading to so you can go to the right side of the track. All in all we had a wonderful time in Paris, our first, and we loved the Hotel Ares Eiffel. We would recommend it to anyone who is thinking of going and will definitely use it again when we return to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Ares Eiffel !”
Reviews.Author: Bostongirl001
Reviews.Content: This lovely Parisien boutique hotel was the perfect choice for my husband and myself. We picked it based on its high tripadvisor ratings and it deserves the great reviews it gets. We arrived 3 hours early and our room was ready so we were able to check in immediately. Our room, #64, was first class all the way and immaculately clean. The bedding was crisp and sumptuous, the towels in the bathroom were thick and plush and we loved the Versace tile and Hermes bath products. As others have stated the rooms are quite small, but so well designed, there's a place for everything. We also loved having french doors that opened out onto a little balcony. The staff at the front desk all speak english well and were always so pleasant and helpful with directions and maps, restaurant recommendations, etc. Housekeeping did a fantastic job and kept us well stocked with bath products. The location is quiet yet convenient. From the Charles de Gaulle airport, we took the RER-B train and transferred to the Metro line at the Denfert Rochereau station, then got out at La Motte-Picquet-Grenelle station which is a very short walk to the hotel. Being close to the Eiffel Tower was great for us. We boarded the double decker bus from the Tower as well as the evening cruise along the Seine. We walked back several nights to see it all lit up and twinkling on the hour - so romantic, and on our final day, took the elevators to the summit. All the other Paris attractions were easily reached from the 3 lines available at La Motte-Picquet-Grenelle Station. There are great restaurants with outdoor seating near the hotel. We enjoyed the "Suffren" and the "Primerose" and a wonderful patisserie across from the Metro where we purchased pastries for breakfast. In this area, you don't feel like you're in the middle of a "tourist trap". We felt like we were immersed in a welcoming Parisien community. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Frank W
Reviews.Content: I did spend three nights at Ares and I had a fabulous stay. The Hotel is conveniently located, the Eiffel Tower is walking distance and the metro (Lamotte - Piquet) is around the corner. My room was gorgeous, and the bathroom even better. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ending for our trip”
Reviews.Author: Steph S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of a two week trip in Europe. Our traveling party consisted of two adults and two 9 year old children. Our stay was WONDERFUL! We checked in early and the front desk person happily stored our luggage and we set off around the city. When we came back we were greeted by the owner who instantaneously waived the breakfast charge for our two children and helped us get our bags to the room. Ok people yes our room was "small" but it is Paris and the cost was SO reasonable for the four of us. They had the two pull out chairs all set up for the kids. We unpacked what we needed and they stored the rest of our luggage for us. The room was clean and extremely well appointed. One of the front desk people kindly recommended things for us to to and places to eat that were good and reasonably priced and kid friendly. If you want a BEAUTIFUL boutique hotel that is in a good location and reasonably priced go stay at the Ares. The only minor minor negative is that I think that the breakfast is a bit over priced for what you get. We would stay here again should we ever return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Impresses Again”
Reviews.Author: sidzy
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Ares. And I was as impressed again as expected. The hotel staff were excellent, the room was available early and clean. The location is by far the best asset of this hotel. Tucked away in a quiet street yet about a 2 min walk from the hustle bustle of Avenue de la Motte-Picquet. Close to restaurants, banks, small shops, cafes, and the metro station. It is in my opinion an excellent location and hotel to be in while in Paris. I couldn't recommend this hotel more. I will always be at the Ares while visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms well decorated, But Very Very small to move around”
Reviews.Author: ManishKayal
Reviews.Content: The rooms are of the size of a bathroom in other cities. Versace tiles, Bang & Olufsen, etc materials doesn't matter if the room size is super small. Location, is too far away from many attractions. Advise to seriously evaluate other hotels. It is expensive too. I paid Euro200 that too without breakfast. Must say that staff is good.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sergioscaglietti
Reviews.Content: This is an awful hotel. It is miles away from anywhere, stuck out in the middle of nowhere in the 15 th arrondissement, You will find it difficult and/ or expensive to get back here at the end of a night out in Paris. Paris is a walking city, but you will not enjoy walking back here. Breakfast is non existent, there is no minibar or bar in the hotel, we had booked interconnecting rooms for us and our children and we were allocated rooms on different floors. This meant that we had to split up as a couple and sleep in different rooms on separate floors in order to keep an eye on the kids.If we could give the Ares zero stars we would. This is not a hotel, it is a glorified bed and breakfast, and definitely not for families. We moved out on the first night and went to stay in the Murano in Bd du Temple, which is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST stay”
Reviews.Author: dfa73
Reviews.Content: First impressions of the hotel were very impressive. We arrived a few hours before we were due to check in and asked if we could leave our luggage. The lovely warm reception by the lady working was second to none, this was amplified by the fact they offered to check if the room was ready straight away and if so we were more than welcome to check straight in. It was which was excellent. I assume in busier months this wouldn't always be the case; but hey we wouldn't argue with that. The quality of the room was again outstanding, it was very clean, stylish, and well laid out. It was a normal paris-sized hotel room but extremely comfortable including the bed. There was a safe in the room for valuables and they were also very accommodating for extra towels and amenities (and also very prompt). We only stayed for one night, and as we arrived back to the hotel to get ready for dinner we asked for some ice to enjoy some champagne in our room; yet again they were very accommodating providing this and some glasses. They called taxis for us, looked after our luggage for the whole day we checked out and gave us a very warm goodbye. I work in the tourist industry and stay in a LOT of hotels. Service and all the usual amenities are extremely important to me (including free wifi). The service, friendliness and warmness of every staff member was simply outstanding. They made us feel very welcome. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. It is close to the Eiffel tower and has good amenities in the surrounding area. First rate and first class. Thank you for looking after us so well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, near metro, away from attractions”
Reviews.Author: iro
Reviews.Content: We are a couple just returned from our stay there. I will try to conclude the positives versus the negatives. (+) Very clean rooms, very well decorated, near at the metro station, designed appliances in the room, Quiet road (-) very small rooms, away from the main touristc area (apart from tour Eiffel), for 16 euro per day for breakfast we would expect more variety.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice I must say, top location”
Reviews.Author: Luigimancs
Reviews.Content: Very well appointed rooms. They have all that one can expect from a good 4 star. The staff spoke excellent English, and were happy to recommend local bistros at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Appointed”
Reviews.Author: HPHAS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and well-appointed on a quiet side street that is 2 blocks from the metro. I was there with my teen daughter and her 3 friends for one night. We were greetly warmly at check-in and offered the wifi password. The lobby is nice in that it has two separate rooms with comfortable seating. There is also a computer in the lobby with free web access. The rooms are small but well appointed, clean, and the beds are very comfortable (the pull-out bed in the executive king room was a bit lumpy but not miserable). My room was a corner room that had two large windows and also a large window in the bathroom. If you are a light sleeper, however, I'd request a room on a higher floor as I could hear voices from folks talking on the street. The rooms have free wifi, a safe and minibar. The bathrooms are quite nice. The downside of the hotel is the location. We typically stay in the 6th arrondissement which is close to many sights. While this hotel is very close to the Eiffel Tower (which was nice for the girls as they walked over there to enjoy the Tower lit up at night), it's a hike to other sights. However, we simply hopped the metro to our first destination then worked our way back; when finished for the day, we hopped the metro the last few stops back to the hotel. The hotel is a bit pricey, but not out of line with the amenities. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, since it was not included with the room. We found a nice cafe around the corner that provided a great start to our day. When choosing a hotel for our next stay in Paris, I would keep this one on the list of possibilities.

Reviews.Title: “FCC = Fabulous Clean Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HyTheTg
Reviews.Content: Bonjour! Arrived at the hotel on 02 Feb 2012. Travelled half the globe to reach Paris, almost past midnight. My wife and me were totally exhausted. The male manager i supposed on the night shift that day, didnt got his exact name. Gave us a quick check in without much delay. Here the Score Board: 1) Service: Excellent. Why i said that? Because every morning i would request for 2 pots of hot water due to the cold snap period while we were in europe. The lady attendant would brought up for us, I think during the second morning upon our stay, she took the initiative to give us a kettle. Ya the negative pt was no tea/coffee making facility in the room itself. But, we were fine as a kettle was provided for us. Isabelle & Co. were friendly and approachable. They speaks great english too and were always smiling with the guests. During the day i left, they still joked with me to "send" them the weather from my origin country Singapore (A tropical island all yr round). 2) Value: The price was abit steep for us but it was still worth it for a short stay. 3) Sleep Quality: Booked the room (no 63) on the high floor located at the rear. Wonderful choice for light sleeper. Bed and pillows were very extremely comfortable. 4) Cleaniness: Absolutely sparkling clean. 5) Location: 10mins walk to Metro La Motte Picquet station. 20 - 25mins walk to Effiel tower. Restaurants/ cafes, supermarket are just nearby. 6) Room: Negative in terms of room size, wardrobe and table space as they are really small. But hey what do expect from a hotel in city centre Paris? Likes the rain shower head, compliementary Free Wifi and the balcony. The toliet door lock mechanism seem to be a little faulty though. Couldnt comment on the breakfast as we didnt had it. Overall. Its a fantastic choice for a boutique hotel in city centre Paris. I would be back here again for sure. Thanks for the good service provided. Merci... =) Regard Mr Ng (Singapore)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kguerra
Reviews.Content: I realize that my title says "Good Hotel". And it is. And I realize that I rated it 3 stars (average), which it is as well. I have traveled quite extensively and it might be that the more I travel, the more I expect from the hotels I pick, especially at $250 USD per night. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: Nice decor Wireless in the room and the computer in the lounge were great The heater worked beautifully (we were there February 6-12, which was freezing!) The staff is friendly and try to help Close to the metro comfy pillows Cons: No breakfast included in the rate (we were offered the breakfast one day because our room was not attended to. The pastries and coffee were good). The hairdryer is very weak and is attached to the closet (we stayed in the Classic Room). It is very akward to blow out your hair while standing in the corner of the tiny room. The minibar was never explained to us upon check in. There is no price list. We never took anything but upon checkout we were charged for 3 days worth of items (I now know that it was 3 days worth of minibar items as I just read another review stating that it was a great deal to be able to take anything from the minifridge for only 5 euros a day). We would buy our own wine or water and take it back to the room and the housekeeping staff would throw away our items even if we were not done. That was annoying. I emailed the hotel one month before we arrived stating that we were staying there to celebrate our 7 year anniversary. Throughout our stay, it was never mentioned or acknowledged in anyway. Although it is close to the metro, the location is not that great. The neighborhood is not very lively. I guess I just expected a bit more. I know my cons are not catastrophic or vacation ruining (which they were not!) but all added up just made the experience at the hotel average.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very well appointed”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaToTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Spent one night year as part of a short stopover in Paris. It is in a really excellent location in a quiet area (Swiss district) and yet a very short walk to the metro and the hustle and bustle of the Eiffel Tower. There are some good restaurants, cafes and bistros in the area as you are far enough away from the Tower to get away from the pure tourist trap ones. Hotel itself has done an excellent job of furnishing and appointing the rooms in a modern but classy style. While everything is typically small it is all very well put together. We picked one of the larger rooms to accomodate a family of four with two chairs that converted into twin beds. It was tight but very nice. Impressed with the facilities - Bang & Olfusen TV and Hermes products in the bathroom. Last time I had Hermes products in a hotel was at Burj al Arab in Dubai! Downstairs was nice too with a nice lounge area with new Apple iMacs for browsing the web. Breakfast was nice if simple in a small but comfortable dining area. Also really worth noting that staff were very friendly and helpful. No need to even say who we were when we arrived they knew from the fact we were family with kids who we were. Really nice touch and made you realize they were making an effort. My one complaint is pricing and hence 4 not 5 stars. One night was over $500. Yes it is Paris and yes it was in height of summer but still this is very expensive and we can do far better in NY, London, Tokyo etc so not sure why Parisians think they can get away with such high prices. However in relative terms I think it would be hard to find much to beat this at this price point in this city.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ares”
Reviews.Author: nwlondon88
Reviews.Content: A great Boutique Hotel in close proximity to La Tour Eiffel. We stayed at a Junior Suite which allowed a direct few on the Eiffel Tower from the 7th Floor. The room was very nice and so was the bathroom. Breakfast was a bargain and we also liked the fact that the mini bar was topped up daily for only 5 Euros. Wifi was free.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed. Great location”
Reviews.Author: LizBx
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel in my favourite city. Fairly small but rooms very comfortable and location wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: mm_chicago21
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel off the beaten path yet still a 5 minute wall to the Eiffel tower. We only stayed here one night while passing through Paris and it was well worth it. This is for the most part a boutique hotel without a restaurant or pool but who would eat at their hotel while in Paris! Overall I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: j_flinn23
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent three days in Paris staying at Ares Eiffel. I had spent much time trolling through various websites and scouring tripadvisor trying to find the perfect place to stay for a short romantic getaway. When I came across Ares Eiffel I knew this was right for us and booked it straight away. When travelled from the airport via metro to the hotel and found it very easy to find (even with both of our poor navigational skills). The hotel is tucked away in a quiet corner away but is just around the corner from a wonderful selection of restaurants, cafes and patisseries and just 10 minutes around the corner from the Eiffel Tower. We were very impressed with our room and the large double doors opening to the small juliette balcony made the room feel much lighter and very airy. The icing on the cake were the lovely Hermes toiletries. Everytime I use the soap it reminds me of our lovely break to Paris and this wonderful little hotel that made the trip for us!

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: holidayhearts91
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, beautiful hotel in a wonderful location... A boutique hotel in all senses - small but beautifully decorated rooms, stunning bathroom, excellent facilities (including free wifi, free internet on the TV and a mini bar which only costs 5 euros a day for absolutely everything in it) lovely little touches (including chocolates on the pillows and fresh linen and towels everyday even though we were only there 2 nights) incredibly friendly and helpful staff and a great location for exploring a beautiful city. The most romantic hotel I have ever stayed in, small but perfectly formed :)

Reviews.Title: “Precious gem”
Reviews.Author: Oliver R
Reviews.Content: The Ares is a wonderful hotel in a nice and quiet area. The metro is around the corner and the Eiffel tower is walking distance. We enjoyed the room (mostly the bathroom), extremely clean and beautifully decorated. The staff helped us out in many ways, including reservations and tours planning. If you plan to stay in Paris, this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, shame about breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other Tripadvisor reviews. All were true. This is a stunning hotel. The reception is stunning. The female receptionist was extremely friendly, polite and helpful. She assisted us greatly with our plans as we were only there for 2 days. She booked our restaurant table for us in the afternoon, booked the taxi to get us there, and then called the restaurant to let them know we were running late. The room was large for Parisian standards and was finished to the highest level. We had the room with the massive purple velvet headboard. We had a sitting area, balcony, Bang & Olufsen tv (although annoyingly the British channels weren't working- luckily we weren't there for the tv and only used it when chilling before heading out for our evening meal at Mariettes Restaurant- highly recommended!!!). The bathroom was absolutely stunning!! With Versace wall tiles and Hermes toiletries! My wife loved the rain shower, which I have to admit after a long day travelling around Paris was great! The seating area opposite reception was also stunning. Very modern in parts yet with that classic French/Parisian feel that you would hope for. Even the stairwells and corridors are dramatic and stylish. The only thing that let the hotel down was the breakfast room. It felt like a kitchen/eating room you would see at a hostel. This, and the fact that the buffet breakfast was 16 euro each put us off from eating there. Instead we had breakfast at a little french cafe just round the corner which was fantastic and felt 'proper French'!

Reviews.Title: “Paris gem”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend that had visited in the summer. I visit Paris often but decided to stay in a different location and try this hotel. It was located very close to the metro station making it easy to get around the city. There are great bakeries and a grocery store located near by as well. The Grenelle market is just under the metro on Sundays and was an absolute delight to visit! Its a must!! The hotel was wonderful from start to finish. Easy check in and the staff was fabulous making sure I always had directions to where I was going. There was free wifi in the hotel and it was fast and easy to use. Delicious chocolates on the bed and Hermes soaps were a plus! The location is right by the eiffel tower so you can see it sparkle at night. I would recommend this hotel! Enjoy Paris!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely staff, and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here towards the end of Jan for the weekend, and had an absolutely great time. The hotel has been designed and furnished as a typical french 'Parisian' boutique hotel. Very romantic. The rooms are not huge, as you would expect in a bustling city, but more than big enough for its purpose. So much attention has been paid to every little detail, including leaving luxury chocolate on your bed, and extra helpful and friendly staff. We loved everything about this hotel, and will certainly be coming back! Located in a side street just off a popular main street, about 500m from the tube. Easy to get to the Gare du Nord (eurostar terminal).

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ArmyWife1999
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location. My husband & I took our 9-year-old son for his first visit to Paris, and this hotel made our visit over-the-top perfect. Not only the location, which is quiet and yet so close to the Eiffel Tower as well as a block from the Metro, bistros, grocery stores, and a divine boulangerie, but the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff as well. Everything we needed, they provided with a smile. The owner of the hotel introduced himself and his daughter to us, and asked if we liked the hotel and if everything was okay. How nice is that?! The rooms are a bit small, but the king-size bed in our executive room was so comfortable and the bathroom was huge and beautiful (and that shower head! Divine.) The chair turned into a single bed for our son and was already made up when we checked in. A very nice touch was the thermostat in our room - we made the room warm when we got back in the evenings (low 30's Fahrenheit in January!), and later made the room cooler for sleeping. The breakfast buffet was ample and delicious. We could not have asked for a better place to stay in Paris, and we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel, spotlessly clean, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn D
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous friendly boutique hotel in a quiet part of Paris. 15 minutes taxi ride (€13 from Gare du Nord and €23 on the return). Two minutes walk from Ave. de la Motte Picquet with a wonderful variety of brasseries and restaurants and ten minutes walk from The Eiffel Tower. Also walkable to L'Arc de Triomphe, and although this takes a while you have the option to walk the Champs Elysees. The hotel was spotless, quirkily decorated and the staff were warm and friendly. Will absolutely stay there again the next time I visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Digiov87
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a nice and quiet area, 200 meters from La Motte-Picquet metro station and walking distance (5 minutes) from The Eiffel Tower. The rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated with a lot of attention to every detail. Excellent sleep quality, very important to everybody traveling on business . A+

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheViking45
Reviews.Content: I decided to celebrate the new year in Paris with my wife and made a reservation at Ares after carefully reviewing all the good comment on TA. I have to say that everything worked out perfectly. The Hotel is located in a quiet and nice area, walking distance to the metro and bus stations. The rooms are clean and beautiful and the great staff adds a nice complement to the whole picture. Our New year's eve in Paris was fantastic and the Ares gave his contribution.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: accima
Reviews.Content: A trip to Paris is always a dream come true, staying at Ares made the dream even better. The Hotel is perfectly located, minutes away from the Eiffel Tower and public transportation. Our room was clean and beautiful and the assistance we got from the staff super. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not so nice owner”
Reviews.Author: zaveeni
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through expedia as I wanted to stay in a different part of Paris. I made sure the expedia representative checked with the hotel that two adults and two children will be accommodated in the room. So while I was on the phone , he checked with the hotel and confirmed this. I also had an e-mail confirmation. However, when I arrived with my family after a 14 hour flight was absolutely denied a room even though I know the hotel had rooms with extra beds that usually had family members. the owner absolutely refused to honor this and insisted that we get two rooms which was over $300 a night and we had booked 4 nights. This was a nightmare. he kept insisting that we were trying to be dishonest and I kept stating that we were not that stupid to get a room for two and have 4 of us in the room. We are a family that has travelled extensively. After two horrible hours of arguing, expedia paid for the extra room and I had to spend the rest of the evening frantically looking for a room in another hotel. Fortunately my usual stand by Hotel D'Orsay gave us a lovely suite for a reasonable price during the middle of the summer. So we moved the next day with a horrible feeling. yes, the rooms were small but cozy. The location is good but not central to other places. Yet, I would have preferred a compassionate and kinder owner/manager. The irony was he stated that he know there will be an issue and was waiting for us. I wish they had e-mailed me as I had made the reservation many months ago. Also I feel at the time of reservation there was such a room available and was given away. Perhaps there was a hope that after a long journey we would be too exhausted to fight it and would pay the extra money for an additional room. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone with children. Furthermore, there was a roof top disco party in the opposite building with pounding music that went on all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Faciltiy”
Reviews.Author: Ani22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last year when we travelled to Europe. Its in a great location close to the Eiffel Tower and also to a lot of the other eating joints in Paris. The rooms are very clean and classy. If you visit Paris definitely give this Hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Clean, courteous staff,5-7 minute walk from metro”
Reviews.Author: amritrvlr
Reviews.Content: ******************We spent 2 days and 2 nights in this wonderful hotel. The staff was very welcoming and polite. While lodging we received free internet, and top notch assistance. I needed a dress for New Years eve..asked the receptionist and she pointed me in the right direction...both affordable..and just maybe 7-10 minute walk to the shops. Like the other viewers if you cant handle being out of the states there the Golden Arches (Mcdonalds) is 5-7 minute walk, also Starbucks is maybe 2 minutes less walk, although there are some great Bakeries near by. The Eiffel Tower stop from the Metro is either two or 3 stops..which ever you prefer to get off. I will definitely refer friends and family to this hotel. I must say that I look for cleanliness..and this place is immaculate. The shower pressure is wonderful....Please refer to hotel pics at http://www.ares-paris-hotel.com/, the pictures that are shown on the website are actual pictures on how the property looks as of today January 1, 2012. Many Thanks to the Staff!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Rglotz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 days for business then 4 days for vacation. The hotel was perfect for both. Wifi is free in your room and is very reliable, even for skype, etc. The room was extremely clean, even to my wife's exacting standards, and very well appointed. The staff was extremely helpful. They would help with anything we asked - from researching local stores to buying concert tickets, and tracking down lost umbrellas at a restaurant. We were very overwhelmed with all of the hotel options in Paris. After touring the city, we couldn't have picked a better location. You can see the Eiffel tower by walking just a few steps from the hotel, there are plenty of great restaurants, cafes, markets, retail shopping, and a grocery store. It felt very much like a neighborhood, and not touristy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Terebv
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this lovely hotel just blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are so nice and cozy,. really good beds. The hotel is beautifuly decorated. Staff is great. We were traveling with a 5 month old baby, they had a lovely crib waiting in our room, which baby loved. Really nice neigborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: IRockOut
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quick to respond to my e-mail before arriving. Room was clean, faint smell of vinegar, a bit noisy, but a perfect location for Parid. Walking distance to Eiffel Tower. Walking distance to many recommended places to eat. For those who can't handle being away from the states even McDonald's and Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer32253
Reviews.Content: This was a marvelous find! We highly recommend this hotel. Located in a quiet residential neighborhood; walk to various restaurants, several major metro lines, and minutes from the Eiffel Tower! The front staff (a female, I forget her name, sorry) was very courteous and helped arrange for a private car for a special dinner (where I proposed!). The room was quaint (smaller), but with high-end fixtures, television and exceptional bathroom with Versace tile, nice tub and other good amenities. It is a small, friendly, upscale boutique-like hotel (and therefore without several features of a large and more expensive property). We stayed here four nights, then a larger hotel (in a livelier part of the city) four more - they were both exceptional in their own right. If you have a week or so, we recommend this hotel and seeing another part of the city as well (too much to see!!!). A WONDERFUL STAY. THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get much better than this”
Reviews.Author: HTK058
Reviews.Content: Excellent small boutique hotel which manages to avoid being too trendy or pretentious. Steers clear of the grovelling found in the bigger boutique hotels. Genuinely warm, very friendly and helpful. Great service from all the staff (day and night) Very clean in all parts of the hotel. Really quiet. Great breakfast. Just a peaceful haven away from the bustle of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Alexander A
Reviews.Content: Located in a quit and nice area, the Ares turned out to be a great choice. We booked the room on the internet and were very pleased to see that the all the positive reviews on TA were confirmed. The Eiffel tower and Champ de Mars are walking distance (5 minutes), so is the metro. The staff was great, warm and friendly and the room really good looking. A+

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: BBandBM
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay in Paris with the perfect person! We arrived by Metro where hotel is situated a 2 minute walk down the quiet side streets.. First view of the hotel was stunning all though very small this hotel is very personalized, it is very modern with lovely art deco! we arrived early lunch to be greeted by two very friendly receptionists. We were shown to our room and again the room was superb! very boutique with dark floors and furniture with velvet curtains and bed throw.. even the huge head board was detailed in velvet! amongst this we noticed the tiles in the bathroom were Versace! The staff were very helpful and friendly and recommended some restaurants, one we ate at, which was delicious. if you walk a couple of metres from the hotel you can actually see the Eiffel Tower. The tower is only a 10minute walk - the location of the hotel is brilliant lots shops, cafe/restaurants and very close to the Metro which we used to get around and site see.. The hotel was a surprise by my partner so I didn’t know what to expect, but I can honestly say he picked the best! I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I thank the hotel for making it a comfortable and homely stay but most of all I thank my partner for an incredible weekend – the best yet!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donny H
Reviews.Content: It was located 7-10 mins walk to Champ de Mars and Eiffel. Of course then walking distance to Trocadero, Seine, Invalides if you walk further. We reached the Hotel by Metro from Louvre and very easy to locate. It was a quiet area and the reception was very warm. They have warm living room as well, as seen on their website. Bathroom was very clean while you can find Hermes toiletries. Price-wise a bit overpriced. Overall: RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neil_O_49
Reviews.Content: I did spend a week in Paris with my girlfriend and the Ares was the cherry on top of the pie. The room was gorgeous and clean (we loved the bathroom with Versace tiles and Hermes toiletry) The staff is great (really helpful) and the location is excellent, minutes away from Champ the Mars and public transportation. No more to say, just try it, you won't get disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shirahi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon and our first time in Paris. The hotel is extremely clean, beautifully decorated and the staff is SOO kind, welcoming and helpful. I think we got the smallest room available, it was pretty small but it was still really cozy and the showers were amazing with Hermes toiletries!!! The only thing about this hotel that was a little inconvenient was the location. It was close to the Eiffel tower but it wasn't very close to the other main attractions in Paris, however I believe this to be the reason why you can get a really good price here!... (places closer to the other attractions are MUCH more expensive for this quality hotel). Overall I DEFINITELY recommend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Could Have Ruined Our Paris Trip: Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: MJN905
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here - - or rather, didn't stay here, depending on your interpretation - - during a 12-day trip through Europe in October of 2011. We landed in Paris for one night before setting out for England and Germany, and for that initial night, used the Renaissance Place Vendome, which was outstanding. Based on reviews here, and the relatively low cost, we decided to stay at the Ares for three nights on our return to Paris to close out the trip. We just narrowly averted disaster. First off, if you do decide to stay at this place for some reason, be sure to get detailed routing info to the hotel from the hotel via e-mail. We didn't, and the cab driver took 10-15 minutes of trial and error and mapreading to find the very small side street upon which the hotel sits. Check-in was fine, about what I expected for a boutique hotel in Paris, where I've traveled before. The staffer at the reception desk was polite, but certainly not overly welcoming or warm. There was no offer of assistance with luggage, which, again, is to be expected for this sort of property. The elevator is absolutely tiny and not for the claustrophobic. The room cleanliness and overall appearance was exactly what I expected based on the TripAdvisor reviews; very pretty linens and drapery, huge bathroom with a window, plenty of space if you understand the general size of Paris hotel rooms. (Some reviews here say the rooms are small - - they aren't, not for Paris anyway.) Immediately, however, we noticed the distinct musty odor of cigarette smoke, which was disappointing for a nonsmoking room. I figured that the A/C would take care of it, and went to activate it, but found that I couldn't. I went downstairs to ask the staffer at the front desk what was wrong, and she told me (not rudely, but not very apologetically either) that since it was "so cold" outside, she had disabled the A/C for the entire hotel. This meant that there was no circulated air of any kind inside the room; no heat, no A/C, no central fan blowing uncooled air from the vents. As we continued our discussion in French, she told me that "in winter, there is no air conditioning." I'll grant her that it wasn't 80 or 90 degrees F outside (it was about 60-65 during the day and maybe 50 or a touch lower at night during our visit), but October isn't winter, and there's a difference between "no air conditioning" and "no central air." Both my wife and I have mild allergies and we need some sort of air circulating - - particularly if there's a lingering air of cigarette smoke from a recent guest. The staffer's solutions were to tell me to open the windows and to offer me an ancient-looking fan to carry back up to the room. The window solution was out of the question, as the Ares has large windows with no screens, and we weren't trying to deal with insects and perhaps even a bird in our room. The portable fan, of course, was unacceptable. I told her that this probably wouldn't work and that I would be back down soon to let her know. She said that was fine. I returned to my room, and my wife and I thankfully located a room at the Renaissance Arc de Triomphe (which was far more expensive but wonderful) for the remainder of our stay. We left, having sat in two of the chairs and logged on to the high-speed Internet. We were at the property for just over an hour. Sadly, but unsurprisingly, the front desk staffer was totally rigid and unwilling to waive the night's charges. She told me archly that I should have e-mailed the hotel in advance, and she would have readily told me all about the coerced deactivation of the air conditioning. I told her that wasn't my obligation, and since the hotel claims on its website that it offers air conditioned rooms, the hotel needs to live up to that promise. I simply didn't understand why any guests who didn't want A/C couldn't turn it off in their rooms, leaving any of us who did want to have some air moving around with that option. No dice! (I suspect the A/C might have been broken, but if so, she certainly wasn't telling.) In any event, although she had not taken my credit card upon check-in, I certainly didn't want to break any laws, so I handed it over and she happily charged us for the full night's stay - - about 350 Euros. She offered no apology and (even though we had seven bags) did not volunteer to call us a taxi. We walked to one of the nearby major streets, got a taxi, and went over to the Renaissance, thankfully enjoying it thoroughly regardless of the far greater cost. I followed up directly with the hotel by e-mail after returning home a few days later; they didn't even bother to answer me. No refund or reduction in the price was made, and the full charge appeared on my credit card statement as I expected. I realize that a lot of TripAdvisor registrants wouldn't care about this sort of situation, and a lot of people wouldn't want anything to do with air conditioning in Paris in October. Completely understood. However, the point of this review is not really in the details but in the big picture - - the Ares is fully prepared to mislead you about at least one of their claimed amenities (two, if you count the "no smoking" room that wasn't), and if you complain, they won't do a darn thing about it, and in fact will blithely ignore your request for a refund or price reduction later. So, if you're prepared to take that risk, the hotel is well-maintained and in a nice, well-located neighborhood once you find it - - just hope that you don't have any complaints! And, of course, if you like to have air circulating in your room during a "transition" month like October, April, or May - - forget it. Naturally, I will never stay at this place again. In fact, this experience has sadly soured me on all Paris boutique hotels. I'll be sticking with full-service establishments going forward. With the Ares, you definitely get what you pay for - - or in our case, you pay for it even if you don't get it. Lowest possible recommendation. Everything a hotel should not be.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel. Quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: anchor228
Reviews.Content: The room was great with three beautiful balcony windows and large bathroom. The metro is so close and allows you to get around central paris in minutes. This makes the location excellent. One metro stop takes you to a range of nice eating places. The hotel is around the corner from a really well equipped gym with complimentary entry for hotel guests and there is also a good thai massage place very close by. The staff were really friendly and helpful and went out of their way to ensure they could answer questions accurately. This aspect of the service was a stand out feature of the hotel. Very prompt and reliable with ordering taxis. Would have appreciated a nespresso machine in the room, as there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, well situated”
Reviews.Author: 55AMY
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable; not luxurious. No problems with noise. Staff were friendly; did not always have best recommendations for dining. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_S012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ares for a romantic weekend, chosen for it's location, we got a pretty good deal on the price too seen the quality of the rooms. The location is optimal, few steps away from Champ de Mars, the area is full of small restaurants and cafés, even the walk downtown is not too long, there is however, a very handy underground stop 50 meters from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and assisted us when we needed anything. The room had an excellent quality to it, very comfortable bed, everything was branded. The only cons were that the rooms were a bit cramped and the tini corridors were impossible to go around carring around a suitcase. Breakfast was not included, wich was a bit weird, however the nice cafés all around were very good options. Overall a good hotel, will be happy to visit again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint boutique hotel. Central yet quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Tique222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and were very satisfied with the room and the service (although we didn't take advantage of all things). It is very central yet located on a side street so it is very quiet. The hotel staff was very friendly and attentive yet they steered us to some really touristy places for dinner (we took their first suggestion, yet shunned all others which were located suspiciously near the hotel). Reasonably priced - fair value for the money. We might stay here again if we go back to Paris, although there are other comparably priced boutique hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice for a romantic break”
Reviews.Author: cheeseontoast21
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Hotel Ares Eiffel with my partner for a three night stay. The purpose of our (very first) trip to Paris was for our birthdays and also our anniversary, and so I emailed the hotel prior to our stay to request a balcony room as a surprise for my partner. Not only was their reply swift and friendly, but the staff at Hotel Ares Eiffel went above and beyond for us: our balcony also had the view of the very top of the Eiffel Tower! Upon arrival at the hotel we were overwelmed. The exterior is very classic and Parisian and is obviously very well looked after. My partner and I only speak a few words of French (basic GCSE standard really!) but the staff were always helpful and gushed to assist us in any way. Our room (a "standard" room) exceeded our expectations and, although small (although I'm told most Parisian hotel rooms are) it was luxurious and well-equipped. The bathroom was beautiful (Versace tiles!! Hermes toiletries!!) with a massive double shower, the bed extremely comfy and the extensive TV channels and wifi access were a great extra. However, our view really was amazing and was the icing on the cake... I cannot comment on the food at the hotel as we did not eat there, simply because the location of the hotel was so close to many beautiful pattisseries and fine-dining cuisine, aswel as small supermarkets for any extras you may need. It is also very close to the metro, which is handy, and ofcourse within walking distance of the beautiful tower. Thank you so much to the staff at Hotel Ares Eiffel. You were so welcoming and helped us have such an unforgettable trip and we are itching to visit you again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Best little hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Jesse H
Reviews.Content: As a world business, and pleasure travelers we are used to staying at 4 and 5 star hotels (four Seasons, St. regis etc...) For this business trip I brought my wife and 9 month old son. Being this was the second time in a month we have been in Paris (the first time we stayed on the The Avenue des Champs-Élysées, at a 5 star) so this time I wanted to stay more off the main area and instead stay in a area that offered great places to eat, shopping and no crowds! Looking on Tripadvisor I found a hotel that though it was rated 13th best in Paris, the price was only 250 euros per night on a 4 day stay including a weekend. All of the other top 20 were all over 500 euros! In reading the reviews of the hotel I was surprised at the glowing recommendations from the guests who stayed at the hotel. So I decided to book a room via email. Also being we have a child I called and the manager answered the phone right away and said that no worries a crib would be in our room when we arrived. Once we arrived at the rhotel, the front desk staff treated us like their favorite family members who they have not seen in 5 years. It was one of the warmest receptions we have ever gotten from a hotel staff! The room was clean, moden and very comfortable, BUT LET ME TELL YOU THE BATHROOM, AND THE SHOWER WERE AMAZING! The shower was wonderful! It is a rain shower that pours hot water for as long as you want, and it was the best shower I have ever taken in 52 years! The breakfast at the hotel was perfect, with all the goodies you would expect in a french hotel! The local neighborhood is wonderful, with perfect little restaurants, cafes, markets, fresh fruit, flowers, wonderful shopping ( my wife bought a pair of all leather boots for 90 Euros!!!!!!) Also the subway is 200 meters away, and the Eiffel tower is 10 mins walk! All in all we LOVED this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ottawatraveller1
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to sing its praises because I don't want to find it overrun next time I try to stay here. what a great hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay for family”
Reviews.Author: Kylie T
Reviews.Content: My husband 2 children aged 8 and 12 stayed here for 2 nights after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. It lived up to expectation and was a wonderful stay. The room was great for the 4 of us for a short stay with each child having their own single sofa bed and us a queen size. It was also decorated in a very stylish way. The bathroom was a little small, but was also very nicely styled and clean and had everything you needed. The restaurant in the hotel also did a fabulous breakfast for us to fill up on for a busy day ahead. Location was very convenient to the Eiffel Tower which was about a 6 to 7 minute walk. I would highly recommend this hotel, the owners were warm, friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “elegant small hotel near eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: aquadotto
Reviews.Content: After phoning 30 other hotels, and thanks to a cancellation, we got a room late on a Saturday night and were very happy we did. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the room a good size (for Paris), quiet and clean. Nice big Apple computer for internet in the lounge/lobby. Having stayed in a number of hotels in Paris over the years, Ares Eiffel is definitely a cut above. We'll stay here next time (if we can get a room). The tower is of course a major tourist draw, but the neighbourhood is otherwise largely residential which was a bit of a (not unwelcome) change for us. Not as many restaurants as some other areas, but being Paris there were still good ones to be found. Can recommend Le Petit Cler on the Rue Cler (the other side of the Champ de Mars). Wouldn't necessarily hurry back to le Pere Claude, but may have ordered badly. For breakfast, lunch, or just chilling, Le Primerose on Ave. Motte Piquet was great, and seemed to be favoured by locals.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tinapaulina
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend, got the nicest room with three french balconys ;) Quality hotel with perfect location from turistic point of view. Quiet surroundings and everything you need within a short walking distance, incl Starbucks :) Room was nicely decorated, bathroom both elegant and practical, both very clean and well maintained. We'll go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “QUALITY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MEGANIsleofWight
Reviews.Content: Well situated a stones throw from Champs de Mars this is a first class hotel.The deluxe room whilst tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean proved to be far too cramped for four persons.The mini-bar contained only soft drinks.The breakfast provided fresh fruit juce and fresh bread rolls and a limited choice of hot food.As on our previous visit the receptionists were knowledgeable,helpful and spoke immaculate English.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ally H
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 5days in april 2011. We upgraded our room before arrival, which I can recommend. The hotel was beautifully decorated with gorgeous fabric wall coverings. The tv was also magnificent. Complimentary bubbly was also much appreciated. The hotel is in a quiet location with a few restaurants a short walk away. The eiffel tower is only a 15min walk. Staff and maids were very friendly and the mini bar in room is also very reasonable. We had a lovely stay and would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel - glad I stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: celinabees
Reviews.Content: My hubby arranged a surprise trip to Paris, and he picked out this place based on the Trip Advisor reviews. He knows I have exacting standards, so he did really well - I was very pleased. The place was lovely from start to finish. Our room was small but so are any big city hotel rooms, so don't feel put off by that - your only there to put your head down! The bathroom and all the decor is beautiful and tasteful - just what you expect from a boutique hotel. I have no complaints - it was clean and tidy, and quiet, warm enough. Would defo stay again. One member of staff appears to be a little unfriendly (Micheal maybe was his name). Not sure why, but he could do with smiling a bit more too! Ive worked as a receptionist for 7 years now - and it is important to always project a positive impression! The owner had a chat with us on check-out to make sure we were happy - we told him what a great place he had and that I would reflect that in this review. I recommend this place for sure. Close to everything, including a starbucks which was good for grabbing a take out hot drink and keeping you warm on the walk to the Eiffel tower!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Savken
Reviews.Content: Found this Hotel on the web rated as a 4 star and wasn't disappointed - very well appointed and comfortable hotel with pleasant & helpful staff. Clearly 4 star as a minimum. The location is ideal as only 10min walk to Eiffel Tower and the "hop on/hop off" Tour Bus stop, so each day can be started and finished with an easy stroll to/from the Hotel. Also has a number of good restaurants, taverns and cafes within a couple of blocks. On departure the Owner made a point of meeting with us to get direct feedback of our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and child friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: TBPXE
Reviews.Content: At the end of our summer holiday we had one night in Paris and so I dedcided to splash out and book somewhere more sophisticated. I found a great deal on a website for this hotel and went ahead and booked. The stay was wonderful! We arrived early and even though our room wasn't ready they stored our bags and showed us where we could park our car for free! The staff were friendly and very polite - everyone was really welcoming even to our baby who was 11 months old - I was worried that it wasn't really an appropriate hotel for a baby but they could not have been nicer - he was treated to a beautiful wooden cot with a proper matress & gorgeous embroidered linen. We did not try their breakfast so I can't comment on it. I feel that this hotel is more about the experience that you have - you need to want to stay somewhere luxurious to feel that you are getting value for money - which was exactally what we were after and it was exactally what we received. One day, when we return to Paris, this will be the place that we book!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: luv2holiday81
Reviews.Content: We loved this little boutique hotel. The staff where friendly and let us check in earlier than the official time, and were able to store our luggage the next day. The hotel is in a great location, you can walk to the Eiffel tower and the metro, grocery shop, bakery and caves are only 1 block away.. The rooms are Parisian style and very charming - would definitely stay here again if we're in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: I was in one of their junior suites for a couple of nights with an Eiffel Tower view. After arriving from a long haul flight quite early in the morning, the owner gave me a choice of immediate check-in into the smaller suite or waiting for the larger one to be ready. As it states on their website, these are not terribly large suites in any case, but I found the room to be of adequate size but nicely appointed in a modern style with a sitting area. The location is residential so most of the surrounding shops service locals rather than tourists which is always a good thing in Paris. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and polite. I didn't go for the hotel breakfast since there were other options in the neighbourhood. Not cheap but Paris is an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but excellent staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Ganuskey06
Reviews.Content: The Ares Eiffel is a nice hotel, but I don't think it's spectacular. The superior room we stayed in had just barely enough room to move around the bed and get to the door and bathroom. This is isn't completely surprising considering most hotel rooms in Paris are small and the price paid was reasonable for Paris, but the tight fit got old after a couple of days. We also heard a lot of noise from other rooms in the hotel very clearly. The bed was also a bit hard for our tastes. If you are a light sleeper, this may not be the place for you. The positives of the hotel are that the staff are really good. They are friendly and knowledgeable and happy to help. We also appreciated the location, which is out of the touristy fray, but also close enough to the highlights of Paris that it's not a hassle to go back to the hotel in the middle of the day to rest. The neighborhood had some good bakeries and restaurants so that you don't have to venture far for food if you want. There is also a Sunday market under the metro line, which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “True Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: mikeysdada
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Hotel Ares Eiffel. We enjoyed the hotel and the neighborhood so much we returned again this year. When making the reservation, we requested the same room as last year. The marvelous staff did their best, and after one night, we were able to switch to our preferred room. THANK YOU!!! We love the overall interior of the rooms, the Versace tile in the updated and very clean bathrooms is a nice touch. Housekeeping could have been better in vacuuming the floors, otherwise, the room was immaculate. Rooms are quiet, bed comfortable, and the access to everywhere, including the airport, is easy. The Eiffel tower is a short stroll away, the Metro is about 1 block away. You can get to everything else using this mass transit system. The neighborhood offers lots of cafes, bakeries, bistros, and shops, and it is a true Parisian experience, with children going to school, locals shopping, etc. The owners and staff of the Ares Eiffel are professional yet friendly, helpful and just overall nice people who look out for their guests. We'll be staying at the Ares Eiffel for a third time next year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: M29G
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general, was very nicely decorated. The room was small, but really cozy. It is also located very close to a Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Violeta N
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous rooms, friendly staff and within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Enjoyed our stay thoroughly!! I would highly recommend it, it was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: criscemonto
Reviews.Content: The Ares Hotel is a very nice boutique hotel close to Champ de Mars. With public transportation minutes away from the rooms, the hotel is a perfect base for a trip to Paris. Rooms are very clean with great deco, the WiFi is free, and the minibar is 5 euros flat per day. We always received smiles and good tips from the staff. Just out from the Hotel there are many good restaurants and cafe to chose from. A+

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rosiehola
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel last weekend. Beautiful hotel in a quiet residentional area, about 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Likes Friendly staff Clean throughout Beautiful rooms and bathrooms Good breakfast (although a little pricey 16 euros) Area Dislikes No iron and ironing board No facecloths Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is close to the Eiffel tower, tucked away in a quiet neighborhood, and employs a genuinely friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyHungry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Eiffel tower, tucked away in a quiet neighborhood, and employs a genuinely friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “expensive rate for a small room...”
Reviews.Author: missylee28
Reviews.Content: stayed here 2 nights on sept 2011. i find that the rate is expensive given the room is small and also equally tiny bathroom. we had a standing shower which was great however even with glass door , the floor tends to get wet when we shower. other than that , the location is ok .. many eating places near the hotel and not to mention eiffel tower is within walking distance. oh btw : cab ride from Paris CDG airport cost us more than 50euros.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Payster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in September 2011. Very nice boutique hotel. Comfy bed and duvet - lovely bathroom and clean. Great location to the metro, eating and of course the sites. Very nice staff - just go around the corner for breakfast versus the hotel - it is less expensive when not eating at the hotel. Would recommend it anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Anthony C
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a quiet and scenic area. The rooms are very clean and the bathroom is something my wife would kill for! Excellent staff and lot to see (and eat) around, The metro station is just around the corner.and the Eiffel Tower is minutes away. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “High priced small rooms at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Helder K
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel right in the heart of Paris. Hotel location is perfect at a walking distance from the Eiffel Tower and other key landmarks. It also gives quick accessibility to move around Paris, with a metro station a close 5 minutes walking distance. Rooms unfortunately are very small for the value paid at the time, but very clean. Having travelling with my 2 children it was a bit difficult for them to have some decent space within the room to comfortable relax and play, so if you do have small kids, it might be a little challenging. Bathroom was also too small but again, comfortable nonetheless. Breakfast was a total disappointment, as it was done in a very small room with very limited options available at the cost it was offered. Luckily enough, there are many options available close to the hotel, with typical good choices' French Cafés offering very good options at a reasonable cost. Staff were very friendly and helpfull throughout the time spent there, with the only complaint being sometimes the room service's staff being a bit too loud when they were doing their job.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shannydog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and enjoyed the stay. Thus, we thought we would try it again. Like the first time, we had a wonderful stay. The hotel is slightly off the tourist path but is located close to neighborhood restaurants, shopping, and the metro. Rue Cler is a short walk away. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are well appointed. We would certainly stay here again and recommend the hotel to friends who want something different than the typical tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarracca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in a quiet area minutes away from the Eiffel Tower. The first (good) surprise was the room: very clean and nice. The staff made us feel home and we want to thank them again here for all the recommendations and help they gave us during our stay. Ares is a great place to stay in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: aweiys
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel. Nice decoration and very detailed. The Hermes amenities was a surprise. Bed & Pillows were very comfortable. Very helpful staff, house cleaning was excellent. The owner introduced himself at the lobby and offered much help. We even received a surprise gift with a personalized note during our last night, so lovely and felt the personal touch. A lady asked if we received the gift the next morning, I think she was the owner's spouse. Breakfast was a little pricey so we ate out every morning. The minibar charging system is a steal! 5 Euro for 2 Perrier, 2 Orangina, 1 Diet Coke, 1 bottled Coke & 2 bottles of water. You are charged if you only consumed one thing with the same amount. Take all or take nothing sort of speak. Little trouble with the supply of water during "shower time". I guess while others are using at the same time, the source became slow to almost dripping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emlau
Reviews.Content: Thanks for all the great reviews from Tripadvisor! My husband and I had a great stay at the Ares for six nights recently! First, the room is exactly like the pictures shown on its website. We have been to hotels that have lovely pictures posted but they are pretty wear and tear in real! Compared to other international brand hotels, room size is inevitably small (we go to Tokyo for work every two months, hotel rooms we usually stay are much smaller) however, the price charging per night is relevantly fair. Two thumbs up to the cleanliness of the room, it has unexpectedly passed my VERY high standards!!! The owner and a lady named Julianne are extremely friendly and helpful! Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: mtbiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ares for 2 days in September 2011. A very smart hotel with a great deal of charm, in an ideal location. Quiet, but only a few steps from bustling boulevards, and a 5 minute walk to the Champ de Mars, in which stands the Iconic Eiffel Tower, on which Vincent van Gogh's younger brother Cornelis worked as a construction labourer (I bet you didn't know that!). Free wi-fi, and two small but comfortable downstairs lounges. I doubt you would come across more friendly desk staff anywhere in Paris. The breakfast can be a bit of a challenge due to the tiny area, something that most boutique hotels have in common. That aside ... what a pleasure this stay was!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location, lovely room!”
Reviews.Author: brownytw
Reviews.Content: We spent the last few days of our honeymoon in this hotel based on its good review on tripadvisor, and it's worth our money! I was happy to step into a room that's clean and smelled nice. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was only a few minutes away from the metro station. There were also restaurants, supermarket, and shops in walking distance. There was, however, one flaw that disappointed me a little bit. My husband and I usually woke up late when travelling, while the cleaning lady started to clean the room next door around 10 in the morning! I could hear every single sound she made - dragging table, closing doors, coughing non-stop. After 15 minutes or so, I decided to call front desk to complain about it. The staff was very helpful and I heard they called the cleaning lady right away (yes, I can even hear the phone ringing next door!) That's why I still decided to give it a full 5 stars. We didn't have any noise problems during the night though so the sleeping quality was good. If I visit Paris again, I'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank N
Reviews.Content: We had to spend two days in Paris and the Ares Hotel was strongly recommended by some friends. The Hotel is minutes away from the Eiffel Tower and public transportation. The connections are very good. The area has plenty of cafes and reastaurants to choose from and the staff will guide your choice. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the bathroom is super. We are planning to get back to Paris in spring and the Ares will be our choice again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice room and hermes amenities”
Reviews.Author: puriindah
Reviews.Content: nice rooms nice amenities lots of towels and clean white bed sheets location 10 minutes from eiffel tower but 3 minute walk you can see the eiffle tower from the champ de mars parc.. close to metro line 8 and 10 and lots of cafes supermarkets and fast food nearby price is reasonable for paris

Reviews.Title: “really satisfied”
Reviews.Author: flyngwoman
Reviews.Content: My husband made me a surprise for holidays in Paris and he choosen the hotel ares eiffel and i was really satisfied of the hotel one of the best i ever stayed the hotel is very well renowated with a lot of test the staff is really great and helpful the metro station is just one minutes to walk and the eiffel tower is five seven minutes with slow walking. we will go back for our annyversary of marriage

Reviews.Title: “great ares”
Reviews.Author: worldthrottle
Reviews.Content: Hi The hotel Ares is one of the best hotel were I have stayed the classic rooms are big enough thanks to the staff for the great help that they have given to us the hotel is wonderful very well refurbished .we will come back soon

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, wonderful staff!”
