Reviews.Author: misterc6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of my wife's 60th birthday celebrations and found it excellent. Hotel Ares in in a great location with the quiet tranquility of the Swiss Village antiques area on one side and the bustle of Avenue de La Motte-Piquet with its cafes, restuarants and shops on the other. The hotel is in a very quiet area with nothing to interrupt our sleep. The Eiffel Tower is an easy 15 minute walk away through the Parc du Champs de Mars. The nearest Metro station is just a 3 minute walk away and is served by lines 6, 8 and 10 giving easy access to all areas of the city. We transferred from CDG using the RER line B and changing at Denfert Rochereau to line 6 which took just over an hour. Yes, the rooms are on the small side but have excellent facilities and decor. The cleanliness was superb. The optional breakfast was expensive but there are many alternatives within three minutes walk. The best feature of the Hotel Ares is its staff most of whom were multi-lingual and seemed to appreciate my poor attempts at French. Julianne was brilliant and helped to make the arrangements for my wife's special day. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends and hope to return myself one day.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION IN PARIS!”
Reviews.Author: gypsyscotland
Reviews.Content: Having checked out hotels on "trip" as usual, we settled on the ARES EIFFEL. We were not disappointed. Well appointed, with lovely rooms, quite funky, and so so CLEAN. Spotless. The Hermes toiletries were lovely, as was the rain shower. Wonderful location, 10 minutes stroll from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine, where you could pick up a river boat, and so central to go north, south, east or west to all of the main attractions and VERY handy for the Metro. Also, some very nice restaurants nearby. Staff all spoke english, and were eager to advise and help, and the owner made himself known, who spoke immaculate english. The 3 nights spent here were marvellous, and we would not hesitate in returning. By the way, the buffet breakfast was very nice, ALL fresh, with lovely sqeezed orange juice and continental choices. Another tip. From CDG airport we took the train to Denfert Rochereau, and then the metro No 6 line to La Motte Piquet Grenelle. It just took about 40 minutes and cost under 10 euros each! Really simple, and the hotel was 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Keiraj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked in a quiet neighborhood, pretty close to the Effiel tower, but a good 15-30 min walk away. I was a little surprised at how small the hotel was, I was expecting some grand huge hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of service that only a smaller scale hotel can offer. The room was clean, pretty and very luxurious. Versace tiles, Bang & Olufsen phones, Etro and Hermes toiletries, and the sheets were a dream to sleep in. It was very pleasant and safe staying here, what with a 24 hour night guard.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbertOma_79
Reviews.Content: The Ares hotel was part of our romantic getaway to Paris. The choice could not be better. The location is perfect and the rooms are clean and nice but what really makes the difference is the staff. Before leaving we took the time to thank each of them personally. All of them. They really made us feel home. This great hotel and Paris did the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: maddie4bc
Reviews.Content: Quite a lovely hotel although the room was uncomfortably small for three of us. I really did not like that there was no iron in the room and I had to do any ironing in the public breakfast room. Buffet breakfast was an additional 16 euros - and when you know all your child is going to eat is a bowl of cornflakes, that is quite an outrageous price. Eating out is expensive in Paris - but we could find better deals at a cafe. However, I think that small rooms and high prices are the norm in Paris. The staff was very friendly and immediately switched to English when I tried my very poor French. We liked that we were within a 10 minute walk of the Eiffel Tower and that a Metro stop was nearby.....we however opted to use the Batobus along the Seine for transportation (stops near the Eiffel Tower, so the hotel is fairly convenient for that as well).

Reviews.Title: “Sweet”
Reviews.Author: doug b
Reviews.Content: Beautifull hotel, very nice staff ( big effort considering its Paris ), the rooms are very confortable, Room service was divine. Well done

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: trentbailey86
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon to paris. We found the hotel on TripAdvisor, and after reading all of the wonderful reviews decided to book. It was definitely one of the best decisions we made for the trip. The staff was so welcoming, the hotel is beautiful, quiet and quaint, while also modern with all beautiful finishes. The Hotel Ares Eiffel has definitely made two HUGE fans out of us, and since our honeymoon we have actually recommended it to friends visiting Paris. They too have had the same experience that we had. I cannot say enough AMAZING things about this hotel, you really just must stay to see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet four-night stay with husband and parents..”
Reviews.Author: MissCLam
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location close to the metro and because it is in a quiet residential area. We were traveling with parents who are seniors and cannot walk excessive distances. We did not try the hotel breakfast because it seemed a bit expensive and there are numerous cafes around the corner. The hotel staff especially Juliane were friendly and professional. There is a laundromat about two minutes away as well. The rooms are on the smaller side which the parents did not like (difficult to move around and no space to put two luggages). My husband and I were fine with the room and we are in our late twenties, but used to staying in tinier hotel rooms Asia. Overall we enjoyed our stay and it was a nice start to our three weeks in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “my best hotel in europe trip”
Reviews.Author: fdunitedstates
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife hav spent a very nice vacation at the hotelAres wonderful design staff professional and very gentle ,amazing location near eiffel tower and the metro one mimutes to walk , we join the other very nice reviews this hotel is really our favourite in paris

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: americanworker
Reviews.Content: we choose the Ares hotel for the photos on the official site and for the ranking on trip advisor , we were really satisfied the hotel was like we saw on these web sites.hte hotel is gorgeous the design the materials and big attntion of the deails , the staff was wonderful like juliane alwais ready to help us fo wevery thing we need to know about paris ,we found the room regular size for a four star in paris and not pricey they are in paris less quality and a lot more expensive, the location is amazing three lines of the metro just behind the corner . i Recommend this hotel to whom like nice places to feel well

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: gatorcane
Reviews.Content: This property is like staying in a rich, distant cousins house. You get a small room that the owner has spent lots of money on and you are going to pay for it. We stayed there for six nights at a cost of $3200 USD. The room was small, it is air conditioned, the bed is ok. The shower was nice. There is no service at this property. The one bright spot was George who was kind enough to get me a pot of hot water in the evenings for tea. This lasted the three nights he was on duty. The other three nights was a different man and he seemed to hate the guests, so no help. There is no service or assistance other than basic directions. The location is a short easy walk to the Eiffel Tower and Metro station. The neighborhood is very quiet and has a Starbucks, Haagen Dazs and a few restaurants and grocery store. I would tell friends and family to keep looking for a different property and I'll tell you the same. Too expensive for the reality of the property.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel with Everything”
Reviews.Author: Snappy65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved Hotel Ares Eiffel. The area is quiet to start and end the day and within walking distance to many of the greatest pleasures of Paris. The hotel offers air conditioning, free internet, wonderfully friendly staff members and a Metro station that has several important connections to get you to other parts of the city. If you love the sound of church bells, you'll love hearing them ring here as there are several old churches nearby. You are near two street markets that are a terrific adventure as well as many bustling cafes for people-watching. One of the best restaurants we frequented was close by: Chamade Cafe, 42 bis Avenue de Suffren. Excellent food and service. We would come to this hotel again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nadyag
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my partner, who proposed in Paris! Fantastic quiet location very close to shops, metro, Sunday market (highly recommended!) just down the road. Safe area, gym entry included in the price, and close to a fantastic jogging track along the Seine. Great to have free Wi-Fi too and free internet in the lounge. Lovely staff, very helpful. Standard room was a little on the small side but beautifully furnished with amazing bathroom. Had difficulties finding it with taxi from Airport - recommend printing out Google maps with location market before arriving to Paris (street not marked on many maps). Erroneously booked an extra night through Expedia, and despite non-refundable status hotel very kindly did refund the extra night's price. Loved it, will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ares my Preferred hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: parsifal21
Reviews.Content: it is many tymes that i am going in Paris for work and it Was the first time AT the Ares , I appreciated a lot the design the people working in that are full of attentions at every desire you may have , the fre wi fi is a plus for people that are in paris for work ,the location is very calm but just just few steps from the hotel there are full of restaurants ,bistros, the eiffel tower is eight minutes to walk and the metro is just behind the corner, what is wonderful is that after a hard day of work you can go to to do gim in very nice fitness club just behind the corner and is complimentary with the room rate I felt in love ith this hotel , and I strongly recommend the ARES hotel and next times in paris i will come here

Reviews.Title: “luxurious Ares”
Reviews.Author: goofy7383
Reviews.Content: We found every thing excellent the service the staff the location and the design for these resons we will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, hip decor, a bit off the beaten path, but close to Metro station servicing 3 lines”
Reviews.Author: davidho65
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Booking.com, and reserved a room due to the popularity ranking. I'd forgotten that the Eiffel Tower which is a nearby attraction is a bit far from most of the other key tourist destinations, but I got a three day Metro pass, and found that I was only 5-15 minutes via Metro from even the further destinations like Montmartre. There is a station just around the corner that services 3 lines, so I made a lot of trips to tourist destinations and didn't have to connect. I had a lovely, hip room on the top floor with a window in the bathroom and the bedroom, so I enjoyed the light-filled ambience of my smallish room. Toilet was separated from the bath/sink in a separate room within my guest room, which seemed a bit strange, but not a big deal. Reception staff were extremely perky, knowledgeable, and enthusiastic about helping me plan out my days. Breakfast buffet which was a supplemental 16 Euros was delicious and substantial.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very modern and in fact luxurious rooms”
Reviews.Author: MarkusSOulu
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent with only about 5 minutes walk to Eiffel tower. Somehow we always managed to have difficulties finding back to the hotel, though, but I guess that's mostly just us. Some taxi drivers were really lost when trying to find the hotel but that was most likely because the road didn't seem to be on the all the maps and/or on GPS. There is also a metro station nearby for easy access to other locations in Paris and its vicinity. At least the standardish rooms (i.e. non-suites) seemed quite small (which was to be expected -- it's a small boutique hotel in the centre of Paris), but they are of very high standards with decoration and electronics from the more luxurious brands such as Versace, Poltrona Frau, B&O, Hermès etc. The staff was very helpful and friendly and overall it will be easy to choose the hotel for our next stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: WYSOKC
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here on a trip to Paris and loved the room. Rooms were small but very nice. Decorated by Versache (I guess before he was shot!?). Staff was very helpful and location was great. 5 minutes to the Eiffel tower and dozens of great restaurants. 10 minutes to Rue De Clare and even more great places to eat and shop. Metro was 2 minutes away. Hotel is located a block off the main drag so it is very quite as well. This hotel is great but it is NOT a five star hotel like the Ritz or the San Regis so keep that in mind when you book but it is definatly a 4 star place at a great price in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieTustin
Reviews.Content: The Ares Hotel was the best thing about our trip to Paris. The staff was amazing and the hotel is very charming. All of their recommendations were perfect and they are located in a charming area which is a short stroll to the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast is expensive but very very good.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable Ares”
Reviews.Author: luxurytraveller33
Reviews.Content: it was one of our best vacation of our life, the hotel is wonderful the designer had a lot of test and attention of the details . The staff is very gently and helpful in all the question we had to ask for restaurants museums and other things . the room was enough roomy and spacious . The location is great just 5 minutes from eiffel tower the tube is just behind the corner , we will recommend to all our friends ,and we will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworthy and outrageous service”
Reviews.Author: natamuz
Reviews.Content: I would like to warn you against coming here with families. Or even coming here at all – we shall certainly not return. Booked two superior rooms at this hotel via their site more than a month in advance – one twin and one double room. I have specially booked this particular hotel, as they have specifically guaranteed a twin room (two separate beds – for my children, a boy and a girl). I have even sent them a separate e-mail after the automatically generated confirmation, making sure that this is what we were going to get. The hotel reassured me by e-mail that we should get what had been requested. On arrival to the hotel at 6pm after a whole day journey with the kids we discovered, that we were given a double room and… a double room. A very polite and welcoming lady at the reception explained that there was nothing they could do about it on Saturday night. Apparently, our visit was unexpected. After some discussion she condescended to at least re-making the bed and providing two separate duvets. Having come back from dinner at 9.30 pm, we discovered that a polite lady was replaced by a man who has not done anything and apparently was not intending to do anything for us. Having paid over 1000 Euro for a two-night stay here, we had to resort to wandering round the hotel with this reception man pleading him to give us a second duvet for our children. He even had the nerve to say that it was not customary for them to provide an extra duvet (i.e. two duvets for two beds – one is customary sufficient). I believe that the hotel does not merit so high position on Tripadvisor, by which I was regrettably misled. Their booking obligations proved to be untrustworthy, and the service – just appalling.

Reviews.Title: “A true high end boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: liveforfood
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with my daughter for her 21st birthday and stayed at this hotel. The location is great (2-3 minutes walker to the Metro). There are restaurants and shops right on that main street. The staff was very helpful and the room was soooo clean. I have a very high standard of cleanliness so when I say clean it is spotless. We had a corner room on the 6th floor with a big bathroom. The room is comfortable and has everything one would need (safe, fridge, tv, closet space). I highly recommend this hotel to people travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: makingmemories09
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends at the Ares Eiffel for five nights this July. The hotel is tucked on a quiet side street - yet walking distance to great restaurants (Le Suffren and Zinc) and the Eiffel Tower. One of the things we loved about Ares was that it is not in a heavy tourist area - yet so close to everything. There are wonderful restaurants within walking distance and one of the best french bakeries is right next to Starbucks, called La Petit Chocoterie (you may need to check my spelling). The rooms are very clean, decorated very well and had plenty of room for us. The front desk was very helpful with questions and suggestions for eating. All in all a lovely stay - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: JacquesTutite
Reviews.Content: Room was nice & big (for a European hotel), very clean and helpful staff. Close to sights, shopping, trains. Good air conditioning, and extra bed for my teenager was a step up from a standard roll-away. Tub and shower floor was very slick when wet (use extra caution), clothes storage space was somewhat limited (we opted to leave most clothes in our suitcases). We skipped the breakfast there (pricey). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: sidzy
Reviews.Content: I looked up this hotel through Trip Advisor and stayed here for 9 nights. My visit to Paris was a mix of Business/Leisure with my wife. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Eiffel Tower and has a Metro Station (La Motte-Picquet) just around the corner. There are lots of cafes/bars just a few minutes' walk away on Pl Joffre which have lots of eating options, and an Indian Restaurant barely a minutes walk from the Hotel where we dined practically every night. There is also a shopping street close by, Rue Commercial which has lots of small shops to browse around. What I found best about the location is that even though the Hotel is very close to these facilities, it is actually located in a small street tucked away. This ensured that we had absolutely no concerns regarding noises from the traffic or the road and had a peaceful stay. Although, other tourist places within Paris are all a cab-ride away. Champs Elysees, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, etc are all about 10-20 minutes by cab, traffic depending. What should be taken into account is that if you do intend on staying closer to Champs Elysees, you will be paying much more than The Ares for a smilar hotel. I was extremely happy with my accommodation. The rooms are small, but then they don't get any bigger in Paris, unless you want to really splurge. The rooms are very well equipped. Have Bang & Olufsen products, chic furniture and decor. The bathrooms are surprisingly nice sized and have excellent Hermes bath products. The staff is friendly and helpful. We wanted to watch a show at Lido, and they were quick and efficient in reserving our seats for us. The breakfast isn't particularly great, especially for vegetarians and is priced at Euro16 per person which we felt was steep for their offering. Getting taxis in Paris can be tricky especially during rush hours. We faced a similar problem on a Tuesday morning when we had to catch a train to Belgium at 9:00am for a meeting. We waited for the taxi to come for about 40 minutes but to no avail. Ultimately the owner of the hotel offered to drive us to the train station. We were grateful to him for driving us there and more importantly, he drove with great urgency because we didn't have much time. We missed our train ultimately and he apologized, even though he wasn't at fault. A gesture like this really won me over. We were really thankful to him and the entire staff at The Ares for making our stay a very memorable one. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable stay in central Paris while not spending over the top. The owners really do go the extra mile to make sure you have an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cozy and great location”
Reviews.Author: andrea_steen072
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ares Eiffel with my sister and our 2 teenaged daughters. The hotel is small but very clean and with wonderful bathrooms. Our shower was great at the end of a long touring day and they have lovely Hermes bath products. The rooms were quiet and we were only a 6-7 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower park. The hotel is near several major streets-Suffren and Grevelle and there is no lack of restaurants, cafes, Starbucks, bakeries and if you wish subway stops. It was also a 5 minute walk from the Fat Tire Bike company with excellent tours of Paris and Versailles (great part of our trip). The hotel offers a breakfast which we didn't try because the price was 16 euros pp. We thought this was a little pricey. The front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. The taxi ride to the hotel is expensive at 60-70 euros! If you feel comfortable with the trains and subway it would be a cheaper option. Overall we were quite happy with the hotel and would recommend it and would stay there again if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsammy
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel. Rooms are small but that was expected and not an issue for us. Location is wonderful as it is right beside a metro hub. Can pretty much get anywhere in the city without transferring from that one station. Staff nice and courteous. Close to Eiffel tower but not so close to other frequently visited points around Paris. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Bob_Mo69
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Superb (superior) room with quality furnishings and a huge bathroom. Staff were helpful and polite. Location is excellent. We were a bit concerned that it has no bar, but there are loads of bars and bistros within 2 minutes walk. The Metro station is less than 3 minutes away and it makes it easy to travel anywhere. Had good nights sleep as it was reasonably quiet. Mini bar (no alcohol) is 5 Euros a night if you use it. We walked to Eiffel Tower a couple times and it takes about 10 minutes. French market on Wednesdays is a couple minutes walk away, (and there's a McDonalds too!) We would recommend this clean and friendly hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: cooksbay
Reviews.Content: My 12 yr. old grandson and I loved this hotel. Very comfortable, good quiet location near Metro and easy walk to the Eiffel Tower or the Batobus next to the Tower. Lots of nice antique stores nearby. The only issue we had was that the night before we left we ordered a 10am taxi for the next day. However it was raining the next morning. Taxis are not easy to find in Paris on rainy days ... and no-one in the hotel had a record of us having reserved one:). Another couple there had been waiting 2 hrs for their taxi! So we ran to the Metro and got to Gare St. Lazare in time for our train anyway. I think the main thing to learn from the story is to always leave plenty of time when in Paris (and maybe particularly in smaller hotels which are off the main streets). Murphy's Law operates more frequently in big cities.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paris-We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Cicero1120
Reviews.Content: Elegant, charming, with lots of charecter. That goes for the rooms, the neighborhood, and the best hotel staff experience I have ever had. I hope to return soon for a longer stay. My friends and I had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous2535
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel! The rooms were phenomenal, the bathrooms were very large and beautiful, and the service was impeccable. This hotel is just a few blocks away from the Eiffel and just steps away from amazing cafes, grocery stores, shopping, and the metro. The rooms were very clean and modern and the bed was very comfortable. They even had nice large windows that you could open to feel the breeze. The bathrooms were very large, especially for Europe and were mostly marble which was amazing. The rain shower head was a nice luxury as well. Just like the room, even the lobby and hallways were beautifully decorated and really clean. Attention was paid to every single detail. Finally, the staff was amazing. The front desk staff were always there to greet you with a smile and offer advice on where to eat and what to see and do if you asked. Also, we had a bit of a situation with our credit card during checkout and they were incredibly kind, patient and helpful as we attempted to reach our credit card company back in the US. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! Would love to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Manasi29
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very stylish and chic. The rooms were small but had everything necessary. The bathroom was clean and modern with Hermes toiletries. The owners were very helpful. The location was superb, just minutes from the Eiffel tower. We would not stay anywhere else when we go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: stevenbh
Reviews.Content: Unbeknownst to me, I checked in last week during the Paris Air Show and had a meeting in the suburbs that required me to take a cab. There were none to be found and calling cab and car services revealed nothing available. "Sorry, Paris Air Show has taken everything." One of the two women at the desk; forgive me; I've forgotten her name; Julienne's colleague; stood out on the main street; Rue de Grenell in the rain ! for at least 15 minutes tyring to flag a cab down and came back to report no success. We then determined that I could get most to the way to my destination on the Metro but although I speak a pretty passble French, I've never been on the Paris subway and have the world's worst sense of direction. This woman then said, "no problem, I'll ride with you; it should only take around 20 mintues." I took her up on this offer since I came to Paris for just this one meeting. When we got to the Metro stop, she told me that a cab from there to my destination would only take 5 minutes but she would be happy to ride with me. I told her I'd be fine, gave her a 20 Euro tip and sent her back. I made my meeting only 15 minutes late and all went according to plan. Overall, a nice hotel but the service was seriously worthy of a 5-star. Steven Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Cameliah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small, classic old Parisian hotel. Nicely maintained. Very nice bathroom, comfortable bed in a tiny but pretty corner room. Location good if you want to be by Eiffel Tower. Front desk not terribly helpful. They called our room 3 times after we went to bed to discuss the cab we asked for (simple 7:30 am request to airport). The cab from the CDG airport was 80 Euros (the RER was on strike). It wasn't clear on our reservation if breakfast was included (it wasn't) but they allowed us to get a quick cup of coffee on our way out at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ares Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: CoTravelsalot
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Ares Eiffel on a family trip through Europe. The hotel was perfect. Location near the Eiffel tower and the subway stop around the corner was great! Quiet neighborhood with many great restaurants and bars was an added bonus. Le Suffren was GREAT, also a Starbucks if you want that . Reception was great - fast, reliable , easy - any directions you want. The room (we had a 4 person family room) was great - plenty of room. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hkpuipui99
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! The service was great in the beautiful, posh lobby. The parking was cheap (14 EUR/night) and nearby (a few blocks away underneath a grocery store). Honestly the parking was quite ghetto, we were worried about our rental car's safety. But I can happily say that our rental car was there for 3 nights and it was COMPLETELY safe. The room was one of the best we had during our entire trip. We had a deluxe room, which was big enough to accommodate all 4 of us. The regular bed is great according to my parents, but I can confirm that 2 sofa beds weren't so great. The mattress was very thin and you can feel the bedspring when you lay down. It wasn't really a problem for me and my sister, coz we were so tired walking around all day, everyday. But this might be a concern for others. Worth nothing is that the bathroom was very nicely decorated, which Versace tiles on the walls, and Hermes toiletries. You read that right: HERMES. But the best part was the rain shower. What a nice relief after long days of sightseeing. Also note that unlike many other hotels, this one has A/C. Wireless internet is also free, but you do need separate logins for each device: i.e. laptop/iphone etc. The front desk can provide you with multiple logins. The location is wonderful. The Eiffel Tower is a short walk away, and since you approach from the other end of Champ de Mars, it's like the most wonderful approach to the tower possible. The hotel is also near 2 separate subway lines, which means most sightseeing can be down with just one transfer or less. If your budget allows, definitely consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel in Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: P_Rowberry
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel! Location was fantastic. A short walk to the Eiffel Tower (about 10 mins), some great restaurants and local shops on the main road, and easy access to a well connected metro station (La Motte-Picquet-Grenelle). The hotel was a little tricky to find though as we came out of the wrong exit at the metro station so it would be worth printing off the map before you go. We stayed in a Classic room which was relatively small but because of the layout we still had plenty of room for us and our luggage without falling over things. Well worth paying to have the mini bar in the room to be filled up every day as buying drinks out was much more expensive. Staff were also very helpful, recommending some good local places to eat, and always cheerful when entering or leaving the hotel even though our attempts at French weren't that good! It's possible to leave luggage at the hotel if you're too early to check in and after checking out which we really appreciated. The room was finished to a really high standard, was really clean and quiet so sleeping was not a problem and the bed was very comfy! All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We enjoyed it that much we've booked to go again in July. We'd never stop in another hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tognir
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations for this hotel, based on the excellent reviews and we were not disappointed. The hotel has a luxurious feel all over, the rooms are a decent size and staff friendly. We got a taxi to the hotel when we arrived at Gare de Nord, the taxi driver had trouble finding it initially, the cost from the station was 20 euros. We were made to feel very welcome on arriving at the hotel and our room looked lovely with a nice view. The room was not massive but fine for a 3 night break. We slept really well but struggled to have a lie in, due to guests in other rooms talking and banging which I found annoying. The bath was big and had a powerful rose shower over, the toileteries a nice touch. My only real complaint was I would have liked a wall mirror in the bedroom, the only decent mirror was in the bathroom. The hotel is in a pleasant and safe area with a few decent restaurants, bars and shops. The metro 'La Motte Picquette Grenelle' is 3 mins away and Eiffel Tower is about a 15 minute walk. We used the metro several times to get round Paris as the location is not close enough to everything to walk around and our feet were hurting! The metro is very easy to use, we got it on the last day back to Gare de Nord very easily (and cheaper than a taxi). If we visit Paris again, I think we would try and get a hotel in the Latin Quarter to be closer to everything. We would still recommend Ares Eiffel to anyone visiting Paris wanting to be in a nice area, just to be aware that you will need to get the metro to visit most of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: NushNushandBooBoo
Reviews.Content: We had high expectations following all the good reviews on this site, and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is very comfortable - combining the best of both a traditional Parisian hotel with modern design (especially the lovely bathroom) - and located in a nice part of town with three metro lines on the doorstep providing easy access to all parts of Paris. While spotlessly clean, the design of the rooms is a bit full on and won't be to everyone's taste, and you can hear rather more from the room next door and the corridor than you'd like. Nevertheless, highly recommended and an excellent base for a Parisian break.

Reviews.Title: “Service above & beyond”
Reviews.Author: LSlorne
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 wonderful nights at the Ares. The location is terrific, very close to the metro. We usually stay in Maris and surrounds so felt quite unfamiliar to the area. Therefore the recommendations to surrounding restaurants was really appreciated. Our room was lovely (a bath as well). The mini-bar full of soft-drinks at a daily charge was very welcome after a hot day wandering around Paris. Due to the sudden & tragic death of our daughter-in-law we had to cancel all our forward bookings and return to Australia. The staff at Ares were marvellous, helped us communicate by translating until we were able to speak to someone in English that could help us on a Sunday (Bank holiday). We will definitely return. Small boutique accommodation in Paris - a great experience. Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Good spot near eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: thavwplaya
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel close to the eiffel tower and the metro. The bathroom had the beautiful versace tile as advertise. The tv had plenty of international channels and I was comfortable. We didn't take advantage of the breakfast, we my wife can't eat gluten. This was our first of two hotel rooms in paris and was pretty good in size (for it's price, location). We ate at La Gitane the first night, and were pleased with it. The eiffel tower is about a 10 minute walk (to the base).

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sellera
Reviews.Content: I have to add myself to the list of those highly recommending Ares Eiffel. I did spend 3 nights there with my girlfriend and all of them were unforgettanle. Th hotel is conveniently located, few minutes away from metro and bus stops and just a walk from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are super clean and beautifully decorated. My girlfriend did fall in love with the bathroom. The staff was always helpful and corteous. A very nice hotel that will make your Paris getaway just better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: TripHappy88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a total of six nights over an eight night French vacation. Ownership and staff are, quite simply, wonderful people. Enrico, Julianne and Isabella Thank you so much!! Because our stay was for two 3 night visits we stayed in 2 different rooms, both were cozy in the bedding area and roomy in the bath. We did not have trouble understanding their English and found recommendations on dining and attractions to be very good. It is very easy to get around from this hotel, as other reviewers have noted, which we found to be a major plus. The area is quiet as it is in a residential neighborhood, but there are at least 3 great cafe's within 2 blocks (there are many more nearby). Enrico (the owner) went above and beyond our expectations in two different ways. He was very kind and generous in extending a gift to help celebrate my wife's birthday and after suffering a serious injury off hotel grounds coordinated medical care to make the return trip more palatable. You should know my rating would have been the same without the extra service, but it is nice to know when you are far from home that someone will take extra care to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed by everything”
Reviews.Author: deltasigguy21
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at Hotel Ares while traveling in Europe and expected an a positive experience after reading the reviews on this site. None of which prepared us for the amazing time we had while staying at the hotel. The staff was amazing, especially the woman who checked us in (sadly I can't remember her name). We were greeted warmly and treated like old friends from the minutes we walked in the beautiful wrought iron doors. The hotel is small and decorated like a stylish home versus a typical upscale hotel. After check in which took all of 2 minutes (including friendly conversation) we were personally escorted to our room up a curved flight of stairs (an elevator is also available). While the room was small (to be expected in Europe) it again was styled more like a well appointed guest room than a hotel room with soft linens, thick draped, polished hard wood floors and Hermes soaps in the bathroom. A small juliet balcony led us a wonderful view down a small quiet street. When we asked about places to dine, or directions, again the staff was more than happy to recommend wonderful places and options that proved point on. The neighborhood is more residential ( i.e. not touristy thank God!) and has wonderful shops and cafes which are open early and close late and best of all is only steps from the Eiffel Tower. Taxis are also abundant, but most of central Paris is in walking distance Words can't describe the experience adequately, and we will never stay anywhere else in this incredible city. Thank you Hotel Ares and your staff for making our stay a magical one!

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly”
Reviews.Author: empress_cherry
Reviews.Content: I loved my (classic) room, it was the perfect Parisian fantasy, with plush decor and one of those little wrought iron balconies! It was small, but the bathroom was luxuriously large. The best thing about this hotel, though, was the excellent service - the staff really seemed to want to do what they could to make my stay great, one guy even loaned me his iPad because my iPhone wouldn't connect to the hotel's wifi network (note: I learned at a later destintation that cookies need to be allowed to connect to some wifi networks, I'm not sure if that's why I couldn't connect at this hotel). The location is a little out of the way - about 15mins by metro to central attractions, about 30 to montmarte or pere lachaise - but Paris is a big place so you'll need to spend a bit of time on the metro wherever you stay (note: do use the metro, it's not at all scary, and there's a station on several lines just around the corner from the hotel). The neighbourhood is homely but chic, a little like the upper west side in NYC. There were some annoyances, most notably noise from other rooms, but nothing that would stop me from giving this hotel 5/5. I paid 254AUD/nt via Expedia (not including breakfast), I think that's excellent value for a hotel of this quality in an expensive city. I wouldn't pay the much higher rack rate though, I don't think anyone (who knows how to use the internet at least!) pays rack rates in Europe outside of ultra-peak times.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Chic, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Downtownapple
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely safe and convenient. It is close to the Metro stops and good restaurants. The hotel decoration is modern and chic. The staff is very friendly. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous accomidation, shower, bed ,room, & staff exec rm. #61”
Reviews.Author: brownie1NY
Reviews.Content: Go for the exec rm in this hotel , quiet great area, near the tower with great metro access

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: tffin
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night in 2009. It was packaged with Eurostars tickets from London. Well decorated room/bathroom.The rooms maybe a bit cramped because of the oversized furniture used but definitely has luxury boutique looks and feels.The staffs were friendly and polite all the time.Location near to metro,interesting places/points.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: spucchio
Reviews.Content: The Ares made my last two nights in Paris unforgettable. Paris was last stop in France on the way back home. No problem for the (very) late check in. The room was beautiful and the bathroom even better. Probably the cleanest hotel we have been in. The area is quiet and has a lot of restaurants to choose from and the staff always gave us nice advices. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: broome57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend with our 2 young kids in a Deluxe room. The Hotel is well situated on a quiet side street but with everything you need a 2 minute walk around the corner, including a metro station. Tour Eiffel was a 10 minute walk away. Whilst the room was small it was beautifully decorated and had 2 fold-out chairs as single beds for the kids. The room was quiet and peaceful and we had a couple of lovely nights sleep. Reception staff were helpful and spoke excellent English. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: RobinHood1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night on the way back from a three week trip to Italy by train. Thought we would have a stop off in Paris and this was a good choice. A small boutique style hotel in a residential area 15 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. Great quiet location, beautiful stylish rooms, and in area with lots of cafes restaurants and bars. We had a superior room on the 6th floor on the corner with two little balconies....very efficient air conditioning and immaculate bathroom. Internet was a little erratic. We were able to walk everywhere and on the Saturday morning went to a very typical local food market a few hundred metres away and bought some goodies for lunch and to take home. Gave breakfast a miss at 16 euros, and went to a local Boulangerie. Service is very attentive and the owner spoke to us as we left to check out all was well - seemed to be genuinely interested in our opinions and if we were happy. I would definitely go here again if I was to go to Paris for a few days...in fact I feel so positively about it I might do it soon!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Gilgordon
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a terrific 4-night stay at the Ares Eiffel and it was FANTASTIC! The hotel is located in a very quite neibourhood, yet only about 7 minutes from the Eiffel tower, and 3 minutes from a Metro station that hosts 3 lines, so we could get anywhere easily. On the way to the Metro there's a Starbucks and 2 local coffee shops, and there are a few brasseries and a very good Indian restaurant less then 4 minutes walk away. The room is very nice and VERY clean. The bed was very comfortable, and there's WIFI in the room. The highlight was the reception staff - they REALLY made us feel at home - very helpfull, always providing tips about where and when to go to places. We travel quite a lot, and the only hotel that had such a helpfull staff was Le Meridien Bangkok. VERY highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GeoSquared
Reviews.Content: I spent two night at Ares during my last business trip to Paris. The Hotel is excellent. The rooms are very clean and beds are really comfortable (I slept like a stone). Internet access if free and the loction is great . Recommended for business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Hotel in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: AlisonB12
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 day break with to young kids in Paris and Hotel Ares was one of our high points! First the positives: Excellent quite and safe location - 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Batobus, Starbucks round the corner for affordable breakfasts and a Macdonalds for fussy eating kids. Very clean high spec rooms with lovely decor, Versace tiled bathrooms, double walk in rain shower, high ceilings, aircon, room safe, mini fridge, flatscreen TV with BBC channel, spacious even for 4, nice crisp white sheets, nice toiletries & fluffy towels and slippers for all. Some very friendly staff who were great with the kids. We were given a very warm welcome and introduced to the owner. Nice chocs in the room for us on arrival. Free internet access (and the ability to print) from the lobby. ...and now the not so good stuff: The rooms have wood floors which amplify noise. The kids fold out beds had poor, thin mattresses which we ended up stuffing with extra pillows and blankets so they couldn't feel the springs! The walls are thin and we could hear conversations from other rooms pretty easily. No coffee or tea making facilities and the breakfasts are very expensive. We had a day at Eurodisney as part of our stay. Was an easy 40 min trip on the local RER A train from the Arc de Triomphe. Would recommend taking the Batobus (hop on hop off boat down the Seine) from the Eiffel Tour as a good way of getting around (and much nicer than the Metro with kids). Overall Ares was a very good family hotel in a great neighbourhood...just a bit pricey!

Reviews.Title: “For the price of the hotel & the service they give, youre better off with another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cldyr
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was not ver clean, bed linens had stains which i find unacceptable for the rates they charge. The room was very small! Albeit all rooms in Europe most especially Paris are small but comparing it to other hotels we previously stayed in, its tiny! The service was not very good, wifi connection would frequently fluctuate and when asked the front desk people would just say, they cant do anything about it & i just need to wait, no apologies, not sorrry for the inconvenience... One thing i loved about it? The hermes toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wibord
Reviews.Content: I did spend 3 days at Ares with my girlfriend and enjoyed all of them. The hotel is gorgeous. The rooms are not big (this is pretty normal in France) but are beautiful. The location is great, very close to the Eiffel Tower and the metro. The surrounding are has a lot of cafe's and restaurants to choose from and the staff is always happy to guide you. The Ares Hotel is perfect for your stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ryangcii2
Reviews.Content: The reviewers in the past were right, the hotel is fantastic. Nicest staff and so near the metro and all the sites. We stayed here for two weeks and it was a place we looked forward to come back to each day after exhausting sightseeing. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: splitto
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at Ares during my last trip to Paris. This boutique hotel is perfectly located: few minutes from the Eiffel Tower ( a 5 minute walk) and public transporattion (bus and metro station are around the corner). The staff is very helpful and the room are richly decorated. This hotel deserves a solid A+

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gervsal
Reviews.Content: This is a very nicely set up hotel with warm and friendly staff. The rooms are well decorated and kept and as per the bathrooms. Quiet and very comfortable - would happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room for Family with Friendly Staff--but limited Amenities”
Reviews.Author: atlantaheel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in executive studio room with wife and 2 kids (9,10). Sleeping arrangement was comfortable with Queen bed and 2 single pull out beds all in 1 room. Space was adequate though typical French small. Bathroom nice and clean w/ Hermes bath products but also somewhat small. Small fridge in room and a single TV were adeqaute especially as we were out of the room alot. The hotel has exceptional staff and were very helpful with local recommendations and information. Hotel had no real bar or amenities though it has a small kitchen /dining area for breakfast but was somewhat pricey for what it offered. The location is within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and very easy access to the Motte-Picquet station. Numerous shops and restaurants are close by although the hotel itself is on a very quiet street. The hotel was good value for the fact we were all able to stay in 1 room and the beds were very comfortabel including the pull outs. The option for using the items in the stocked fridge at 5 Euros a day was a steal (no alcohol). The free Wi-fi was another bonus as well as access to a printer in the lobby. Overall, a good option in a boutique hotel with all the feel of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been annoyed if I'd have paid full price......”
Reviews.Author: leapyear60
Reviews.Content: This hotel although in a great location just didn't live up to the luxury hotel it is billed as. The room we had was in the inner courtyard so although quiet was dark and quite depressing. The room was small and even though I have stayed in Pari a few times and know generally the hotel rooms are smaller than other places in Europe, I did expect a room a bit larger given the full price of the room. In fact the bathroom was alsmost as big as the room.... I would have been annoyed if I'd have paid full price for this room. I am glad we only stayed for one night

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great lcoation”
Reviews.Author: RichieUT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in between business trips and found the hotel itself was very nice and the front desk staff were very friendly and spoke English pretty well. It is also just a short walk away from the Eiffel Tower and several restaurants. The rooms were very clean and comfortable as were the bathrooms. When I asked the person on duty at the front desk they were more than happy to recommend local restaurants (although I usually got lost trying to find them) and things to see. The only problem that I ran into during my stay here was when one night I bought a bottle of wine to drink at the hotel to find that there was not a bottle opener in the room. When I called down to ask the desk if they had one I was told that there weren't any openers in the hotel. this I found odd especially considering the country that I was in. I wasn't going to let a piece or cork keep me from my wine so I ended up shoving the cork into the bottle and enjoyed my drink.

Reviews.Title: “ares very good choice”
Reviews.Author: flyngtraveller
Reviews.Content: this hotel is elegant modern and warm in the mean time the staff is very gentle and helpful i will came soon with my wife for romantic gateaway .

Reviews.Title: “Oh me oh my, this is a gorgeous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wellykiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of our honeymoon and were so well taken care of we couldn't have asked for a better stay. Service: The service was lovely, when they learned we were on our honeymoon, they were sooo lovely, they upgraded us to a bigger and better room! They were helpful, ordered us a taxi to the airport, showed us great places to see in the area, and were really helpful in general. Room: Well, we got upgraded, so the room was brilliant! The bed was super super comfy, probably the most comfortable bed I've stayed in hotel-wise. The tv was fantastic, only drawback was that the keyboard they had for use when converting the tv into a computer, was poorly transmitted, meaning a hit and miss shot at typing. Bathroom was huge and luxurious, Hermes bath products and Versace tiles, pretty well as good as it gets :) Location and amenities: Location was fantastic, ten minutes to the Eiffel tower, what more could you want? Breakfast was amazing! We got down to the buffet room to find it all to ourselves and laden with croissants, pastries, fresh juices, excellent coffees, cereals, fruit, eggs, etc, I'd definitely recommend buying breakfast. Liked best: The breakfast. Liked least: Leaving. Overall brilliant value for money in expensive Paris, gentle and kind staff, gorgeous and sumptuous rooms, and perfect location, thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful -- felt very special!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineRoma
Reviews.Content: I loved ** the hotel -- fabulous new decoration, spacious and comfortable rooms, quiet, and luxurious bathroom products ** the staff who were very friendly and helpful; and ** its location -- near the Tour Eiffel, easy to walk everywhere, or well connected by public transport! A special treat, which made Spring in Paris even more special.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel deserves 10 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: lyzd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just lovely! The rooms were beatifully appointed, the bathrooms were luxurious, the bed and linens were comfortable and luxurious as well. The locatoin was very convenient to the Metro, many very good cafes and restaurants, and a quick 7 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. We cannot say enough about the staff - Mr. Casimieri, the owner, and Jliane and Isabelle gave us so many recommendations and put up with our many questions with smiles on their faces and really made us feel welcome. We arrived from the airport very early and no room was available yet, which we expected. The staff went over and above to make us feel welcome and comfortable, until a room was ready. We are so happy that we discovered this hotel, and we shall recommend it to anyone who cares to listen to us go on and on about it! We wish we could ive it 10 stars - it truly deserved it!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: octopus1234
Reviews.Content: It was great pleasant surprise to be at Hotel Ares designed with a lot of test, rooms have many different colours, the staff is really friendly and helpful, free wifi .the location is very good , 7 minutes walking to the Eiffel Tower , three lines metro just two minutes by feet full of restaurants behind the corner and a starbuck's cafe nearby . I recommend this hotel to whom likes luxury places

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rodneytrip
Reviews.Content: We had great day at Ares during our honeymoon in Paris. The Hotel has a great surrounding area with a lot of cafe and restaurants and the Eiffel Tower is just a walk away. The metro line and the bus stop is even closer. Rooms are really nice with a superb bathroom an comfort beds. The staff has always been nice and helpful. We stronly recommend the Ares Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Great ares”
Reviews.Author: Diabolik23
Reviews.Content: Very Nice Hotel wonderful staff perfect location near eiffeltower . My NeXT home in paris

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel luxury away from the hassle of tourist-hell”
Reviews.Author: graeme_ncl
Reviews.Content: As you've probably already gathered from the vast majority of the reviews on here, this is a really nice little hotel, tucked away on a quiet street in the 15th, very close to a Metro station and within easy walking distance of touristy stuff if that's what you want, and near dozens of excellent bars and eateries frequented by locals, if that's more your bag. We had a 'standard' room on the 6th floor and whilst I'll admit it was smaller that I expected, actually that really didnt end up bothering us. It was perfectly clean, incredibly well decorated and nice and cosy. The staff at the hotel were lovely (and spoke perfect English), and could not have been more welcoming or helpful. And whilst it is not of course Paris' cheapest hotel, its also nowhere near the most expensive, and so if you are looking for somewhere with bags of character (and Versace tiles and Hermes toitletries, no less), that is beautifully styled and as close as you need to be to everything without inhibiting the streets of millions of tourists, then you really should try this place.

Reviews.Title: “TOO MUCH MONEY FOR MINISCULE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: Maria149
Reviews.Content: The room size and specially the closet to hang our clothes are miniscule. the room had no space to open a bag. We had to put it on our bed to take out the clothes and as there are no room to put our clothes we had to open and close the bag on the bed every time we needed something. I think it is too expensive for the room the hotel offers. I will not recommend this hotel. At least at this price. If I knew the hotel was like this (not real information in this site) I would not have reserved it. It's not worth having an hotel so richly decorated and not offer the necessary confort to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amber8885
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel when I entered was how chic the lobby and reception were. Our room on the 6th floor was on the same level. We were left mini complimentary chocolates on the bed, which was quite nice. The room was a decent size and nicely decorated. A minibar, safe and hairdryer were in the cupboard in the room. The bathroom was the best bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel room, made with versace tiles! Both were extremely clean and well presented, as was the whole hotel. Staff were extremely friendly and willing to help at all times. They also spoke and understood English, which was helpful! The location was also in a prime place, a ten minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, and less than five minutes from a metro station. There were many shops and cafes nearby also. What I liked most about this hotel was the room and bathroom, and how clean it was, The location, as mentioned before, was also excellent. There is nothing at all that I disliked about this hotel. I would definitely recommend staying here. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GplusT
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this beautiful luxury boutique hotel. It is situated in a quiet lovely neighborhood which made us feel like this place was the perfect home away from home. We used it as our home base as we traveled to Courchevel and back to Paris so stayed at the hotel twice during our 3 week trip to France for a total of 13 days. There are many little stores and great cafes in the immediate area. Major sites are in walking distance and the metro is so close. The staff and service was impeccable and the rooms and bathrooms were very well kept and beautifully decorated. We traveled all the way from Honolulu, Hawaii and upon our arrival were jet lagged to say the least. The staff was incredible and worked to make sure we were perfectly accommodated. We cannot say enough about how we loved our time at the Hotel Ares Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnk3240
Reviews.Content: What a nice secluded hotel. Everything was perfect, which made our stay in Paris great. We were even met at check out by the owner who wanted to make sure eveything was fine....Everyone associated with Hotel Ares could not have been more cordial. Would definatley stay again....

Reviews.Title: “very beautiful and what you want while in paris”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellersyo
Reviews.Content: good looking and well designed. well thought out and good offerings. pricey, but worth it. we would rather pay a bit more for a room with a great view, great room, great amenities etc etc. than almost as much for other typical hotels in paris. not a tourist trap, and very Parisian.

Reviews.Title: “Ares Eiffel est magnifique”
Reviews.Author: JennikerIsle
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Ares Eiffel for an extended weekend in Paris after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel did not disappoint. Location: Located in the 15th Arr., but really just on the outskirts of the 7th. It was a delightful area to walk around and just around the corner from dozens of restaurants, cafes, pharmacies, florists, bakeries and the Monoprix. Although we didn't shop there, it is literally next door to the Swiss Market. It was also one block away from the Metro, which was incredibly convenient for getting to the rest of Paris. It was also a lovely walk from the Eiffel Tower. Within three minutes you are at the beginning of the Champs de Mars. It takes about another 20 minutes to reach the actual Eiffel Tower, but it is an enjoyable walk. Cleanliness: Literally the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. The entire hotel appears to have been recently renovated. Everything is sparkling white, fresh and immaculate. The sheets, beds and bathrooms looked like we were the first ones to use them (which is certainly not true so a credit to the housekeeping staff.) Rooms: We had a superior room and yes, it was small, but it was by no means tiny or claustrophobic. It served perfectly for people who go to Paris to be outside of the hotel! The bed was large and so so so comfortable. We literally had to peel ourselves out everyone morning because the mattress and sheets were heavenly. The room had a small desk (which we used to shelve our toiletries) and a very big flat screen TV. There was also internet through the TV and free WiFi throughout the hotel. The room also had a safe and a closet. Keep in mind that the closet and attached shelving is the only place to store clothing. There are not other drawers. We made do but we had some wrinkly clothes! There was a small table and chair in the room and a cute balcony. You could stand out the balcony for a quick picture or breath of fresh air. Bathrooms: The bathrooms are the star of the show! Immaculately clean and sparkly bright, the large tub had a rainshower faucet, which made for some refreshing showers (it does tend to leak all over the floor though.) There are dual sinks with delicious Hermes soaps, shampoos and lotions! A blow dryer, which was decently powerful, was attached to the wall. The toilet is in a separate chamber. Service: The owner was really nice and sweet and refused a tip after carrying our very heavy bags. The clerks at the front desk were fine. Not too helpful but polite enough. They called taxis for us many times, but were unable to help with recommendations for restaurants, etc. Go armed with your own list because they will NOT be able to help. I am not sure whet the actual check-in time, but we had no problem getting two rooms at 11:00 am. When it was time to check-out, the staff held our bags for us while we had a last romp around the neighborhood. Decor: The hotel is amazingly beautiful and decorated luxuriously. The lobby has beautiful window treatments, sofas, lamps, pillow, etc. etc. You can tell particular detail was made to every last decorating decision and the result was truly beautiful. Overall: When I return to Paris, I will be returning to the Ares Eiffel!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: BeccAndBarry
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in larger chain hotels but after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor we booked three nights in the Ares for our first trip to Paris. The hotel is in a good location with shops, bars, cafes and restaurants just around the corner aswell as a Starbucks and Macdonalds. The Motte Picquet metro station is only steps away with easy connections across the city however we visited many of the sites on foot as there's lots to see on the way. The Eiffel Tower and Trocadero Centre are only a ten minute walk from the hotel. Our room at the Ares was spotlessly clean and the decor was chic and modern. The mini bar was great at only €5 per night for as many drinks as you want. The staff at the Ares were always friendly, our train home was not until the evening so they stored our bags behind the reception after we checked out. The only slight issue we encountered was we found the walls in our room to be quite thin. We could clearly hear guests in the adjoining rooms talking, showering etc. Not great if you're a light sleeper and want an early night or lie in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: zabolo
Reviews.Content: I did spend two night at Ares with my girlfriend during my first gateway to Europe. The Hotel is excellent. The room was gorgeous (my girlfriend loved the Versace tiles in the bathroom) and very clean. We loved the surrounding area full of restaurants and cafe and the staff gave us a lot of goog suggestions anbout where to go. We really enjoyed our stay at Ares.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Valentine's Day in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ladyalice13
Reviews.Content: After a disasteous first attempt in a different hotel in Paris, we found this one after a quick search on TA. It was incredibly easy to find, and even though the hasty online reservation we had made had not yet registeredin the Ares computer system when we arrived, they found a room for us immediately and checked us in with the web price (at a discount). The lobby is very modern and stylish (and clean, which was most important to us at that point), and the clerk was very friendly and efficient. Our fifth floor room was a delight (it is not very accessible to those with a disability though; there are a few stairs once you step off the elevator on that floor. It was not huge as we had only requested a standard room, but it had plenty of space for the two of us. The bed was large and very comfortable with enough pillows for us and our whole wedding party. The TV was emblazoned with a personalized welcome message and the free mini bar was welcome after driving all day. Free wireless internet was fast and easy to access and the bathroom is a story unto itselt. I loved that there was a room for the toilet (with a phone, just in case), and a vanity room with towel warmer, Versace tiles, double sink and every Hermes bath product you could ever need. It was very roomy and super clean. We loved the decor of the room - very unique and boutique styled. The window with miniature balcony revealed the very tip top of the Eiffel Tower and a lovely church in the distance. After a lovely deep sleep, (no noise from adjoining rooms, although we could hear the neighbours across the hall) we tried the breakfast. It was not as expansive as those we enjoyed in Germany, but even as a vegetarian I did alright. We filled up fairly well and headed out for the day. The housekeepers came while we were out and arranged everything in tip top shape, adding extra toiletries since our room was only made up for one the day before (remember, no reservation). We checked out after two beautiful nights at 1200. Since our flight wasn't until 2000hrs, the staff offered to keep our significant amount of luggage behind their desk for the day. The owner was there when we were checking out and asked us how we had enjoyed our stay and if we had any suggestions. He then offered us a coffee before we headed out for the day; he made it himself and left us to enjoy it in the chic lobby lounge. (It was very good). The only thing I would not recommend is making use of the parking arrangements. Parking in Paris - especially so close to the tower - is scarce so the hotel has an arrangement with a nearby supermarket. One way streets make it a bit tricky to find, and the street that houses the market is what I would call sketchy...and expensive at 14 EU/night. On that note, I just plain wouldn't recommend driving in Paris at all. It is a frustrating and frightening experience and you can walk everywhere. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. A bit pricy, but beautiful, well-located, clean and stylish. It was the best of how we imagined Paris and had just the right amount of romance for our Valentine's trip. We adored it and hope they will have available rooms the next time we find ourselves in the city of lights.

Reviews.Title: “We had just one night in Paris - so glad we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: khn2011
Reviews.Content: Awesome service! We were traveling in Paris for one day and night only. Our flight landed early in the morning, so when we arrived at the hotel we assumed we'd have to simply drop off our bags and head out for a day of tourism without a real opportunity to freshen up. But to our surprise, when we arrived at the hotel, our room was ready and they let us check-in super early! It was a perfect start to our one day in this amazing city. Great location for the tourist! Very close to the Eiffel Tower, around the corner from several delicious cafes, right by a metro station. Friendly staff, luxurious rooms, overall a great place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Ares”
Reviews.Author: silverghost_11
Reviews.Content: I Discover the Ares through tripadvisor and I decided to reserve I have been completely satisfate for everithing .I recommend to all that likes nice places , I will come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel situated close to the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: Gsedge1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ares with my girlfriend and we both really enjoyed our stay. The whole hotel is fashionably decorated, it’s very clean, and there's was no noise from either local or hotel residents to disturb your sleep. Its 10min (max) walk to the Eiffel tower. If you’re looking for a romantic weekend away and want to impress with the hotel then you can’t go wrong with the Ares.

Reviews.Title: “lovely ares”
Reviews.Author: overthetop94
Reviews.Content: my Factory reserved to me and other collegues The ares and we were really satisfied for the lovely choice of top quality materials attention at the details and the great breakfast .free internet ,great locatio,We were also surprised how the staff was helpful and gentle to reserve us taxis restaurants and others many things we need i will recommend to all my friends that wants to go to paris

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Ares”
Reviews.Author: totonda
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the internet after all the recommendations found on TA. The choice was perfect. Thre hotel is conveniently located in a quiet area, surrounded by restaurants and coffee shops. Metro and buses are walking distance, as is the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are clean and really beautiful (the bathroom deserves a word of its own) and the staff has always been helpful and corteous. A+

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms but TERRIBLE staff and service!!!”
Reviews.Author: katienluke
Reviews.Content: Although the title emphasises the poor quality of staff and service at this hotel it must be noted that the rooms themselves are beautiful and the decor is very unique. The rooms are immaculately clean and the bathroom/shower is fantastic with Versace tiles!!! Unfortunately the top quality rooms are let down by the very rude and ignorant staff who work in the hotel. On arrival we were greeted by the front desk staff with not even a smile or a hello and they were very blunt during our check in with very little to say to us. As first time visitors to Paris we were given no help or guidance on the local amenities or places of interest and when we did ask it almost seemed as if it was too much effort to try and translate in to English for us. As for the maids they were extremely rude and abrupt, they entered our room on various occassions without even knocking, one of the times being when the maid threw a magazine in our room in anger and slammed the door! The other maid who entered without knocking came to fill the mini bar and on her entrance she shook her head at us and commented on the mess in our room, I think she may have needed to be reminded that we were paying customers and could have our room in what ever state we wanted seeing as we were on holiday!!! Due to these events the decor and location of this hotel does not outwiegh the rudeness of the staff and therefore would not recommend the hptel to friend as we are frinedly happy people who want to be greeted with a smile!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thornolo
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Ares for our Paris getaway after reading all the positive comments on Tripadvisor. The choice could not be better. The hotel is located in a quiet area very close to public transporattion. The staff is really helpful (including the owner) and the rooms are clean and beautifully decorated (we liked the bathroom very much). We strongly reccomend Ares Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: puffingirl73
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely small hotel close to the Eiffel tower & Ecole Militaire in a quiet street. Room was nicely decorated and spotless. Small lounge area and breakfast room. Breakfast was very nice, good choice of eats, and @16 euros is worth the spend if you want to fill up for a long days walk around the sights. Good value when you realise tea and croissant alone is at least 7 euros elsewhere. Many local eateries nearby and an excellent seafood restaurant at the end of the road. Staff very helpful and polite. If arriving at CDG only one change to get to hotel. Sunday market with lovely food stalls nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with really excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: GavinB79
Reviews.Content: Everything we hoped for really- reception were great, nothing was too much trouble. Rooms clean and tidy. Location is great, quiet with local antique shops- very close to Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Livelife060
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying here, front desk staff very helpful. Small breakfast room, but lovely French pastries. Rooms are really nice, small, but don't forget you are in central Paris lovely decor.safe and small supermarket close by. Found a very nice fish place to eat, not too expensive. Nice French area, not too busy with tourists. The park is only short walk away for people watching. Would love to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed, new hotel in a good area - highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Businesslounger
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on tripadvisor, and am so glad I booked to stay there. It is immaculately presented, with professional and helpful staff. The rooms are well-decorated, and I especially loved the Hermes and Etro bathroom compliments. The room was small, but I suspect that to be the case with most hotels in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “could not be better”
Reviews.Author: shark_11
Reviews.Content: I spent with my wife last part of my tavel in europe at hotel Ares to discover paris , i was not disappointed at all ,i was very happy for the hotel design attention at details and the high standard of materials like tv bang and olufsen funitures poltrona frau or lights cristal of baccarat , Like you can undestant i am very fond of hotel Ares and not only for the nice things used but for the staff too that helped us a lot to find and reserve nice restaurants always ready to help you for everythig,the location is perfect and is full of restaurants around , the metro is only one minute to walk with three lines that drives you every where in paris without changes .I will recommend thi hotel to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “Ares Hotel, Amazing, Brillant, You Must Stay Here...”
Reviews.Author: yasandwill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ares Hotel for our mini-honeymoon, in Jan 2011. The entrance to hotel is beautifully designed, stylish and sumptuous, with lovely swarovski chandeliers. As soon as you enter you hope that your room is going to be as stylish as the lobby and guest lounge. You will not be dissappointed! On entering the room we were stunned by the plush decor,the fittings and detail of decoration, it was simply stunning. We have stayed in some lovely boutique hotels, but this hotel sets new standards. The hotel manager / owner is lovely and really will go out of his way to ensure your stay is as perfect as you desire. The hotel receptionst was polite and courteous and will help you at every opportunity and the night porter was simply lovely, we asked for some ice for some champagne and he rushed away to bring us back a lovely bucket full of ice. The hotel is ideally situated for tube travel and general access to the many beautiful tourists sites in Paris. While staying you must find the Le Petite Marsaque Patisserie, which is just a short walk away around the corner (closed on Tuesdays) amazing - simply amazing cakes. There are many excellent restaurants nearby and the neighboured is warm and welcoming. We would highly recommend you stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ads298
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the glorious reviews on Trip Advisor. The first sign this wouldn’t be a great stay was when the cab driver could not find the address. Once in our room, I literally could not believe how small it was. The entire floor space was taken up by the bed. The hotel claims to be a luxury boutique establishment, but it was not. Yes there are Hermes bath products, but the shower in the bathroom leaked so badly, when you used it the entire bathroom got soaked. Very uncomfortable and disappointing experience overall. We left after one night. I do not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: chewingum62
Reviews.Content: very nice and very alot of attention at details the breakfast is great the hotel is very clean and calm the staff frienly and helpful..the location is only five minutes from Eiffel tower and one minute from the tube with three lines driving you every where without changes i will come back soon and recommend the Ares to all that like nice places

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base from which to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: guitarslim
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for my birthday and is tucked away in a nice suburb of Paris, away from the main road a block away and under 10mins walk from the grand Eiffel Tower. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and the room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. Paris is an ultra expensive city to visit and I guess this is also reflected in the hotel prices. However, overall I would recommend it without hesitation. Other than the price it was perfect for our comfy base to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb but Guests were a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: wrigst
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to celebrate her Birthday. Cannot fault the location and the staff were amazing. Isabelle was so friendly and helpful from the moment I called to book, to the moment we left. The rooms were also spectacular - well designed and immaculately laid out. Everything in the hotel was clean and tidy. Our only issue was with some of the guests who were staying there.
