They decided it would be great fun to slam the doors at 2-3am in the morning which meant my wife didn't get much sleep. The hotel staff were a little slow to pick up and investigate this, but I guess they cannot be responsible for all guests behaviour. Another thing which would improve this hotel would be room service. It seems a shame that although breakfast is really nice, and there is a mini bar in each room that there is no provision for room service. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel, not only for the impressive service and decor, but for the good proximity to the Eiffel Tower and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: juppalo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem. I did spend 3 nights at Ares with my girlfriend to celebrate our anniversary and everything was perfect. The hotel is extremely clean and nice, the staff has always been helpful and the location is super. The surrounding area is full of bistrots, restaurants and cafe. Public transportation is just around the corner and the Eiffel Tower is walking distance. We will get back at Ares.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: minty77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel around mid august. After reading very positive reviews, I booked the hotel, but I must say I could have gotten a better hotel. The location is decent, the people were not friendly at all. I think it's like a family owned business or something, the people there were very unpleasant, so it made us feel very unhappy. I would not choose any boutique hotels again after this hotel because it just seems like a town house where it is less private and walls are thin. You hear everything. The beds were pretty uncomfortable and there was hair that wasn't ours in the bed when we arrived, I think that is pretty disgusting. The pictures you see are not like the rooms we got, I think those pictures are all the best rooms, the room we got was pretty small and I think there are plenty of nicer hotels in paris for the price. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody, I didn't find anything special about this hotel like the reviews said and the water was funny in the shower, the water was hot and cold on and off during the shower which was extremely inconvenient. I think you can definitely do better hotels than this in paris. Look somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jabbola
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Ares and enjoyed every one of them. The hotel is great. Rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated. The TV is a B&O LCD screen. The free WiFi is fast and the minibar is only 5 euros/day flat. The staff has always been very corteous and ready to help. The surrounding area is minutes away form restaurants, cafe and public transportation. The Ares Eiffel is strongly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: val8700
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the metro, convenience stores, restaurants. The room was comfortable and a reasonable size. The shower was hot and powerful. It tended to get a pretty noisy in the mornings as there was a school nearby and you could hear the children screaming during playtime and the church bells chiming every half hour. Also, on our last day, we wanted to get an extension for our room (either late check-out or a half-day rate) and though the hotel wasn't full, the lady at the reception refused to agree to either and insisted on charging the full day rate. This pretty much soured our impression of the hotel and but for this incident we would have give the hotel a better rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location, worth returning back!”
Reviews.Author: BharatYatri
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and I must say we were not disappointed. We stayed in the superior room of this centrally located hotel for four nights. Nice and clean room, beautifully decorated.The room was cleaned daily. Hotel staff did not disturb us.Breakfast was good and filling.At the time of our stay, you could enjoy the mini bar with coke, water and juice for two people at 5 euros a day.Luggage hold facility allowed us to travel the whole day after check out without worrying about our stuff.we had a very comfortable stay here and slept so peacefully on all nights. A little expensive but worth the cost. I would recommend this hotel. However if you need extra water bottles, buy it from the general store on the main road (3 mins walk from hotel, very very cheap). Location of the hotel is very good, metro line is 2 min walk and eiffel tower just 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosbo79
Reviews.Content: This hotel really sets standards. The interior is beautiful, rooms are clean and the staff is super. The location is very near to bus and the metro line. The area has a lot of restaurants and cafe around and the Eiffel Tower is jjust 5 minutes away. A+

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: binkbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the recommendation of a friend and we, in turn, would recommend to our friends. We liked that it is very cozy and low key but very close to Metro and food, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't an ideal stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellergirl75
Reviews.Content: I booked Ares as a birthday surprise for my husband. It was a one night trip so it was important that we were close to all the sites. We couldn't have been happier with the location. It was close to the metro and within walking distance to all the sites. When we arrived the receptionist spoke great English and our room was ready even though we arrived early. The room was tiny but exceptionally clean and modern. I am 8 months pregnant so I booked the a more expensive hotel because it was important for me to have a room I was happy to relax in. After dinner we decided to go back to the hotel to watch a movie and rest our tired feet. Unfortunately the room was freezing(and didn't get any warmer when we turned on the heating) and the TV movies didn't work . When I complained to reception they said they could send up a heater , which they didn't so I had to call them again. When the night porter came up and I told him about the TV he just shrugged his shoulder and said, 'the provider sometimes doesn't work on a saturday so there is nothing I can do'. Not ideal for a room which cost nearly £200 !!! Would I go back again....no .....would i recommend it ...no...there are plenty of other hotels in Paris to try.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: xleannex19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ares for 3 nights in October with my boyfriend. I'd been told by friends that you have to be very careful with the hotels in Paris as they can be very hit and miss. So we figured we should pay that little extra to be sure to get somewhere decent to stay. Well all I can say is that we were not disappointed! This place was more 'perfect' than decent! We arrived 2 hours prior to check-in time and expected just to be able to leave our bags at the hotel until we could get to our room. However we were pleased when we were able to check in there and then with no hassles at all. The room was small (as are most paris hotels i'm told) but beautiful. We payed a little extra for a superior room so I can't say what the standard rooms were like but I'm guessing they were just as lovely. The beds were made daily with fresh towels everyday also, and on the second day we came back we found 2 pairs of fresh Ares slippers waiting for us which we thought was a lovely touch! The only downfall is that the hotel is quite near a school so there was quite a lot of noise in the mornings but nothing major and it didn't affect our stay at all. We bumped into the manager a few times and he was very nice and friendly and couldnt do enough for us. He was very eager to please but not OTT - just what i like! We were room only so i can't comment on the breakfast but i'm sure it is just as good as everything else in the Ares! Would go back in a second - definately the perfect stay at the perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: petergoeshollywood
Reviews.Content: Second time in Paris and second time at Ares. This boutique hotel is a true gem. The location is perfect, away from crowd but minutes from the Eiffel tower and public transportation. Rooms are top quality and the staff is very helpful. Minibar is only 5 euro flat per day and the WiFi (very goos speed) is free.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sonia1785
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Ares during our honeymoon in Paris. It's clean, the decor is modern and chic and the staff are very polite and helpful! The hotel is conveniently located near Champ de Mars and the Eiffel Tower (about a 10 minute walk). There are plenty of cafes nearby. Thank you for a lovely stay and for making our honeymoon very special!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: vallefiorana88
Reviews.Content: Very littel to add to all the positive reviews you can find on TA. The location is great, minutes away from the Eiffel tower and public transportation. The surrounding are has many restaurants and cafe. Rooms are top quality and the staff is super. A+

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: fiorana
Reviews.Content: Very littel to add to all the positive reviews you can find on TA. The hotel is conveniently located minutes away from the Eiffel Tower and public transportation. Plenty of good restaurants and cafe in the area. Rooms ares top quality and the staff is extremely friendly and ready to help. A+

Reviews.Title: “Nice people in a beautiful place.”
Reviews.Author: Jean-ChristianS
Reviews.Content: bathroom coule be larger. rest was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries, Quality Place, Absolutly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: AtyourLeisure
Reviews.Content: Subway is around the other side of the building, Eiffel Tower maybe a 10 minute walk. Could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our top floor room! Location is quiet. Lots of shops and cafe's around. Did not partake in the morning breakfast, too expensive for a family of 4, but that was my choice. Front desk staff were agreeable and conversational. Plenty of maps on hand and willingly gave them out and helped with directions. I would not hesitate to stay here again if the location was convienent for my purpose, but admittedly would probably seek a less expensive rate per night. Tough to find a family room for 4 in Paris, though so want can you do. If I were paying the single or couples rate, I'd have no issue. Again no hesitation to recommend this as a "sure thing" and known commodity if the location is convienent for your purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, but...”
Reviews.Author: bunee
Reviews.Content: Found this place after looking on Trip Advisor and finding a great deal. Hotel was in a very quiet location and rooms were beautiful. Amenities were great quality too. The check in was very smooth and easy, plus free wi-fi which was good. We had a room on the 2nd floor (just at the top of the stairs) and even though the hotel area was quiet, at 6am when the laundry truck came it was terribly noisy! Banging doors and trolleys going in and out of the truck, the noise was loud. Definitely could not sleep in. I think my views of the hotel would not be tainted by this if we were on a higher floor or not near the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Another Stay at the Ares”
Reviews.Author: RagtopBeetle
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Ares. We chose to end our European vacation there because we new we wouldn't be disappointed. And we were right. The Ares was as we remembered and as we expected. The room was comfortable and clean and its amenities were top notch. Once again, the staff was helpful and courteous. It's always nice when the staff at the hotel you are staying in recognize that this is YOUR VACATION and try to ensure good memories. The Ares did this for us once again. NOTE: The closest Metro is about two blocks away but easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambience”
Reviews.Author: shellshott
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fabulous - and they were huge by Paris standards. Loved the decorating - very art deco but trendy at the same time. Bathroom - also huge - 2 sinks - excellent for the 3 of us - and separate shower and bath - again, very unusual. Like the process of paying 5 Euros each day for all the soft drinks and water in the fridge - as long as you use most everything in there, it is a great deal. The rates were rather high although Paris in general is expensive. Location was great. Close to the metro, close to the Eiffel Tower and lots of great cafes in the area. Staff were ok - not very friendly - like pulling teeth to get a map of the area - huge improvement could be made in that area. It would be good, for a tourist city, to have suggestions of what to do - or at the very least when you check in have them ask "would you like a map of Paris" - many other hotels do this - and it is a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: vaishyv
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is small but simply gorgeous. Each room in the hotel is tastefully decorated and its all the small personal touches that make this place amazing. We stayed in the pink room and our bed was SO comfy, that I didn't want to get out of it. The hotel owner came to introduce himself to us, and it was clear to see how proud he is of his empire. Can't wait to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beat Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot. We found this little hotel on Trip Advisor. We used Thankyou Network points for our stay. The hotel is small but very friendly and welcoming. They are just enough off the beaten path to be in a quiet neighborhood...but close enough to everything to make it really a great location. 10-15 minute walk to Eiffel Tower...5 minute walk to the metro, which is quick, safe, and efficient. You can get anywhere in less than 20 minutes I'd say. Hotel staff is comprised of one person behind the counter...but that's all you need for this small hotel. Everything we needed, from dinner reservations to directions were always handled promptly and friendly. What a great little hotel. The shower was like a waterfall...awesome. The bed was firm but comfortable. The room size was cozy but adequate. Cleanliness was superb. Mini-fridge stocked with water and soda for a flat 5 Euro per day fee...not bad. I really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: miclaLausanne
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Arès very occasionally for more than 15 years, because of its location (wonderful transportation connections and a quiet street), but I was totally unprepared to discover the profound transformation that it has undergone over the past years. The result is superb! The rooms have been redecorated/redesigned to the highest standard with an attention to detail that even palaces sometimes miss. All the small amentities are there, including a safe, slippers, plush towels and plumbing that not only works but it aesthetic as well. Don't go looking for a fitness centre and a pool. It's not that kind of hotel. On the other hand, lots of great restaurants are within a stone's throw. Rooms are smallish, the stairwell access is convoluted, but the hotel is quiet, clean, beautifully located, so what more can you wish? Furthermore, the owners and staff are charming, something sufficiantly rare in Paris to be mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Simply splendid!!”
Reviews.Author: etrusko2009
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this splendid hotel with my wife and two kids (2 and 5). 5 tripadvisor stars really deserved. very good position, 10 minutes walking from the eiffel tower and few meters from the metro station. delicious breakfast. very clean. cordial and helpful staff. spacious rooms. reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful personal service in a lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: elisalite
Reviews.Content: It's the little things you notice that sets the Ares apart from other Paris places - Enrico (the owner) sharing a bottle of champagne he had received as a sample - the hermes bath products and the lovely breakfast - all made for a more intimate relaxed time. Would stay here again !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in an ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: travelswithncm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ares Eiffel for 4 nights in mid October and had a wonderful time. The hotel is spotless, our room was comfortable (even had a small balcony) and the owner is so helpful. The street is quiet yet you are only a block from amazing cafes and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Exactly what a hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: Elle630
Reviews.Content: This is our first time in Paris. I spent a lot of time researching hotel and my husband happened upon a website that mentioned The Ares Eiffel. We look through the site and felt it was perfect for us. That was before we arrived. When we landed at Charles De Galle I was nervous but excited. Between the pair of us we don't have much experience with the French language and worried about just how we would get around. We took a taxi to the hotel and once inside were warmly greeted. In English. When we arrived much earlier than their standard check in timevwe were upgraded to a better room and allowed to check in right away! The room is beautiful. We were given room 62. The décor is so chic. The lighting is just right, the beds superb and the bathroom toiletries are delicious smelling Hèrmés. Prior to our trip I purchased a few power converters to avoid problems Well as Murphy's Law would have it, one of them blew a spark and all of our lights went out. I felt awful yet when we went to the reception area and explained what happened we were told it wasn't a problem and they would fix it. They did and seemed to still like us. :) I love this hotel. The people running it are magnifique! It is centrally located in a gorgeous residential neighborhood so you feel as though you are a Parisien rather than a tourist and we've had lovely experiences thus far with the staff here and at a local restaurant where I was shy about ordering in French but they spoke English and kindly ( in no way did I feel mocked) helped me to pronounce what I was trying to say. The restaurant is Café Brasserie Le Suffren. It is close by and has wonderful food and people. This is only our first day and already I felt the need to sing their praises.

Reviews.Title: “The Ares is unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: NewyorkDiscoverer
Reviews.Content: I found thé ares through the web and for me wasvery nice surprise thé hotel has been renewed completely just two years ago with a lot of taste free wi fi and fitnes clubj just 50 metersfrom thé hôtel with sauna and hammam complymentary for thé hôtel guests location is ijust fie minutes to walkfrom thé hôtel an for business you havé three lines of métro just les t han 2minutes walk thé staff is wonderful and always readyto help you for anything you need.Iwillcome back and recommend strongly this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: aztravellover007
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 30th anniversary in Paris and we're glad we chose Ares Eiffel as our home away from home. A small Parisian hotel in a residential area. Located around the corner from the metro which was very easy to navigate, many restaurants, cafes and a wonderful outdoor market on Sundays/Wednesdays several blocks away. The Eiffel Tower is an easy 10 minute walk. Our accommodation was beautifully appointed and very comfortable with a king bed, large double windows that opened to a small balcony facing a courtyard and a large bathroom with double sinks. The staff spoke English and were very helpful in recommending restaurants nearby, making reservations and confirming our shuttle to the airport. We will definitely stay at Ares Eiffel again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kari1234
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris, France. I enjoyed the hotel because the staff was friendly and hotel was clean. The bathroom was fantastic and the bed were comfy. The only con was the kids playing in school yard. I awoke to lots sounds of kids playing. I could hear the EVERYTHING. Close to shops, and restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Very nich stay”
Reviews.Author: LuganoAndrea
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms, clean and friendly environment. Thank you very much to the staff for the nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: clcollar
Reviews.Content: Although a bit pricey the hotel is lovely. Walk to the Eiffel Tower in 5mins, some fab restaurants on the main road behind the hotel, and metro 2 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little quiet place, convenient location, beautifully decorated”
Reviews.Author: swk_10
Reviews.Content: Very nicely decorated, boutique style hotel, near Eiffel tower area. Very pleasant staff, very convenient location (one or two blocks from metro). Classic Room pretty small--double size bed, with very little room to walk around the bed. Terrace with french doors a nice perk. Able to hear other guests through door/wall at times. Bathrooms very nice, with nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with special touches and good location”
Reviews.Author: nicolema16
Reviews.Content: This being me and my husbands first trip to Paris, I would say Ares Eiffel met our needs. We took the Rossybus from the airport to the Opera station and then took the metro to the hotel. It was a little hard to find, but I had a good map of the area with me. We ended up taking the hotel shuttle to the airport on the way home it was 45 euros for 2 people. After lugging around luggage all morning, it was a pleasant surprise to open the door to our room and see such a nicely decorated clean room. One of my favorite things was the doors open up and you can get some fresh air. The bathroom is a good size. The bathtub is a little odd though-it is a very big step to get into the tub and it has a glass door that only covers 1/3 of the tub so the floor is always wet. The room is a small, we had a superior, but I honestly didn't mind because of how nicely it was appointed. I felt like I was in someones apartment. We didn't not have breakfast at the hotel as we thought it would be fun to get croissants from a different boulangerie each day. The concierge has helpful in getting us restaurant reservations. The hotel is in more of a residential area, which I liked. I do, however, agree with a previous poster who commented on the lack of nightlife. There are about 3 or 4 cafes in the immediate area, but thats it. We would spend our night in another part of town and have a nightcap at the of the local cafes. The closet metro stop is La Motte-Picquet Grenelle which connects to 3 different metro lines. After spending all day sightseeing it was nice to come back to such a warm and welcoming hotel with caring staff.

Reviews.Title: “A well run Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dapapabear
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, elegant Hotel, the location is good for public transportation, nice discount shopping nearby, a short walk to the army museum and Eiffel Tower. Staff is very nice, owners are there almost every day, and they really care about making this the best boutique Hotel in Paris.... One note: this hotel can be hard to find at first, so take a map off the internet for your taxi, or yourself as the street is sometimes not named on tourist maps. This is a bit of a blessing since Paris is a noisy city, and as the hotel is off the main street, it is very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel that gives a...”
Reviews.Author: BeeHYW
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel that gives a luxurious experience. We are in the executive room with a sofa bed. Though the room is a bit too small it is well decorated and thought through. It is also very convenient to major locations and tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel with an extra special touch”
Reviews.Author: EGANSMIND
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel situated within 5-10 minute walk of the Eiffel Tower. Nearest Metro La Motte-Picquet Grenelle was only 2 minutes around the corner A nice little Sunday Market was about 4 minutes away on the main road under the bridge The deco in the Hotel was very nice and Paris chic and we had an iPad given to us for the duration of our stay with free wi-fi. You can ask at the desk for a username and password. The rooms were typical French and small with no much room for clothes but we only stayed for 2 nights so that didnt matter to us. The extra special touch was providing Hermes Soap, a Bang & Olufson TV, Versace tiles in the bathroom, free wifi, iPad and iMac for use in the lobby. We were always greeted with a smile by Isabelle and an Airport Shuttle was organised for us to get to the Airport. This cost 34 euros but it was shared transportation. We were very impressed and it defiantely has the WOW factor. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in residential area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: drs64
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel and the staff. The rooms were small but charming and elegant. Modern and clean

Reviews.Title: “Service really stands out in this very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyork2
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Ares Eiffel hotel was wonderful. The rooms were very nice. The beds were great. The location was extremely quiet and a short walk to the Eiffel tower (an even shorter walk to several metro stations on lines running through the heart of the city without making any connections). But, even though all those things were great, the desk staff really set this place apart for us. During our stay we met a morning and a night person running the front desk and both were fantastic. On our first day my wife asked them to call two restaurants for us to confirm our reservations (hard to be certain of them with the language barrier) and they were happy to do so. They spoke very good English (sadly we don't speak French) and helped us with a cab for dinner one night, cab to the airport and several other small requests. The people at Ares Eiffel were the cream of the crop.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with superior amenities”
Reviews.Author: PBhan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights in October. The hotel is very close to metro station with lot of restaurants and Eiffel tower nearby. The hotel is new, offering high end amenities like Bang and Olufsen flat screen Tvs and Hermes vanity items. I had a Deluxe room on 2nd floor. The rooms are relatively smaller by US standards. Breakfast which was included in the room price is average. The owner of the hotel and the lady at the frontdesk are always willing to help and will offer suggestions on restaurants nearby. The only glitch is that electronic system like internet etc does not work all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CRoseRuss
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ares was a pleasant suprise from booking a sight unseen on the internet. Located in a quiet neighborhood away from the Paris hustle and buste. Which depending on how you view that can be a good or bad thing. If this hotel was located on Rue Du Rivoli you would pay well over a thousand a night. With that being said, I totally loved this Hotel. My friends and I were celebrating a milestone birthday for her and had decided to try this hotel. Rooms have been renovated with decorator touches throughout. The staff is very friendly and the owner charming. The eiffel tower is a 5 minute walk with bistros and metro nearby. A small market is within a block for that small touch of home. Hotel Ares offers free internet and is equipt with safe in room, hair dryers and minibar. All in all Hotel Ares was a wondeful stay and when in Paris again will certainly use them.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claude64
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has great accomodation,clean,quiet,comfortable beds and staff who are extremely helpful. Would come back to stay when next in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jzunica
Reviews.Content: If you need a comfortable, clean, great looking hotel in Paris the Ares Eiffel is for you. The rooms are great, the WiFi is free, the minibar is just 5 euros flat and the staff is very nice. They have an answer (and tips) for everything. The location is simply super. Minutes from public transportation, restaurants, shops... and the Eiffel Tower. The area is calm ans safe. A+

Reviews.Title: “Just Gorgeous - One of the best night's sleep we had the whole trip!”
Reviews.Author: twogirlstravels
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! - Our first trip to Paris so we were not sure where to stay but looked on trip advisor and read many reviews about this hotel. So glad we visited because it was just gorgeous. Had a double room with a sofa bed (one of the best I have ever slept on!) For two girls travelling together and their first time in Paris - great place to stay. Decor just divine and not just the rooms the whole hotel! - staff just gorgeous and so helpful - no problem with the language barrier as both receptionists spoke English really well - lovely breakfast - amazing coffee - close to the Eiffel Tower and within walking distance to transport. Only downfall couldn't stay longer - We will definately come back next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian hotel for romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: anyohaseyo7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had an amazing 2 night stay at Hotel Ares Eiffel from 20-22 Sept. We decided on Ares Eiffel after trawling through the numerous tripadvisor recommended Paris hotels, and its highly rated standing by tripadvisor users has certainly proven true for us. In our opinion, the hotel location is superb (just a 2 minute walk from the metro station, located on a quiet street just parallel to a main road which has lots of French restaurants, and a delightful Parisian cafe called Secco just a few blocks ago), the room was luxuriously decorated and comfortable (our room was on the 6th floor, with a balcony!) and the receptionist Emmanuelle was very helpful and cheery (thumbs up for great hotel service and for the recommendations on good restaurants!). Would certainly return to stay at Ares Eiffel on our next trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay - excellent location, friendly staff, modern plumbing and amenities”
Reviews.Author: NDGangy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in a Superior Room and we'll be back! The staff was bend-over-their-back helpful and friendly. The location was quiet, which after roaming around the chaos of Paris streets and landmarks, is a good thing. Also, important to travelers from the US, the plumbing is modern and updated (strong shower pressure, nice fixtures), as is the A/c (got the room very cold, very easily). Further, the room itself was quiet in that we couldn't hear the people above/next to us. If we had to offer a drawback, it was that a children's school or daycare center is around the block and during recess, the kids can be somewhat noisy. However, this happened around lunchtime and frankly, you should be out and about enjoying the city during this time anyways - it was a good excuse to get out of bed and get over the jet lag the first day there. All and all, the hotel was modern, clean and comfortable and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: SophieZhang
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights. It's 5 minutes walk to see Effiel tower and Military Ecole right in front of you. It's quiet and convenient location. The hardware such as TV( B&O), soap( Hermes), Lotions are great, as well as their service. On our last day, We want to have some seafood, the owner recommended us the restaurant " Vin and Marie" in the neighbourhood. We ordered the seafood platter which turned out to be the best meal during our two weeks' trip in France. Merci beacoupe. And the mini bar 5 euro per day is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: LeeLane L
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 6 night stay at this hotel. Rooms were beautiful but small. Location of the hotel was great..... we were able to walk to restaurants & Eiffel tower. Only issues were with a fridge that did not work.... likely hadnt for a while.... and a taxi strike that left us very stressed when told by staff that we could not get to airport. As it turns out a few phone calls and we were able to get a taxi. This was the first hotel that we stayed at that did not have a coffee maker in the room. We love our first cup of coffee before we leave the room..... and will likely invest in a 2 cup coffee maker for the next time we travel....just did not expect to not have a coffee maker in the room. Great hotel, great staff, great locations. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon76
Reviews.Content: First visit to Paris, excellent hotel. We stayed in a classic room, which was small but there was enough room to get around the bed, store clothing in cupboards and a place for our suitcase. room was well decorated with good shower in the bathroom. For a flat 5 euros you also get to use minibar, which contained 2 bottles of water, 2 bottles of orangina, 2 bottle of perrier water (sparkling), 1 diet coke and a normal coke. Fridge was restocked each day we were out. - This was excellent value given a coke in a bar is normally 4-5 Euros. We stayed on 6th Floor (7 in total) in room 63 and could see top of Eiffel tower from our room which also had a small balcony. Hotel Location is great, Eiffel Tower 5-10 min walk, Metro stop at Le Motte Picquet Grenelle only two mins away. If you plan to go the Palace Versailles direct train from Champ De Mars Tour Eiffel stop about 5-10 mins away. Food, We didn't eat at the hotel instead we went to a number of cafes , for around 9 Euros you get bread, jam, crossiant, coffee and Orange juice. Our preferred cafe was Le Bouquet Grenelle (on the corner by La Motte Picquet Metro stop) We liked the cafe because it was fast service and they give you freshly squeezed orange juice, it is a noisy busy area and nice to see the world go by. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: corocorro
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is a true gem. Conveniently located in a safe, quiet and nice area has everyting you need. It's close to the metro and buses, the surroinding are has plenty of bistrots and coffee shops to choose from and the Eiffel Tower is at walking distance. Rooms are extremely nice with flat LCDB&O Tv and the bathroom deserves a word of its own. The staff is extremely friendly and always ready to help. Reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “my next home in paris”
Reviews.Author: tarci33
Reviews.Content: i discovered the ares on trip advisor and i was really satisfied the hotel is marvellous the staff is gentle and helpful for every queston you can ask the location perfect with the meto station at few steps and eiffel tower just five minutes walking , the ares will be my next home in paris , i strongly recommendthis hotel

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravellots2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay at Ares Eiffel and were satisfied with every aspect of our stay. This hotel gets the highest praise of any city hotel we have stayed in. The location is in a very quiet neighborhood, the room we stayed in was the executive room as our daughter was with us for her 30th birthday, and there was ample room for all three of us and our luggage. I sometimes read about how small Parisian hotel rooms are and although this is our first trip to Paris we have ventured thruout Germany,U.K., and Italy and my husband travels globally for work...this hotel is the best ever. The executive room has a very large bathroom... two persons can easily get ready at one time...only ever seen one larger bathroom in Europe and it was a Jr. suite in a five star. The beds were soooo comfortable and we all slept liike babies... cant say enough good things about this hotel...staff very helpful... no coffemaker in room but coffe is sent to the room for three euros each... well worth it... large serving... the best coffee ever... cant wait to return!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Un tres chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrtr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent several nights at this superb little hotel in Paris, near the Tour Eiffel. The service was exceptionally good. The hotel is owned and run by a very nice couple. We met them every day, when they were greeting customers, and offering assistance. The rooms were very comfortable, and location, of course, top-notch. We look forward to returning to Hotel Ares on our next visit to Paris, and highly recommend this hotel to other visitors, who are interested in staying in a small, family-owned hotel off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jusine710
Reviews.Content: What a great find. The hotel is modern and has a real touch of elegance. The TV (B&O) set up is excellent with wifi internet included in the room price. The location is fantastic, close to many cafes, that have great breakfasts. The Eiffel Tower is a less than 10 minute walk, as well as the hotel being a 5 min walk to the Metro. The staff were very helpful and have a special deal with one of the airport shuttle companies which was very convenient, so ask them to book the return trip if you need one. We will definately return when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great great ares”
Reviews.Author: newyorkerfan
Reviews.Content: I have been with some colleags in Paris for business and i was really satisfied at hotel ares very well remoderned with a lot of taste the rooms are very nice the breakfast room is amazing like the lobby , the staff is always ready to help and giving nice informations for every think you need. ifound the breakfast very good and not very expensive for what offer .the location is perfect calm but very near at plenty of restaurants and bar.three lines metro just one minute walk . i will come back next year

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a calm and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: SunshinesNC
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely weekend in Paris. Hotel is in a quiet and calm spot close to Champ de Mars. Key Metro station is a minute away (La Motte-Picquet Grenelle). Hotel is well maintaned and clean. Public spaces are small. Our room on the 4th floor was nice but too small for 4 (2 adults+2 kids). Bathroom was small but efficient with an excellent shower. Note on breakfast: not a good value at 14 euro. Lots of cheap and high quality bakeries/cafes in the neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jamtarzan
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel. It's located in a very French, rather than touristy, area of town, so if you prefer hotels off the beaten track then this would be ideal for you. It's just around the corner from the "Tour Eiffel", a sight that you can never tire of! The room was amazing, we've had the best night's sleep in a longtime in extremely comfortable beds! The decor is luxurious (including Versace bathroom tiles!) and the rooms have everything you would need. Staff are friendly and helpful. There are plenty of local bars and restaurants, all within walking distance. Would definitely visit again and would recommend. Deserving of it's ratings!

Reviews.Title: “NO REGRETS AND VERY PLEASED WITH ACCOMMODATIONS!”
Reviews.Author: Kjmacbrad
Reviews.Content: From the moment my daughter and I entered the hotel we were greeted warmly and provided immediate service. Within five minutes we were checked in our room which had two single beds as requested requested. The room looked exactly as the picture reflected on the Hotel's Web site - everything was fresh and clean. The closet space was ample and included a safe and mini bar with selection of water and beverages. Wi-Fi was accessible and at no additional cost. The hotel is located in a very quiet and safe neighborhood, yet approximately an easy ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. For me it was a pleasure to return from the major tourist attractions - crowds of people, traffic, and noise- to the quiet and calm of the Ares Hotel after a long day of sight-seeing, walking, and navigating the Paris transportation system, which is exceptional. The Ares is an eay walk from several metro stops. There is no lack of dinning accomodations in the area. You need only walk a very short distance to find any number of cafes and other shops from which you can purchase food. Just walk the neighborhood and you can bank as well a shop. My daughter and I had planned to return to the Eiffel Tower to see the lights - but no need. We we able to see the lighted Tower while walking on a side street of the hotel while returning from dinner from a local cafe. When traveling, my hotel standard begins at four stars, and I look for other accommodating ammenties. Hotel Ares met my expectations, and I do not regret having to select this Hotel for my first visit to Paris. Although I missed having the availability of room service for meals, this by no means is a minus because for the availability of a range of dinning establishments very close by to walk for meals. The hotel does provide a daily continental breakfast. Without a doubt, I would easily return to this hotel for another visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING...wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: 930Traveler
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have stayed in ever. The rooms were a very adequate size, clean, and very well decorated. We stayed in a corner room, room 55. Didn't have a view of the Eiffel tower, but enjoyed looking out over the Parisian neighborhood. In a great location, quiet neighborhood, but still in the middle of everything. Very close to the 6,8, and 10 metro lines. It took us no longer than 20 minutes to get to any of the big attractions by metro. The closest attraction, the Eiffel tower and Champ du Mars park is a 10 minute slow walk away. Attention to detail was immaculate and the staff was incredibly friendly and knowledgable. The owners have done an amazing job. Doesn't have a business center, but has a computer in the library area for guests to use. Also, even though they don't have a restaurant on the premises, they serve breakfast in the morning. For meals for the rest of the day, there are plenty of restaurants, cafes, supermarkets, and brasseries in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Quality - On the Edge of the Centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: GWBCalgary
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Ares in early August. We are a family of 5 with three teenage girls so did require two rooms. We did book a month in advance so were able to get rooms next to each other on the same floor which worked out very well. The staffs at the hotel were great. From suggesting restaurants, giving us directions, or providing advice on taxis to the train stations or how to get around on the subway, all the staff were very professional and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and appeared to have been updated recently. The beds were comfortable and rooms had pretty much everything we needed. As others have noted you do not get any extra space in the small rooms but as we were gone early and home late, this wasn't an issue for us. The hotel is located a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel tower in a more residential area, It was generally quiet except for the odd garbage truck in the early morning or late night car in the street. It is 2 blocks from a metro stop and area with a few restaurants and brassieres (great croissants at the Petite Choclataire - stopped there every morning!). We did ride the subway every day which was very convenient for us but if you do want to walk everywhere then this location is not ideal Summary: Very well run hotel in a quiet neighborhood. You can find other hotels closer to the hustle and bustle but you would also pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Few Days in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: sarbjitskochhar
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in the Hotel Ares in Paris, a chic boutique-hotel in walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. We were welcomed at the door with open arms and huge smiles, as well as by the trendy and original decor. We were awed at the sophistication and simplicity of the hotel as we checked in. It was beautiful! The owner was on site everyday we were there and often chatted with us about our plans and offered lots of guidance and advice that was much needed, as we were not native Parisians. The staff was stellar, and the rooms, even better. Each was crafted individually and tastefully, with little details leaving our family in wonder and appreciation. The owners and operators of this hotel have made it so that each guest experiences the fact that they poured their hearts and souls into making this place wonderful, and personal for all. Our family will undoubtedly be returning as soon as we can. We were in Europe for two weeks, and the most memorable time was in Paris, undeniably because of our stay at this exquisite hotel. Before we jumped on the train to our next stop, we were ready to check back in.

Reviews.Title: “Pefection!”
Reviews.Author: Bexiwexi
Reviews.Content: I came here for a long weekend for our honeymoon and we arrived around 11.30am ish - although check in was at 2 we were given a free upgrade to the room they had available! Great start! Reception was exceptionally helpful and just really nice :) When we opened the door to our room it certainly took our breath away, the decor was beautiful, the beds were comfy and overall, spacious and clean! The eiffel tower was a 5minute walk away - bonus! The metro is on the hotels door step too so if you wish to, travelling around b y metro is easy - although we walked everywhere by foot! Our last night we had a slight issue with our tv - the volume just went straight up to 90! It was really loud and we couldnt turn the tv off - or the sound!! The security guard on the night time helped us out though and despite disturbing a few people sleeping, the security guard just laughed it off with us! Im hoping my new husband will take me back for our 1st anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pmmom
Reviews.Content: Pros: - wifi galore! They gave us 5 sets of logon id/passwords. 1 for laptop and 4 for our iphones. Coming from Italy where wifi was not working or limited to 1 set of logon id/password, we were ecstatic. - Emmanuelle was so nice and friendly. Made restaurant recommendations, directions, and even gave a map of where the laundromat is. Saw her only once during check-in. - safe box inside the room. small fridge (do not put food on the first shelf, it melted our chocolate bars). - Hermes soaps and toiletries! - Bathroom tiny but shower stall is normal size. - air conditioning was good. - clean rooms. - location was residential, so very quiet. - easy walk to the eiffel tower. I think it took us 10-15 minutes slow paced walking. - I think location is okay. It has a nearby metro stop and that's really all you need to get around. Cons: These are minor issues - The 2 single beds were pull out beds. They were soft and uncomfortable. Placed the thick comforter on top to lay down on and that did the trick. Then used airline blankets in lieu of the comforter for blankets. DD and I slept on the single beds since we were the shortest. - The room is on the small side. But that's the norm in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BankerJen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Our 7 year old was with us so the pull out bed in the executive room was wonderful. The location is amazing. It's close to the La Motte Piquet Grenelle Metro station (line 8) which allowed us to go everywhere in 1 to 2 stops. There was also a great patisserie on the corner, right in front of the metro entrance, that was great! Best of all, we had only a 5 minute walk to the eiffel tower. We spent many evenings there on the grass, playing cards and viewing the light show. As with most hotels, the walls are a bit thin so bring some earplugs in the event you have noisy neighbors and you'll be just fine. The staff is extremely friendly, accommodating and responsive. If you're having difficulty making restaurant reservations, send them an email request and they will take care of it quickly! We will definitely stay at the Ares on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet and Central - Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Angela/Stephen
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, quiet hotel with an excellent staff and a central location. The room was extremely clean, the beds and pillows were very good, the bathroom was large and the room was so quiet. There are many good places to eat and shop nearby and the metro stop is close as well.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, the staff was so accommodating a real Paris treasure!”
Reviews.Author: JRV55
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the reviews on trip advisor and it was better than described! It is off the beat and path of tourist so it is quiet but still centrally located. We did it all we took cabs, we took the metro, we ate in the little cafes around the hotel, had after dinner drinks at some of the bars. The owners are truly appreciative of their customers and are willing to help with travel, tour and where to eat trips. One review said to get a bottle of wine and cheese and picnic at the Eiffel Tower we didn't have time to do this it is my only regret as the tower is just blocks away and on Wednesday and Sunday they have a street market under the metro bridge about a block away it is all local sellers great cheap buys and the food, wine and cheese is awesome. I highly recommend Ares Eiffel!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SeanySheep
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at this elegant and charming little hotel. It's a perfect boutique hotel in a lovely, non-tourist area of Paris. The staff are very helpful and speak excellent English. The hotel has recently been refurbished and no expense has been spared, it is stunning. The rooms are small, but from my experience in Paris this is average so they are not too small compared to your average Paris boutique hotel room. ask the staff for tips on dining and they'll put you on to some great local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,great area, great room, only missing hot drink facilities”
Reviews.Author: IrishHolidayduo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic local area away from the hustle bustle that you get near Champs-Élysées. Lots of local Cafes and restaurants bear by, which forParis are reasonably priced. Metro very near also. Eiffel tower is a stones throw away through the Champs De Mars. Breakfast is good, we had the fresh orange juice, Pain au chocolat and croissants and cereals. Coffee too. They also have ham, cheeses, yoghurts and more. Wouldn't bother witht eh sausages and scrambled egg thanks. Mini bar for 5 euro per day is the best value. Enjoy because it cheapest drinks in Paris. Decor and cleanlisness is fantastic. Safe in rooms was great to have and free. If you have a laptop the WIFI is free and great for organising trips and booking stuff. They have an Apple MAC with web access in reception for every one for free too anyway. Near by is the Segway tours; they are soo cool you can;t afford to miss them. A tour of paris is 80 euro. Try wine tasting too; we went to O Chateau near the Louvre. The indian restaurant around the corner has really good food. Le Palais de Raja Maharaja. Carmine- Pizza- Grill- Restaurant and Bar is maybe the best value and tasty food and good service near by. We loved it and went back 3 times :-) 1 more good place for dinner is Le Cafe du Commerce. 3 floors, may be slow service but good for a long slow dining evening. its on rue de commerce. we booked a table on line. From Charles du gaulle taxi is 50-60 euro. On the Metro, watch you belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vespadirk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated 5 minutes walk from the Eifel tower, close to the metro and in a quiet street. Our room was luxurious, large and well equiped. The service was great and it was especially nice to be welcomed by the manager, his wife and daughter. Our impression was that they really have put their soul into making this a cozy, clean and well serviced hotel. -I have stayed in a few hotels in Paris and have normally experienced bad service and overpricing - The Ares was something totally different! You probably have to search for a long time to find a gem like this. Even the night porter was exceptionally friendly. I can definately reckomend this hotel. -As we were travelling with a 3 month old child and had a pram with us, the corridors to the rooms could have been a bit larger - but we never had to clap together the pram to get through, so it worked out fine :-)

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in paris”
Reviews.Author: worldoflove
Reviews.Content: I found through internet the Ares and is one of the closest hotel to the eiffel tower , the hotel is very well designed and a lot of attention for the details they used are top luxury ,the staff is helpful and gentle the breakfast is really good the loation is perfect because with three line of metro few steps you go every were directly in paris without change .i recommend the ares very strongly

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. ideal location”
Reviews.Author: menai62
Reviews.Content: We would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The ambiance of the hotel is exactly what we were looking for, in our Paris experience. It is ideally located, close to the metro & walking distance to the Eiffel tower and with plenty of good places to eat just around the corner. When we go back to Paris we would not hesitate to go back and in fact we would not bother searching for anywhere else to stay. We had both our teenage children with us and they were made to feel welcome and it exceeded all of our expectations, very french!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a fantastic bathroom”
Reviews.Author: janavratil
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet, well-kept hotel in a great location. The bathroom was awesome - I want one like it at home. Really close to the Eiffel tower, but we couldn't see it from our room. Next time I will stay in the upper floor. The room was a bit small for a family of four, but would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, skip the breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: NatRhin
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Hotel Ares Eiffel and the staff was gracious and prompt. The receptionist was incredibly helpful with restaurants and she also phoned a restaurant for us regarding a reservation. Our room is very clean and comfortable though we didn't ask for a view and we didn't get one. The breakfast in the hotel is awful. Skip it and eat elswhere. The scrambled eggs are gritty and the sausage is not worth mentioning. The pastries are pre-packaged. Yikes! There is a computer in the lobby for guests which is very convenient and the sitting room off of the lobby is very chic with a good selection of books. There is not a lot to do in the immediate neighborhood - not many shops but a few ok bistros. It is close to the metro making it easy to get anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming - expensive and really rather basic”
Reviews.Author: Dom067
Reviews.Content: Undeniably the hotel is attractively designed. Our room, however, was very small - a 'Superior' but with no space to put a suitcase flat other than on the bed itself, and cupboard storage was limited. When I asked if this was the smallest double room in the hotel I was told not, "This is Paris, Sir". None of the hotels I have stayed in on previous trips to Paris have been so small, or so expensive. I am amazed that it has 4* status as facilities are limited. Free WiFi is good, and beds are comfortable. But if you want an ironing board you have to use one in the breakfast room. No other food available food or room service. No bar. Only non-alcoholic drinks in mini bar. We expected a few nights of luxury at the Ares instead we got a really rather basic hotel with nice wallpaper.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended, fab decor, great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: cathymcil
Reviews.Content: Just back from two day trip to Paris. Thank you Trip Advisor for recommending this great hotel. Small family run hotel. Great decor, a mixture of new and old. Although room size was small, the classy decoration and attention to detail made up for it! Funky bathroom ensuite with cool chrome finish throughout. Room spotlessly clean, very comfortable beds with crisp white linen. Reception staff so helpful (English speaking too). The owner very hands on - and anxious that you have a good stay. Two streets away from the Eiffel Tower, and two minute walk to the metro. Plenty of shopping can be done in the nearby rue du Commerce. Will defo be returning to the Ares!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay...”
Reviews.Author: dublinturk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Ares Eiffel. The management and staff worked hard to make this a pleasant trip. The manager made an extra effort to see that we were satisfied with our accommodations and even provided his personal umbrella one day when it was raining. Contrary to an earlier review, the wireless service was quite strong. Can recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: marretito
Reviews.Content: After five years it was time to get back to Paris and the hotel we booked was Ares. The choice couldn't be better. The hotel is conveniently located in a quiet area with everything handy: public transportation, bistrots, stores... and the Eiffel Tower ! The staff has always been corteous and helpful and the rooms are top class. We really liked them. Reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: BangkokJune
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in June . when i first walked in to the lobby was really impressed with the decoration , really chic and cool , great location near the metro n eiffel lots of good restaurants cafes , safe neighborhood , great room BUT with 270 euros a night I didnt expect to have to go down to the reception to get the my towel that the maid forgot to put in the room and the cleaning was very very late . The wifi wasnt working during my first night and the staff said " oh a couple guests had a problem" so i asked if they are fixing the problem , the staff just shrug his shoulder and said ' no cant do anything'

Reviews.Title: “A great find for Paris”
Reviews.Author: CatR22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a really good find. Having been told that all hotels in Paris are awful and expensive, I found this on the web and thought it looked good. It is really good! The rooms are lovely - not massive, but a decent size and really parisienne in feel. All the finishing touches are great - good quality TV, cheap mini bar, Hemes toilettries, air con etc. My boyfriend even questioned if I had told him the right room rate because it seemed too good to be true. It is in a quiet back street, but there are good restaurants near by, and it is possible to walk to see lots of sights, or get the metro. A lovely hotel with lots of character that makes for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: MJfromNJ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ares is a wonderful little hotel on a quiet side street not far from the Eiffel Tower. Rooms were small but not in a bad way -- cozy and spotless and beautifully decorated. Toiletries provided were of great quality. Service from the staff was outstanding, from the front desk (who offered us coffee and drinks after our long flight, and were always on hand to provide answers to all our questions) to the maid and breakfast staff. The location was nice, very near a metro stop and lots of restaurants, but I just wish it was a bit closer to more sites. (But if it were, maybe it wouldn't be as quiet as it was.) Breakfast was nice -- breads, cereals, meats, cheeses, eggs, sausages, etc. -- more than enough to choose. We would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, PLEASANT AND QUIET”
Reviews.Author: ah110
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern small hotel. They were able to accommodate our 2 children in the same room. Rooms are a bit smallish but what is expected for Paris and certainly adequate, bathroom was exceptionly nice. Mini bar included for only 5 Euro flat was a very welcome touch. I believe this boutique type hotel(I think only 80 rooms)was recently renovated and decor is decidely modern/contemporary. Very good location tucked behind a busier street with cafes, restaurants etc.This made it quiet but possibly hard to find(ie print the little map to take with you). Close to Eiffel tower but far enogh to be away from the touristy bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly but not that special.”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyerLondon
Reviews.Content: This is another hotel with a stylish taupe interior, offset in our room with a plush cerise headboard. We arrived in the middle of a major heat wave and were relieved to find that the hotel had good functioning air conditioning, possibly the most important attribute of any hotel when the outside temperature is in the mid thirties centigrade. The deluxe room itself was compact and had been made up for 4 guests in dormitory style converting the two sofa chairs to beds. As were were just two, we asked for them to be returned to chairs so that we had a bit of space to put our bags down. In the X4 configuration there was lying room only. The shower room was one of the smallest I have ever been in but had undergone a Versace styling. I really liked the Hermes gels and potions. It is so rare to find a hotel which offers amenities made in Europe and if we are to believe the labeling, made in France. Full marks for that. The hotel is located in a quiet side street not too far from the Eiffel Tower, probably walkable in more clement conditions. The floors are wooden which means that there is some noise transfer between the floors so it depends who you have got in the room over you. The hotel offers free wifi but remember to get your code on the way up to your room. When we asked for a code we were told we had to come down to reception even though we were ready for bed. The sole man on reception agreed to post the code in the lift which we had to retrieve. Not a hardship in itself but this hotel is not cheap. Overall I would rate the hotel a 3 and a half which is not bad considering that it rates itself as a 3 star property but I don't think it offers particularly good value given that the paintwork is starting to chip a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with wonderful staff, and located in a charming neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: GraciePacificNW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem --- the rooms and public areas are very chic with all the mod cons -- excellent bathrooms and bedrooms with all the amenities. The rooms are large and well decorated-- very comfortable and elegant. The breakfast is bountiful with eggs, sausages, fresh beads and pastries, fresh fruit and it's a good value. The Hotel Ares Eiffel is located in a lovely neighborhood with good restaurants and cafes; it's convenient to the sights on both the Left and Right banks but it is not heavily overrun with tourists. The staff are so helpful. Our daughter was upgraded to a special room when we mentioned it was her birthday. This hotel is really a great find --- we stayed 3 nights and wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Small luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Strangerinthecity
Reviews.Content: Going often in paris for work i know a little bit hôtels in Paris and the ares is really a excellent find thé hotel is ver tell renewed with a lot of attentiion to design and quality ,thé hôtel is in very clam street but near to very good restaurants like la gitane,the staff is helpful and gentle .the location is great three liens of métro just two minutes to walk,free wi fi and Internet in the lobby with a Mac and if is busy they gives you an ipad.thé plus is that eiffel tower is only seven minutes to walk .defenetly i'll come back again

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel with friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Ri_Sun8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near a metro station and close to the Eiffel Tower. Rooms were beautiful and lavish interior design. Free wifi and friendly staff helped make it a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: PJL30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ares Eiffel in May of 2010 and what a beautiful hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable with balconies and a view of the Eiffel Tower (just look up). The location was walking distance to almost everything and the staff was incredibly friendly. In fact, the owner personally checked on us to ensure our stay was perfect, now that's service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific boutique hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: donnaleigh63
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out great for our family of 5 (three of whom are teens). I have always had trouble trying to work out hotel rooms for us because of the size of the family (without cramming us altogether, which is not acceptable!). My husband and I had a king room, and our three teens (2 girls and a boy) had what is called a quad room - a king bed with two armchairs that fold out into twin beds (room 22 and room 25 (quad) were our rooms - very nice. It worked out great. My son took the bed and my daughters used the twin beds. Service was very good - the two ladies at the front desk were very helpful in getting a cab or answering questions about Paris. They serve breakfast at the hotel if you are so inclined for 15 euros. It is a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and there is a metro station within a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: Colmarink
Reviews.Content: It was very expensive for a very small room and I did not think it was worth the money - they did move us - but we had issues with noise above our room and the internet was very very poor - definitely would not recommend unless you have NO LUGGAGE .

Reviews.Title: “Great city, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KraKra
Reviews.Content: The Ares Eiffel is perfect choice for everyone staying in Paris. It's conveniently located close to the Eiffel Tower and just few minuts frm the metrò. The rooms are very clean and the bathroom is in a class of its own. The minibar is 5 euros flat per day and the WiFi is free. The staff was very friendly with us and suggested the best restaurants and cafe in the area (quiet and clean). I strongly reccomend Ares Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the ares”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter60763
Reviews.Content: We have been for work in Paris and we reseved the ares because a friend of us has been already there we loved it so much we had a classic room that was at six'th floor with Nice balcon y and . The hôtel is really wonderful really calm ,thé design is very nice and alto of attentionat thé details, and very clean .for work is exceptional location because thé metro is only one minutes walk from hôtel ares and you havé three lines that drives you directly every were in paris. The staff really gentle and helpful they gave us really a gret choice of restaurants and museums to visit . We really recommend the ares to all they likes nice place were to pass nice time , in the marvellous Paris

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Newer Rooms, Close to Eiffel Tower, but hard to find for taxi's.....”
Reviews.Author: ganmaster
Reviews.Content: Great stay with the family, incl. a 2 year old. The hotel is small and quaint, the rooms are not huge, but for the style of hotel, it fits perfectly. The hotel is really no frills, a place to stay, no room service, pricey breakfast given that McDonald's and a few bakeries are on a block away. The staff, usually one person at the front are very nice, however, each has their own personality which you might want to adjust to. They have some good local, and I mean very local advice, but the farther away you wish to venture, the less reliable their advice is. The maids are a bit rude, but when are maid;s not? They tend to clean the room late int he afternoon and if you cant allow it, i.e. a napping 2 year old, they tell you it is now or never, since they get off at 4PM. Not the best service, but, hey, I would kill myself if I had to clean rooms every day, all day. For the 1st time visitor to Paris, this hotel may not be a great choice due to location, but for anyone who knows how to navigate the subways and get around, you cant go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: alia106
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location close to the Eiffel Tower, which was only about a five minute walk. However, the hotel hardly had a view of the tower from the window. From the 6th floor you can see just the tip. The room was 250.00 dollar for two a night and it was a 7x7 size room. It was really small the size of a walk-in closet. Also, our bathroom flooded and the hair dryer was difficult to find. Later , after complaining to the staff multiple times they decided to help us. The hair dryer was located in a closet in the bedroom and the bathroom continued to flood. They did nothing to compensate or move us to another room. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel ...it is way over priced for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: fresman90210
Reviews.Content: The staff was great! The bathroom was small but fantastic! The breakfast was Great! Made you feel like family

Reviews.Title: “great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mama2010_10
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying in Ares for 4 nights with two young children. This hotel was only 15 min walk to the Eiffel tower, which my daughter loved it. All the staffs were very nice and helpful. The hotel was very quiet. we really had a good time there. we recommend this hotel to anyone. If you are traveling with children, be sure to go their website and reserve a bigger room (and of course more expensive) from there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location very nice”
Reviews.Author: jessta7
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay not only is it in a great location, the hotel makes you feel special. They were very accommodating answered many of our questions. The location was a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and many cafes and supermarkets on the way. The best part was being able to stop at the market and picnic in front of the tower at night and be back in our bed within 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and most perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lee02
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel. There is an abundance of good restuarants in walking distance, the Eiffel Tower is such a short walk away and everything is very easy to get to. We walked everywhere in Paris or rode the bikes for hire. The owners of the Ares are very helpful and obliging. Breakfast was very lovely which consisted of meats, eggs, pastries, cereals, yoghurts, cheeses and toasts. The room we stayed in was the basic room which was small but very appropriate. The bed was comfy and the furnishings were gorgeous. Really you are in your room for such a short time it really was just perfect. We spent most of our nights on the grass in front of the Eiffel admiring the lights (a must see). A word of warning and not about the hotel but about the people in Paris. 1. Learn your french. Even if it is the absolute basic like, Can I order a.............or............Where is the toilet............or...................Can I have the bill please. The french are not big on tourists and sometimes it really does feel like they have no time for you. If you speak french you will have a better chance of enjoying your meal with better service. 2. Watch out for the men selling the Eiffell Towers. Dont ask how much they are. They will pester you forever. 3. If an indian dressed woman approaches you asking if you speak English "SAY NO". They all want money. 4. Watch out for the person who finds a gold ring and wants to give it to you. We accepted the ring they supposedly found then they demanded us for money. ALL SCAMS Hope this helps with your time in Paris. ARES WAS BRILLIANT...YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: “Would definatly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelledKent
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel and amazing decor. The rooms were slightly small (we stayed in room 54) but we were not anything much bigger for being in the centre of Paris. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English. I would recommend that the hotel considers putting a tea/coffee tray in the rooms which would have been welcomed after a long day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ivantam38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had such a great trip in Paris last week. It was our first time in Paris and the city is very romantic. The hotel is top-notch. The room we stayed in (35) is nice and clean and tidy. It is surprisngly bigger than I thought. The staff is ver helpful and friendly and they can speak english/france as well. The location is good too since it's very close to the Metro station where it can connects with 3 different lines. Also, there is a McDonalds close by as well in case you miss your North American Burger. We will definitely recommend people to come here. Note: You might want to print a map for the taxi driver.

Reviews.Title: “good parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gourmet3C
Reviews.Content: nice room, clean and modern, well equipped. well situated in a quiet street near the tube, near shops... overall quiet except for noises of water in pipes, bathrooms...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: here2daythere2morrow
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! conveniently located near a metro stop.. the eiffel tower was within walking distance..lots of food places nearby..the bed was comfortable..loved the shower after a tiring day of walking..the staff were friendly and helpful...you get free HERMES toiletries in the bathroom!!! I SHALL RETURN!!!! :D

Reviews.Title: “WOW Great hotel what a find”
Reviews.Author: Bramble1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the end of May and were really pleased we decided on this hotel over others. From the moment we arrived the hotel staff were friendly and couldn't do enough to assist us. Our room on the 6th floor was a good size, well furnished with a fantastic bathroom. The bed was comfortable and provided a great nights sleep. The wall mounted flat screen being a great addtion to the room.The bath products were a great touch, best that i've found in a hotel yet! The view from our balconey was great, seeing the lights circling the Eiffel Tower at night was fantastic. It was also very quiet with no road or traffic noise overnight. We didn't have breakfast but it all looked very good. The location was spot on, 10min walk from the Effiel Tower with the Metro 5min walk away, The area felt safe at night, with plenty of cafes and resturants within walking distance. For a hotel that was choosen from the reviews on here we were really pleased, you will not be dissapointed. If going back to paris we would stay again without looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Go56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a fabulous location - close enough to walk to the Eiffel Tower, cafes, major areas and quiet at night. The owners did a fabulous job renovating the place yet keeping the character of Paris. The ceiling molding are amazing. The room was a good size since we were traveling with our daughter for her 30th Birthday. A very comfortable pullout bed was in the room for her. Everyone was very helpful arranging transportation, providing directions, making recommendations, etc. We will definitely return as we only had one day/night to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Maaaaggiiicaaalll”
Reviews.Author: FrenchinSanJuan
Reviews.Content: Room fantastic with view of Eiffel tower. amazing Staff very friendly for french people, and I am french so I know Very good safe location, 1 block from restaurants; 2 blocks from Metro, 10 min walk Eiffel tower I am used to stay in Ritz in the U.S. this hotel is a different feel, more boutique, room smaller than U.S but decoration / inerior design is top notch. There is no Ipod dock in the room as an alarm clock combo, this would be my only comment. suite 73 is the best with a view of the Tower from the bed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find!”
Reviews.Author: JAG710
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ares is a fantastic boutique hotel! It's location is a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, 1 minute walk to the Metro line 8, and 1 minute walk to good restaurants and shopping. It's located on a quiet street among residences which makes it ideal. The design of the rooms are awesome; modern and high-end! We stayed in two different rooms while we were there and both were great! The staff speaks English really well and is super helpful. This is in the 15th District and I wasn't sure it would be close enough to all the tourist stuff we wanted to see, but it was not a problem getting around at all. Stay here; it's awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! FREE INTERNET and Expensive SOAP!”
Reviews.Author: brokeguy
Reviews.Content: close to the metro stop la motte piquet 6 or 8..1 block away..be sure to eat at the Crepe place right across the metro..cheap and very tasty. do note on there is a market under the bridge..awesome cheese/produce and even paella on massive pans. and FREEE INTERNET!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: KazolOne
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really a true gem. The Eiffel tower is just five minutes away and the area is quite and full of restaurants and stores. Rooms are not big but really stunning. The bathroom it's top class and the tv is a B&O flat screen. Internet is free and the minibar is just 5 euro flat. We have found the staff very helpful and corteous. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ParisTripper23
Reviews.Content: Great room. Very clean. Mostly friendly staff (the African night desk manager was not helpful and often rude). Fantastic location. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: chelseafanCalgary
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we expected and more. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was small but that was also expected for Paris. It was very well laid out however, and the bathroom was gorgeous. You couldn't ask for a better location. We were within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and many fabulous restaurants and shops. There was easy access to the subway. Many times we have heard about how rude the French are in Paris, but we can honestly say we did not encounter one instance where we were not treated with kindness and politely. Our French is atrocious at best but we tried to use very basic polite phrases and had absolutely no problems navigating the city, asking for directions, or being served in restaurants or bars. I can't wait for my next trip to Paris and I will definitely stay at the Hotel Ares again.

Reviews.Title: “paris i dreamed...”
Reviews.Author: fabio_vandekamp
