Reviews.Content: I often visit Paris but i've never found an atmosphere like here. Friendly, elegant, and with the italian taste thanks to the owner and the staff. my stay was absolutely unique. I will defenitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “top service”
Reviews.Author: LondonRedbull
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last weekend - and can say so much good things about this hotel. The bedroom I stayed in was fabulous with big screen TV mounted on the wall. its very close to eiffel towe - 5 minutes walk and theres loads of nice cafes and bars around. the service is top class, the owner and his team are genuinely very nice people and welcome you with the best hospitality

Reviews.Title: “A RESult of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: danieltjames
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and found the hotel to be an excellent choice. The location is excellent in a quiet neighbourhood but very close to shops, bars and restaurants and the subway network. It is a stylish hotel with friendly staff. Stayed in two different rooms during the stay and both were small [even though one was a suite] but were stylishly decorated with quality furnishings and amenities. All in all a good stay. Worth the money for a Paris hotel in a great location. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick186338
Reviews.Content: small but funky, well furnished, stylish, in a handy area of tow, quiet but close to things...friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: dcrumpler
Reviews.Content: Great location. Everyone very helpful. Best room we stayed in. Excellent nights sleep. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Ares in may 2010 and we...”
Reviews.Author: Fourfromcolo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ares in may 2010 and we loved our expirience. We had our two kids with us and we were able to have them in the same room. The staff were very helpful and helped us in every way possible! We loved being close to the Eiffel tower. The area around the Ares was wonderful and full of cafes and shops! This is a special place and we hope to go back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - 5 star hotel at a 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: ROM30K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great in all aspects. We spent our last night of our honeymoon at Ares and were disappointed we did not find it sooner. Rooms were of an average size (large enough for 2 people and 2 suitcases), amenties were 5 star, furniture and fittings were all 5 star. Shower was a great size and the best we had on our 4 week trip even compared to a Hilton suite in Venice which was 3 times the nightly rate! Hotel staff are very good. Very helpful, friendly and very accommodating. We arrived at 11am and they arranged a room within 5 minutes even though check-in was not until 2pm. Nothing seemed to be a problem. This is a must stay for anyone visiting Paris and wants to be located somewhere nice and central and appreciates attention to detail. This hotel is certainly on my must stay list for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great, stylish, hotel near the Eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: giampi_london
Reviews.Content: Rooms are elegant and modern, staff helpful. Location is 5 minutes from Eiffel Tower / Champs de Mars, 25 minutes walk from St Germain

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!!”
Reviews.Author: k3lv1n
Reviews.Content: Exquisite decor and attention to detail (Versace tiles in the bathrooms, B&O TV's, etc), the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, courteous and friendly staff, ideal location - what more can you ask? Only sleight is that the hotel doesn't have a restaurant but why would you need one in Paris anyway? Breakfast was served in the breakfast bar and seemed expensive, but we found a great little pattisserie 2 mins away on Rue de Grenelle (Stephane Secco), where you could get a fresh pastry and coffee for about 3 euros. This is an ideal hotel for exploring Paris from. It isn't often you check out of a hotel and genuinely feel you would go back at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ellebee_10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel following reviews on trip advisor and weren't disappointed. The hotel is wonderful and in a great location - walking distance of Eiffel Tower with some great restaurants nearby and a couple of minutes from a Metro stop. We stayed in an executive room which was fantastic to come back to after a day walking around Paris! The room and bathroom were spotless and the 5 euro a day minibar is a great idea. Ours didn't chill the drinks but it didn't bother us too much. The only criticism I would have is that the breakfast is not included. We only had it in the hotel on our last day and it was very good. Not really worth 14 euro though. Given the cost of the rooms it would be a nice gesture if the breakfast was included in the rate. Apart from that, it was a fantastic stay. I would just say to anyone staying above the ground floor to remove their shoes if they're walking around the room - with the wooden floors you hear everything in the room below - including crying babies! The free wifi was also a great bonus. There is only 1 English language TV channel (BBC entertainment) so you won't spend any time watching it as it's all repeats (even during the same day!). There are very up to date movies available for 11 euro a time (or special offer of full access for 24 hours for 18 euro).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with even better service”
Reviews.Author: DreadPirateMo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ares Eiffel at the end of our France trip. Got to the hotel early. Isabel called the maid and asked to get our room ready as soon as possible. This was typical of the great service Isabel and the hotel provided. We had a great room on the 5th floor, big, clean, comfortable with a bathroom bigger than some entire rooms in Paris. It is c a little bit away from the main sights other than the Eiffel Tower but they are still within walking distance and the hotel is on a main subway line. There are great restaurants and shops all around the hotel and a street market Sunday mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexoRoma
Reviews.Content: Reserved ahead and was given an excellent room, not small at all. My choice was a superior double, very nice decor, felt like something you could have in your own home. Free Wifi included

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonerKent
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends at this hotel for 2 nights - we booked 2 'classic' rooms on first floor. Yes, they were nicely decorated, but extremely 'compact' to say the least. Hubby and I had to take turns if we moved across the room. Wardrobe contained hair dryer, but not easily usable if clothes hanging in it at same time! Shower cubicle did not close properly so bathroom became a 'wet room' literally! Air conditioning did not work in either of the rooms. We opened the large windows but street noise made it difficult to sleep. The room generally was not well insulated - we were over the lobby and subjected to early morning deliveries as well as noise from above when the bathroom/shower was in use! On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and we found the lady receptionist very helpful (impeccable English). The Hotel itself is within easy walking distance to a good selection of cafes and restaurants and just a short and pleasant stroll along to the Eiffel Tower. However, given the cost of the rooms (and the quality of the refurbishment) we were disappointed with the size of the room and especially the lack of insulation in a Hotel of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: OMLLeitrim
Reviews.Content: The taxi driver had to consult his map several times before he found it. The best thing to do is tell him/her the driving description from the hotel website. It's very close to the Metro as well - 2 mins on foot. Located very close to the Eiffel 3 or 4 mins on foot from the end of the Champ de Mars. The locality is lovely with loads of cafes around. The hotel breakfast was worth the 14 euro for the amount and choice as we spent almost as much for a coffee and an omelette for example in cafes. There is a supermarket 2 mins on foot. The room was spotlessly clean and not as small as expected from other reviews. We had a view of the Tower from our balcony which was on the top floor. Nice market close to Metro on the Wednesday morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple - great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jbnd007
Reviews.Content: This was a very simple and nice hotel in a great neighborhood. It is not far from the Eiffel Tower but the surrounding neighborhood is very trendy and particularly in the blocks nearest the hotel the people were friendly and nice. It is a little tucked away but in a safe area. Room was small but nice, clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “elegant chic”
Reviews.Author: kangoroo35
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel Ares on trip advisor and we found that the hotel is better than in the photos of the web site , the location is great near eiffel tower we had a de luxe room for us two adults and two childs we found it elegant and chic , few minutes from Eiffel tower and plenty of restaurants few meters from the hotel and the metro station ,we past very nice jorney ,so we will say to all our friends how our stay was pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “real quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: clintwood33
Reviews.Content: We arrived at hotel Ares early in the morning and eaven if the the check in time was at two o'clock pm they found us a room in five minutes and it was very nice after a night flight the hotel is really top level quality for design materials and details .the staff was very helpful and gentle on every demand we made ,the breakfast convenient compared at the price in paris (an orange juice in champs elysees five euro).the eiffel tower is five minutes to walk, the metro just behind the corner, with three lines that drives you directly everywhere in Paris.we strongly reccomend the Ares , we hope to come back soon

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: BradInBed
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very quiet area. All you need is around the corner: bistrots, public transportation, shops... The rooms are very nice and, even if not big (this is normal in Europe) very comfortable, A special mention goes to the staff, always kind an professional. I strongly reccomend Ares Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable ares”
Reviews.Author: toreador80
Reviews.Content: we have been few days at ares hotel for a break in paris and we won't forget the hotel is in silent and calm street ,the design is elegant (tv bang and olufsen in the rooms), contemporary and classic very well mixed , the staff is very helpful and gentle ,they has helped a lot . so we had at hotel ares great time .we strongly reccomend the ares

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable !!!”
Reviews.Author: kennedyfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises as a 4 star, in fact when you arrive you discover you reserved in a 3 star hotel. This is really unacceptable and has to be mentionned here. I do not understand all these good reviews, the classification should be verified carefuilly because their rating is 4 star and their service is 3 star. The location is not far from Eiffel Tower but in a little street hard to find even by taxi drivers. Will never return, you can have much better fin Paris for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: micpai
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and my brother in law suggested me stay at Ares Eiffel that he personally knew. This boutique hotel is really nice from bottom up. The staff is simply superb, the rooms are beautiful (a little bit small according the US standards but perfect for European ones) and the location is great. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower and the public transportation is around the corner. A+

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise for a first timer in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach06
Reviews.Content: Took a 4 days break after business trip in London and stayed 3 nights at this nice little hotel. Being my first trip to Paris, I don't know what to expect but was quite pleasantly surprised with Ares. At least the room I had was of quite decent size and the bed was really comfy and the very modern bath room full of Hermes toiletries. I agree with the other reviews that the walls are quite thin and the wooden flooring makes it worst when my upstairs neighbour seems to be walking around the room the whole time! The reception staff was quite helpful trying to check on seats for us during our last night when we were hoping to catch a show at Moulin Rouge and Crazy Horse.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: leisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ares for 3 nights. Our room was quite nice and the bathroom was up to date w/ nice toiletries. The breakfast room was fine, but the buffet could have been better with more fresh fruit. My only complaint on the hotel was the lack of space to congregate and have a drink in the evening. THe rooms are too small to hang out in, so your only option is to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked it but some notes to share”
Reviews.Author: coconut38
Reviews.Content: Reservations were in order. When we arrived, front desk agent spoke both French and English. She told us our room was ready but when we walked in, we found it hadn't been cleaned yet. No A/C in the room (believe they have the whole hotel on either heat or A/C). We like it cool so opened the windows. Street noise (and thin walls) were a bit distracting. We needed to ship a Fed Ex package and asked for help from the front desk. They provided the local number for Fed Ex (which was out of service) but weren't willing to go beyond that in helping us get the package shipped. We checked out with the night auditor at ~7am. We asked him to get us a taxi that took credit cards (it didn't) - but he did call us one. He said "You have already paid" and then two minutes later said "you need to pay!" and two minutes after that said "You have already paid"...a not-very-pleasant cycle as we were preparing to leave and catch a plane. The room itself was very cute; bed was comfortable. Room was small for two people with a fair bit of luggage. Shower is trendy (and like the rain shower feature) but leaks badly. Toiletries were good. Free coffee throughout the day if you ask. We didn't have the breakfast although looked decent. Plenty of places in the area for a quick bite, though - which we preferred. Location is a bit tough to find. Recommend using the Metro stop La Motte-Piquet-Grenelle to direct cab drivers and then walk the few remaining blocks or guide them in from there thorugh a few one-way streets.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: yma7956
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Ares Eiffel. It was a fantastic hotel, the location was excellent and they are great with kids. We traveled with our 12 and 9 year old children and we were a little worried that people would be annoyed by the fact that we had our children with us. Not a problem at the Ares! The kids would take turns picking up and dropping off the key at the desk and the clerks were always great. The beds were comfortable, we had the room with the 2 chair beds and the kids slept great. Our son really liked the Hermes toilettries. Free wi-fi was great and had a strong connection. I would definately recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcasp
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation at Ares after reading all the positive comments from other guests. The hotel keeps up his reputation. The location is excellent , the staff is the most friendly and professiona I have found and the rooms have a wonderful deco. Reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, good looking, relaxed....and expensive”
Reviews.Author: M1lla
Reviews.Content: We only had a brief stay at this hotel, one night on our way to our other stay in Marais. From the outside the hotel didn't look like much, it was pretty anonymous but once we stepped in we immediately got the botique feeling. We had a nice welcome and a quick check in and got on to the escalator to the top floor where we had our junior suite. The suite was small but very cozy and modern. It looked just as good as in the picture, which is not often! Every detail was thought through, from the lighting to the tile in the bathroom. Very nice interior! As an extra, we could see the top of the eiffel tower from our window. Breakfast was not included in the price, which is pretty surprising when you pay 400 EUR for a suite, but it was decent enough with good coffe and tasty bread. In all, this was a very pleasant hotel experience. The interior in all of the hotel was very good looking and contemporary and the staff was friendly. However, the suites was a bit small and I would think that they could include breakfast when charging this much. The area around the hotel is central enough with some of the must-see things close but we didn't find the area very cozy for just a stroll when you are looking for a nice restaurant or a buzzing bistro. We spend the rest of our vacation in the marais area which was more jostling and bustlig with lots a small boutiques as well as restaurants and bars not only filled with tourists. However, the hotel itself I would definitively recommend! It's the optimal mix of luxury and relaxed cozy atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I had hoped for”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelin
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Ares was very enjoyable. The staff was friendly. The rooms were clean and very cute. The free WiFi made staying in touch with loved ones easy. The location was perfect- near the Eiffel Tower, metro stations, good food, safe and clean. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: mallok61
Reviews.Content: Choosing the Ares was the best thing I could do to make my trip to Paris nothing less than perfect. The Hotel is conveniently located in a quite and nice zone, few minutes from public transportation and even less for the Eiffel tower. The staff is extremely friendly (including the owner) and the room was a nice surprise: the deco is top quality, the high speed internet is free and the mini bar is just 5 euro/day flat. I strongly reccomend this hotel. A+

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room decor”
Reviews.Author: mrsmac301
Reviews.Content: Seems all Euro rooms are a bit tiny but they made it work. It was luxurious, modern, clean and comfy. The staff were pleasant and pretty helpful. Free WiFi. The metro is just around the corner and there were plenty of places to eat nearby. Did I also mention it is next to the Eiffel Tower! They also surprisingly upgraded my room at no charge so I recommend Rm 35 (corner Superior) if you can request it. All in all a great spot and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “nice&cosy hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: deja76
Reviews.Content: It is a nice small hotel with pleasant staff. It is very good located near the metro station and a few minutes walk from the Eiffel tower. Rooms are small (which is quite normal for Paris) but lovely decorated and with big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: BUSHCHESHIRE
Reviews.Content: Cant say enough about this lovely hotel, great staff, great surroundings, beautiful building, superb quality room. Located just 10 mins walk from the Eiffel tower with childrens parks, Metro stations, restaurants and shops all within easy walking distance you couldnt wish for anything more in a hotel and area, dont hesitate in booking a room here, you wont be disappointed 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff, nice touches, small room even for Paris”
Reviews.Author: CRtor
Reviews.Content: Near great sights, restaurants, central. Quiet street. Nice appointments but small room. Some of the most helpful staff we've encountered in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Stan.stan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Small but very comfortable, well presented and maintained hotel. Reception staff always freindly and courteous. Good location near the Tower (10 mins walk), metro (2 mins) with some perfectly adequate restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Only had a very brief stay but I really...”
Reviews.Author: Brannigan84
Reviews.Content: Only had a very brief stay but I really enjoyed the hotel and found it matched, if not exceeded, my initial expectations.

Reviews.Title: “sublime ares”
Reviews.Author: diamond026
Reviews.Content: the ares is the best for me in paris ,for business is perfect location really marvellous .i will come back shortly with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Felt in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jullieseatle
Reviews.Content: great service perfect location, thats the place to stay, rooms quiet small but decoration absolutely lovely.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: judih_talavera328
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Ares Eiffel very much. The hotel was very well priced, the location was excellent, the staff was very kind, the hotel was beautiful, and the free internet use was GREAT. The only thing that was a disappointment was there was no room service, but that wouldn't keep me from coming back. I will book this hotel again when I return to paris.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed - very comfortable, clean and freindly”
Reviews.Author: yourekidding
Reviews.Content: Very cosy hotel about 10 minutes walk to the foot of the Eiffel Tower. Nearest Metro is La Motte Picquet Grenelle - its a good 15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower metro station so dont make that mistake if you have luggage! Rooms are a bit small - we had a "triple" for just the two of us and I am not sure where they would have put the single bed for the third occupant. But no complaints whatsover, very comfortable, wonderful decor and immaculate throughout. The staff are very nice and can give you good advice on getting around. We got a good deal through booking via Eurostar, think about £120 per night, but the rate on our room was advertised at 350 Euro per night. One thing, the cost of eating out in Paris is crazy, typically 8 euro for a bottle of beer, 5 euro for a coffee - a meal for two with a couple of drinks each could easily be 100 euro - 10 years ago this would have been maybe half.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: Marigold79
Reviews.Content: I chose to extend my work trip for 2 days, and wanted to be near the Eiffel Tower. I had read some good reviews of the Hotel Ares Eiffel, and the pictures looked great...in my opinion completely deceiving. NONE of the rooms have a view except the most expensive suite, and it is located on a quiet residential street that is not in a good location. The rooms are small, they are modern and clean. But they do not have a comfortable feel - my room was dark and dreary. I could hear the people next door - not in our hotel but actually in the next house. And my window was located immediately next to theirs...too close for comfort to be honest. There is no food in the hotel except for breakfast...over all I would not return. For the price you'll pay, at least go somewhere that has a nice restaurant, a gym etc....any kind of perk really! I travel often and am not picky, I just want comfort, safety, cleanliness and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Netz_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were up to expectation - bijoux. Everything was glamourous. The area was ideal for the Eiffel, in fact you could see the top of the Eiffel from our bedroom window. The underground network was 2 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cute Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GigNYC
Reviews.Content: Close to all the metro stops & eifel tower (of course) The rooms are small but they do the trick and we really didnt spend much time in the room anyway. Quiet, clean, comfy bed, really nice bathrooms. Although, I would not recommend Paris in August. Most of the shops & bars are closed and the streets are empty because all the Parisians are away on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gastronoom
Reviews.Content: Tasteful decorated, quality finishing, very friendly staff, nice location with a few deliteful restaurants in the neighbourhood. Next time in Paris we surtenly book the Ares hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small lovely room for 4”
Reviews.Author: ShellyBNyc
Reviews.Content: Paris with a family. Excellent room decor and details except as noted below (the pull out chairs). Shower was the best. However, the service was not world class. Quad room was tight. The pull out chairs a bit lumpy. The other details in the room were excellent. Service could have been much better. Arriving in Paris for the first time it would have been nice to have a map of the area and recommendations of places to eat available at the front desk. Easy for the hotel to give a little extra personal attention by having information available for guests: How to buy metro tickets, where to grab an early morning bite, which days which museums close. Wouldn't cost them anything and would help the visitor feel more grounded. Also, we returned late one night and the front door was locked and the bell wasn't working and after 10 minutes the front desk person appeared and unlocked the door. Absolutely no help with luggage at all. Which would have been kind and thoughtful to provide. So, I picked a boutique hotel for the service of but an apartment with a concerned owner would have given me better value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: iwanttotravel2
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris with my girflriend for the weekend and I couldn't be more satisfied. We stayed at a superior room and although it was kind of small(all hotel rooms in Paris are small), the decoration of the room was amazing and everything was perfect. However, I especially liked how the reception was very helpful with all our requests from finding a good wine shop to reserving a place at one of the best restaurants in Paris (especially since we couldn't speak French). I don't think you can find this kind of individual attention in one of those big hotels, and that's why I chose this boutique hotel in the first place. Breakfast is also very nice and I recommend everybody to have breakfast at the hotel since the prices outside will be much higher. I stayed in many hotels in New York, Chicago, Boston, San Francisco, London, Milan, Istanbul and this one is one of the best I stayed at. If you can afford it, this hotel is definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenkel
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for a special wedding anniversary, relatively easy to get to using the Metro and a short walk. The receptionist seemed friendly but didnt give us much information, she did give us a paris map, but didnt point out the hotel lift. Room and general hotel decor was very nice, the shower is probably the best hotel shower I have ever had, The breakfast was typically french, perfectly adequate but nothing special, we had a standard size room and I have to say it was a little small, we were staying 3 nights, wouldnt like to stay in that size room for much longer, not much space to put your suitcases, so dont take many. Bed however was very comfortable. Sadly we didnt have much of a view, our room was at the front of the hotel, though I do understand some rooms have a view of the Eiffel tower. All in all a nice hotel for a short break, lovely decorations but perhaps avoid the standard rooms if your staying for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect. Great style and we would love to come back.”
Reviews.Author: benaust
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Ares for our 10th Wedding Anniversary for 4 nights. The hotel is in a great location as it is close to the Champ de Mars and not far from the La Motte Picquet-Grenelle Train station. This made getting around quite easy on the Metro, and and we were not far from most attractions. The hotel itself is very well decorated, and the rooms were perfect and well designed. The little things were great- like the umbrellas to borrow at the reception area were a nice touch when it was raining outside, and access to the internet and newspapers opposite the breakfast area in the foyer. Breakfast was pretty good although it did seem small when we first sat down, but was quite substantial and well laid out. The service was great and reception staff were very friendly and helpful speaking in english when my french got muddled up. They recommended a good company for us to do a day tour of the champagne region and Rheimes. They happily booked it for us, and the 8 people tour bus picked us up from outside the hotel without any dramas. The restaurants recommended nearby - La Gitane and La Guiloisse (I think) were fantastic- but don't bother with the italian restaurant on the street near the station. There is also a small supermarket nearby which was helpful for little things we needed too. We would happily recommend this hotel, and we were always happy to come back to it after a busy day in Paris shopping, eating, drinking and sightseeing. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great for romance”
Reviews.Author: Marrtini
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in February and it was a great experience! The Hotel is small, beautiful and classy! Our room was very elegant and comfortable. Staff was extremely nice and helpful. Ares hotel is located close to the metro station, a lot of bistrots and cafe and of course Eiffel Tower is just 5 minutes walk. We had a delightful stay and definitely will come back again! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish room and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SPM713
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and friendly service, this stylish small hotel makes a visit to Paris truly enjoyable. There is no need to have the expensive breakfast in the hotel as there are plenty of cafes nearby and they are quite a bit cheaper. And getting to the hotel from the Gard du Nord proved to be straightforward and surprisingly quick using the Metro, with just one change of trains.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its excellent rating”
Reviews.Author: punnditt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in early February. Not sure I should be posting one more great rating.. the Hotel will be sold out next time we want to stay ! This really is a gem of a hotel. We had a great room (booked the slightly larger "Superior") and the staff were extremely helpful. The location is good for sightseeing because much is in walking distance and the Metro is really close. Only minor issue was that in an exceptionally cold spell more heat in the hotel would have been better. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyc340
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect little hotel for those looking for an affordable room in a great quiet area of Paris. The rooms are not huge but the bed was really comfortable and the amenities were great as well. The one critique I would have is the service is fine but not spectacular. Don't come here expecting many recommendations, you need to have your own trip planned out before you come. (Which we did so it was fine.) Bottom line, for a quick Paris weekend...this place is a fantastic hotel with great value.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: pigioQuebec
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights after a week of business. This is a great hotel in Paris. The big tourist attractions can be walked (Eifel tower 15 minutes) or are within a reasonable taxi fare (for example the Louvre). Nice restaurants within minutes walk on avenue la motte piquet or on avenue Suffren. I recommend Aires hotel without any hesitation. PG from Quebec city

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great price for Paris”
Reviews.Author: MrFussyGlasgow
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed, I have stayed in other hotels of similar quality but for Paris it is a great price. Rooms are beautiful and elegant and the staff friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but more than comfortable and luxurious, the only flaw being no kettle or tea/coffee making facilities. We were on the 1st floor above the main entrance which led to one night been awakened by a truck making a delivery of bed linen and towels. However i don't think the hotel has another entrance for such deliveries.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Ares”
Reviews.Author: venerevalley
Reviews.Content: Stop looking around for a great place to stay in Paris. With Ares you can't go wrong. The hotel is convenientely located close to the metro station (walking distance) and the Parisienne nightlife. Lot of bistrots and cafe are around and the Eiffell tower is just in front of you. The staff has always been kind and professional. The interior are beautifully decorated with a large LCD TV in every room and the hi speed internet is free.

Reviews.Title: “uniquely plush boutique hotel, versace decor, hermes toiletries, great service, central location- fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMumBerry
Reviews.Content: Very central, short walk from metro and eiffel tower. Helpful staff at front desk. Rooms reasonable size for city centre, luxurious soft furnishings and bed. Bang and olufsen stereo, hermes toiletries, soft white towels. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Le choclat + la beauté + le Ritz + Coco Chanel = PARIS!”
Reviews.Author: CocoIIIII
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 11:00am – it was fab – Hermes toiletries and vercase tiles. Window/doors that open onto a balcony – very Parisian!!!! The receptionist let us book check in early and drop our cases in our room which was very kind of her as check in was not technically until 2:00pm. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. Each window opened out onto a balcony which was very charming. The only downside is that this hotel does not have a bar but there are plenty of nice authentic french cafes and restaurants nearby and it enables you to discover more of the area. Also, there was a family next door and there was some noise as a a result but I wouldn't let this put you off. Overall, a delightful stay and when I return to Paris I will return to Ares-Eiffel Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the city - not your regular tourist hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Firethorne
Reviews.Content: With only a few days to organise a short break to Paris I checked out the Trip Advisor list of hotels to find Ares Eiffel coming in near the top. Although perhaps a little out of the way the hotel is in a quiet side street but within walking distance of a mainline metro station where you can buy a carnet of tickets and within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is full of character and the building has been sympathetically renovated. We paid for a superior twin room which wasn't huge, but plenty big enough nevertheless. It was on the corner of the building and had dual aspect with a beautifully clean modern bathroom with shower, bath, bidet and basin! Hermes toiletries were included and we had clean towels daily. The beds were superbly comfortable and it made a change to have feather pillows instead of those infernal foam ones that so many hotels now use!! There are no restaurant facilities at the hotel as such but it is in a good area with a reasonable choice of restaurants and bistros serving an amazing choice of fresh seafood, oysters etc.. Breakfast is available at the hotel in a breakfast room downstairs at 14 Euros - service between 7am-11am. It is a self service affair, but the bread is fresh with ham, cheese, fresh fruit, yoghurt and croissants available. The crockery and cutlery is all Villeroy & Boch - coffee is hot and freshly squeezed juice is plentiful. The staff speak reasonably good English and are helpful. There is no concierge or bell hop. The room mini bar really only has soft drinks in it and a bottle of water is 5 euros. Everywhere was beautifully clean. Overall for the price this is a lovely hotel with attention shown to almost all the details that make a nice stay a great stay!! Having visited with my daughter I won't hesitate to find an excuse to come back and stay with my husband!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bg205
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in the hotel. It was a clean niclely designed hotel and warm which was important as outside was very cold. It is near the metro station (a few minutes) which made getting around easy and there is a nice bakery down the road where we had breakfast as the hotel breakfast was note included and was 14euro each. The only problem was that they would only extend the checkout if we paid for a whole other night and our train was not until 7pm. I would hope for a smaller fee they could make late check out available esepcially as there were many vacant rooms

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a few faults”
Reviews.Author: tt180
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 2 nights... A really lovely 3 star hotel in a quiet yet fairly central location, literally round the corner from a metro station, and 10 mins walk to the Eiffel Tower. The staff were very friendly and efficient, and the rooms were very well decorated but VERY small- we had a deluxe double, and you could only just walk around the bed, it really couldn't have been any smaller if they had tried. We had fold-up bags, but a guest with a couple of suitcases would have really struggled to store them somewhere. Yes, the room was slightly larger than a standard, but because the bed was also larger, it did not result in any extra floorspace! There were several disappointments for us: breakfast was expensive, and was a very limited continental selection (and only four or five tables to eat at which could be a problem at busy times.) There was no bar or restaurant- in fact no way to get a drink or snack at all in the hotel. No tea making facilities in room or downstairs outside of breakfast times, no iron, trouser press or full length mirror in the room also disappointed. Having said that, we did enjoy our stay here, and it was an excellent base for a couple of days, but we were perhaps expecting more after reading the hotel's many, many glowing reviews on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: sitrop
Reviews.Content: When planning a second trip to Paris with my girlfriend, it was hard not to be impressed by positive reviews and the Hotel Ares definitely doesn't disappoint. We stayed for 4 nights in a classic room on the fifth floor and the room was absolute luxury - beautiful furniture, comfortable bed, refreshing walk in power shower and TV and free wifi access. The little balcony was a nice touch and we used it as a natural fridge for bottled water aince it was so cold outside! There is an iMac downstairs should you need to do some last minute investigating before heading out in the morning and we used the webcam to talk to relatives back home. Hotel Ares is brilliantly located pretty much at the bottom of the champ du mars, just a few minutes from the Eiffel Tower and is served by a metro stop that takes you anywhere in the city in a matter of minutes. Although right in the centre of Paris, the neighbourhood around the hotel is surprisingly quiet and slightly off the tourist track which makes it feel a little more like actually being in France. There is a supermarket, several ATMs, a gym and a florist nearby as well as an offering of traditional French brasseries. We tried Cafe Suffren on the corner of Avenue Suffren and found it to be one of the best places we have ever eaten in - well worth a visit. Overall, Hotel Ares is a real hidden gem, a trendy, immaculately clean, cozy and quiet haven in a perfect location to explore one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower in a quiet area and close to metro station.”
Reviews.Author: bobbinonta
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower in a quiet area and close to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: nick_peckham
Reviews.Content: The room was beuatiful, the staff were very friendly and helpful. It is just round the corner from the Eiffel Tower, with several good restaurants nearby. About the only issue was with the clueless taxi driver who had trouble finding it - print a map before you leave home! It is not cheap, but is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, nice and central”
Reviews.Author: Incoming11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel located 5-10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. So easy to get places but located in a quiet spot, it is the best of both worlds. It is just around the corner from the Metro station 'La Motte-Picquet - Grenelle' with 3 different lines that will get you pretty much anywhere. The rooms are compact but nicely finished and the staff were outstanding and helpful. A few really nice little restaurants around the corner to. La Gitane in particular. In all a highly recommended city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel - helpful staff, elegant decor & great location.”
Reviews.Author: MsDizzyTuzza
Reviews.Content: The is my second stay at the Ares - so that in itself is a recommendation. The room I had (on both visits) was a suitable size for one person, but a bit of a squeeze for two. However small hotel rooms are the norm in Paris, so put in context this is a minor point. Overall this hotel is a little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Smaller than expected though!”
Reviews.Author: Rebel08
Reviews.Content: Having thoroughly researched hotels in Paris before I went I read all the reviews about this hotel. Because the reviews had said the rooms were small I booked a superior room and I was a small bit disappointed when I saw the size. I can't imagine who small the classic rooms are. Also the toilet was in a small closet next the the wardrobe and no full length mirror in the room which I found a bit unusual. Anytime I was in the bathroom I could hear someone playing the same peice of music on a piano ( including quite a few mistakes!) which I thought was a bit strange but did not know where it was coming from! Other than this I found it to be a very charming hotel. The receptionist was very nice and helpful, and the hotel was only 5-10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower so I would recommend it once you know what you're getting. I would also recommend Carmines bar /restaurant around the corner as the food is lovely and the staff very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iheartmt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading many great reviews on TripAdvisor, and they were correct! This is an adorable, quaint boutique hotel. The staff was very nice and location was great. It was no more than a 2 minute walk to 3 different trains within the metro and maybe a 10 minute walk, if that to the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were very nice and I loved the decor. However, with both of our bags, they were VERY tight, which, being in Europe, is understandable. I wish I would have known and paid for a larger sized room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy”
Reviews.Author: SMWSingapore
Reviews.Content: Fantastic family room - not easy to find in Paris. Two armchairs that converted to beds for the children. Decor throughout the hotel was lovely. Would recommend the breakfast buffet - good selection and very well priced for the food available. We stay in 5 star hotels throughout Asia and for quality and cleanliness, this hotel was comparable. Reverse cycle air-conditioning so even though it was -3 degrees during our stay, we were able to adjust the heating in our room easily. Short walk to the Metro and about a 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. Quite a few cafes in the direction of the Metro, plus a whole street of well known high street stores if you want to do shopping. Free wireless internet (they give you a code on check in) which was great. There is also free use of a Mac computer in the library area which we used to check in on line for our onward flght.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel to everyone and will go again”
Reviews.Author: alicemann
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as a result of the positive comments on Trip Advisor and they were very accurate and we were very pleased with our choice. There is little further to add other than we had a triple room with our teenage son and I havent awarded 5 stars as the room was small given that we stayed for 5 nights. Our adult daughter joined us for one night and the room she was had with twin beds was bigger than ours or at least appeared to be. It was a corner room and had two lovely windows so would recommend asking for one of those. Finally it did not come across completely in previous comments what a fantastic location this hotel is in for sight seeing.Its a five minute walk to the Champs de Mars and from there the Eiffel Tower and Seine. The street is also very quiet with no traffic noise at all. I would recommend that if you want to eat close to the hotel turn left out of the hotel front door and you will walk towards much cheaper cafes and brasseries than the Champ de Mars direction. Chez Luigi, Bvd de Grenelle was our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a jewel....Small, elegant and well located.”
Reviews.Author: jaaaam
Reviews.Content: This is a small elegant hotel that is just around the corner from the metro and just behind the Eiffel Tower. A perfect location..... It is perfect for a getaway to Paris. The interior is fabulously decorated in a mix of Italian design and French charm. The reception is staffed with friendly knowledgeable people who can help with anything from finding a sushi place that delivers to a babysitter. This is a jewel in the heart of one the world's most beautiful cities. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, every detail thought about.”
Reviews.Author: lauraismyname
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on laterooms.com and got a standard double room for 1 night for £150 which from looking at the room prices on the hotels website seems to be a fairly good deal. The hotel is in a great location, about 10 minutes walking from the eiffel tower and lots of resturants and shops in the area. Very Close to a metro station as well, the metro station is also a very well connected one. The receptionist at the hotel was very polite and helpful and spoke fairly good english which was especially useful for us! There was a lift as well as stairs incase you have heavy luggage or are just feeling slightly lazy after a day of site seeing. The room itself was beautiful and very very clean. It wasn't particulary big but it didn't really need to be. The shower was amazing and large. The bed was extremly comfortable and the sheets were of very high quality, making it very hard to get up in the morning. The television in the room had free tv and also free internet on it. We didn't have the breakfast but it cost 14 euros and looked pretty standard - buffet The only problem we had was after going out to a bar we came back to the hotel at about half 12 at night, the door was locked and after ringing the bell a few times no one came to the door. Eventually after more ringing of the bell we were let in by a friendly man, was just slightly worrying for a moment. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We took a weekend break and had two nights in a cheap hotel and then one in this hotel and it was well worth it and a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: glamismac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly amazing. Set just aside from the Eiffel Tower, behind a metropolitain and RER station it's a little luxury hotel. We stayed for three nights with a special rate but it was worth every euro. Everything described in the website was true, from the Versace tiles in the great bathroom to the Bang&Olufsen tv/internet set. The room was large and beautifully furnished, with free wifi and internet on the tv. Every detail, from the Etro bath to the key holder to the posh lobby was really amazing. Especially for a romantic trip in Paris. Just two minor issues: the room was a little cold (but we went in a very very cold winter) and you've to pay 14 euros for the breakfast (but outside is full of patisseries). In the end I'll absolutely return to the Ares Eiffel, one of the most beautiful, chic and elegant hotel I've ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Paris, highly recomment”
Reviews.Author: gregj2209
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for a long weekend for my fiancee's 30th birthday and I managed to book this hotel on a special internet rate. I would highly recommend it, the location is good, not really walking distance to any major attractions except the Eifel Tower but with a metro station literally 2 minutes walk away you can get anywhere easily. The rooms are lovely and very nicely appointed. The bathroom was very nice and very clean, the staff are lovely. We didn't have breakfast here as we thought it was a bit expensive so I can't comment on the food. Overall I would say this is an excellent place to stay, they were more than happy for us to sit around in the lounge and wait even after we'd checked out to have a rest from the sun and walking before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: stephanieas
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for New Years and expected to be overwhelmed by crowded hotels, and poor service. Well, we found a definite diamond in the rough! Ares Hotel is an elegant boutique hotel, in walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. The service is impeccable, the rooms elegantly designed, yet comfortable, and it is clean and well looked after (something that is my number one priority!) The staff are so helpful (even arranging babysitters), there is an amazing full service gym at your disposal mere yards from the hotel, free internet, and all the charm one would expect from a Parisian boutique hotel. It would also be a brilliant romantic getaway for two! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice room, if quite small”
Reviews.Author: Dustys_Mum
Reviews.Content: We took the advice on Trip Advisor and stayed at the Ares for four nights over Christmas. The location is great and the service is very good. I was quite amazed at all the languages the reception staff seemd to have mastered! The area is really well supplied with bistros, patisterries etc but very quiet at night which was lovely. We had a Classique Room (smallest) and it was very small even understanding French room sizes. We had no luggage and I can only imagine if we had luggage it would have been quite tight. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was wonderful with Hermes toiletries. The free wi-fi internet in the room was also great. We drove to Paris and supply of off-street parking at the hotel was very handy as on-street parking looking very busy. Overall, very good and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “we will come again and again”
Reviews.Author: erbove
Reviews.Content: we trusted in trip advisor rewiews and is totally true we had confortable room for paris standard the hotel is really testly conceived between modern and classic .all the material are top luxury from tv flat screen B O the baccarat cristal of the lights an marvellous marble in breakfast room .the breakfast was o.k. the eiffel tower is just five minutes to walk . the staff is gently and helpful for every question . so our vacation was marvellous , so we will come back at hotel ares in the future and we reccomend strongly to every one that is looking for excepionalplace .

Reviews.Title: “ares my new home in paris”
Reviews.Author: quant66
Reviews.Content: top hotel design hotel, service and gentelness very good location few minutes by feet by eiffel tower the free wi fi .i will return often at hotel ares is perfect for business .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very boutique hotel. Earns its rating.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCook
Reviews.Content: Let's start at the beginning; this is not the Georges IV, and it doesn't try to be. It's also not a flophouse or a bed-and-breakfast. It's a small, boutique hotel with updated fittings and fixtures. It's within a couple of blocks of the Eiffel Tower, though actually seeing it from the hotel is not an experience I had. The first thing that struck me was the cabbies had no idea where the hotel was, had not heard its name and either couldn't understand my pronounciation of the address or hadn't actually heard of it - though one found it quickly with the GPS and the card from the hotel itself. The entryway is understated, on a back street away from the main drag and near what appears to be a primary school. The entryway and lobby are elegantly appointed, with rich dark colors but without being gloomy thanks to the bright (and somewhat eclectic) lounge area. We were quickly greeted by the person behind the front desk and given our key, a small RFID tag with a big metal-topped tassle that looked like something off an old-style drapery pull. Being on the 7th floor, we elected to take the (fairly small) elevator, which was more than quick enough. All the lights in the small hallways (it appears there are only 4-5 rooms per floor) are motion activated but come on very quickly. The hotel was very quiet, despite it being the middle of the day. On entering our room, we saw that it was very nicely appointed. I'd say the bed was US King sized, and probably just a little big for the room. There was not a ton of closet space, which was fine for our short trip but might be an issue with someone who is staying for an extended period. The room featured an electric safe, a nice sized flat-screen TV with Internet, a mini-bar (with one daily price for any or all of the eight or so beverages in there), and a private bath with elevated shower tub and seperate commode. All three doors were double-thick (entry, bath and commode) and my one possible gripe was no peephole for the entry door. When housekeeping knocked, I had no idea who it was (tired from sixteen hours' travel and weak on my French). Breakfast, at €14, seemed a bit steep and perhaps a little sparse (continental with scrambled eggs, pretty much), but the hotel is very near several nice places for breakfast. And lunch and dinner as well, by the way! It's also very near a Metro station and with a little study you'll quickly realize how easy it is to get around the city for a few €! We mostly walked, however, and the hotel was in a nice enough neighborhood that we felt safe around there even late at night. The desk seemed manned at all hours and while there was a key in the lock at the bottom of the glass door, it never seemed to be locked. Staff were very helpful and even arranged a last-minute reservation at the #4 restaurant in Paris (review to follow). They seemed eager to please and very knowledgeable. We would return to Hotel Ares Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: muscarillo
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great place to stay in Paris, Ares is the best choice. This boutique hotel will treat you like a king. Rooms are gorgeous, perfectly decorated. The staff is always helpful and the location is super, just few minutes from public transportation and a lot of bistrots.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mosaic1
Reviews.Content: After reading the Tripadvisor reviews on this hotel, booked for a one night trip to Paris and returned yesterday. The hotel is well situated about 15 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are very boutique - lovely facilities and excellent linens with top quality pillows. I would imagine the reason it has only 3 stars is the lack of public facilties, ie no bar or restaurant. Breakfast is served in a side room, and although there are many decent restaurants and bars close by it would have been nice to come back in the evening and have a glass of wine at the hotel. The staff were delightful.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Brit2989
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through the reviews on tripadvisor and would echo all of the positive comments below. The bedroom is pretty small but that is to be expected in Paris but it is well furnished and the bathroom small but perfectly adequate - the hermes toiletries were a nice touch! The hotel was ranked as a 3 star on the board outside the hotel, but I would say that it deserves a 4 star rating. In terms of location, it was really good - only a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and Champs de Mars. The metro is very close which was handy when it was raining but note that if you don't already have a ticket, you can't use the entrance nearest to the station. All in all, it was a good find and I would go back when I am next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We spent the first nights of our honeymoon here and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bbumatay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ares is on a small street and in a cute building. Well, all of Paris is cute and romantic, so being that it is located in Central Paris, that is obvious. The hotel is about 5-10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. The Eiffel Tower area itself isn't all that wonderful considering all the other Paris neighborhoods you could be in. But, it was still adorable enough. The best thing about the location is that the metro is 2 minutes away and there are multiple lines. You can go almost anywhere from the station. But, you can also ramble all around by foot - it is close enough to all that Paris has to offer. The best thing about Hotel Ares is the helpful staff and the stylish (although very small) rooms. We booked everything through our hotel, including a quick reservation at Guy Savoy - one of the best restaurants in the world. I was surprised we got in! We had the hotel staff call around to talk to everybody for us because we know very little French. It helped for making all sorts of wonderful reservations! One of the coolest things we did was a romantic Citroen Tour where a cute french man comes and picks you up in a tiny Citroen convertible and drives you around to wherever you want to go, telling you all about things. It is very romantic and lovely! The rooms are very small, but very stylish with nice products. We couldn't really walk around in the room with our luggage out. We would have to roll over the bed at times just to get across. But, alas that is Paris for you. All the rooms are small. Some of the best days of my life started in this hotel (well it was my honeymoon) and I will never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a special character and flavor, fantastic, nice location & very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ArabSindibad
Reviews.Content: It's a hidden gem with stunning & charming modern interior design in a cozy atmosphere for excellent value for the money and it has a very very courteous hotel staff. I always remember the nice smiles of the gentle charming Parisian lady in the reception and the laughs of the late night duty receptionist from Ivory Coast ( Cote Devour). it would be very convenient for honeymooners like us. We were very warmly welcomed & they offered us complimentary services & gifts for our honeymoon. very easy to reach by metro ( 4 minutes walk) it was one of the best hotels we had stayed in in our Euro Honeymoon that lasted for 27 days. the toiletries were one of the greatest made by Hermes. I'd stay again in this hotel & I'd recommend it to all my friends. The one thing I didn't like about the hotel is that I didn't like the breakfast. I'd recommend to have your breakfasts in one of the nearby beautiful Parisian cafe shops or a breakfast on the go better than the hotel's breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rikkko
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true gem. The rooms are very nice, the staff is top class and the location is one of the best in Paris: away from crowd an noise but few minutes from eveything. I can only have positive words for Ares and, if back to Paris, it will be my choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: novakc
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. We had a triple room since our daughter (29) joined my husband and I for our last week in France. Yes, the room was small but we had enough room. The bathroom was a treat! I love to take baths. Hubby and daughter are shower people. The separate bath and shower were perfect for us and as a matter of fact, my husband took pictures because we are remodeling a bathroom! We never ate breakfast at the hotel during our three day stay. Instead we enjoyed nearby cafes. All of the people we dealt with were very friendly and one woman went out of her way to arrange the least expensive transportation for us to the airport. We were leaving at 1:30pm and wanted to spend some time walking in the morning. Worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymousx
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay this hotel. The lovely decor, the friendly staff and the location all make this hotel the perfect hideaway in Paris. Its just a short stroll away from the Eiffel Tower and Hotel Invalides so its in a great spot. We loved the fact that it wasn't in the main tourist area of Paris and enjoyed the quiet back streets of this great city. We stayed in the Junior Suite on the 7th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was gorgeous and the bed was so comfortable! Breakfast (although expensive at 14 Euros each) was delicious. We had breakfast in our room only once because there are so many cafes and patisseries near by which are perfect for people watching, we were spoilt for choice! Overall, its a great little boutique hotel which we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Anneel
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel! Previously we have stayed in big hotels, but never again. The service was even better than I expected, they were helpful, welcoming and had great suggestions. The rooms were smallish, but the space was well-utilized. The decor was exactly what I would have chosen for my own house. There was free internet, nice toiletries, a lovely breakfast, copies of the IHT, free Mac in the lobby. Close to the Metro, shopping, lots of little cafes (including one that was open quite late).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic area”
Reviews.Author: moretimeaway
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris. Stayed at Hotel Ares Eiffel for 7 days with my wife. The room was small but very clean and modern. Staff were friendly and helpful. Very close to the Metro station in a very clean and quiet area of Paris (the hotel is set back one block from the main road), and it was not a problem to travel to all areas (actually line 8 seemed to have the cleanest trains of all). Less than 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower/Champ de Mars and we were able to venture there on multiple occasions to capture the perfect photographs. Fantastic hotel and I would recommend this to anyone. Also, the local restaurant, La Gauloise (recommended by the hotel) was also notable in its quality, service and ambience. This was a perfect first holiday in Paris and my wife and I were very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel300463
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one week at this wonderful hotel. I studied most hotels on Tripadviser before coming to the final decision of booking this hotel. We booked an executive room which,( although was a little more expensive), was well worth the extra. The only little fault that i could include would be, as mentioned on the review below is that the breakfast lady was not as nice as the other staff. She did not like it when her routine or table settings were "mucked up"..not very friendly at all, BUT, all of the other staff were exceptional. Would most certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe boutique accomodation - a hidden gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sckc01
Reviews.Content: Purpose of the trip was a leisure weekend in Paris to see the sights with minimal travel time from our hotel. We are both usually business travellers, so we wanted a quality hotel with some luxuries, and hassle free service so we could focus on sightseeing and have a good night's sleep at the day. Booked though Hotelclub for Euro 245 per night. Hotel is a 20 minute taxi journey from Paris du Nord. Location is 5-10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. From our room #65 we could see the topmost spire of the tower. Hotel has chic boutique atmosphere. In a quiet neighbourhood (15th), discreetly signed, it’s almost as if you are a local. The hotel is completely renovated. Decoration and furnishings are high end (Versace bathroom, Hermes toiletries, Bang and Olufsen electronics, airconditioning/heating). Room is a very good size – two adults, two suitcases, two small backpacks – with room to move. Bed was comfortable. Housekeeping made the room up on a daily basis. Room has flat screen tv, safe (fits laptop), minibar (5 euro for one drink or for entire contents!), wardrobe and small writing table. Our room had two balconies (floor to ceiling windows) – which opened up the space and allowed fresh air. Bathroom was a decent size and modern with a rain shower plus handheld over the bath. There was also a bidet. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a little expensive at 14 euro – but produce was fresh. If you want to stay right in the middle of the night life or shopping – this is not the place for you. But if you want a luxe getaway with some Parisian character that is very close to amenities – this is perfect. Took heaps of photos of the room (and also had a look at one of their rooms on Level 4) - but didn't bother uploading. Just look at their website - what you see there is what you get. We also hired a scooter and most attractions were 5-10mins away from the hotel. Free wireless internet in room if you had your own phone or laptop. One public computer in the reception area - never saw a queue to use this computer.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: NürnbergSusanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family of 4. The room was very small, but cozy and nicely furnished, plus there was enough storage space. A few hooks for coats in the room would have been good. Also the bathroom was tiny, only one sink for 4, but the bathroom was spotless and had a very good shower. We felt very comfortable here. The metro is right around the corner and there are lots of nice cafes and restaurants nearby. The interior of the hotel is very stylish and proves of good taste of the owner. I liked the hotel a lot, only the atmosphere felt a little cool sometimes. I think a few candles in the lobby and offering coffee and wine in the afternoon would have made it a little more cozy after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast is good and offers a good variety of fresh products, the only thing I didn´t like was that our 8 year old was charged the full breakfast price, she eats 1 piece of toast!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Moulder70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing less than perfect. It's conveniently located, the staff is friendly, the rooms are very nice and the price is reasonable. I did spend only two night at Atres Hotel but I'm pretty sure I'll get back soon. I love Paris and now I love this hotel too!

Reviews.Title: “Great, small hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Dennis4817
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a trip to the Hotel Ares (family with 2 small children) staying in one of their deluxe rooms. The hotel was lovely, clean and friendly, very close to a metro station and only a short walk to the Champ de Mars and the Eiffel Tower. Our children adored this hotel and the staff were endlessly patient with their attempts to try out their French! The only negative thing I would say is that the breakfast, at €14 per person was very expensive. Having said that though, the hotel is located very close to a number of supermarkets, restaurants, bakers etc. so no real problem with going out to eat. All in all, our best holiday ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scully82
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. I've found it on tripadvisor and without any doubt it deserves his reputation. The rooms are very clean, the staff is fantastic and everything you want is very close. Restaurants, bistrots, monuments.... I had a very pleasant stay at Ares and strongly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful little hotel in a perfect neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jjsalome
Reviews.Content: We had 4 people in the largest room in this lovely little hotel. Although it was a small room, as all rooms in Europe tend to be, we were very comfortable. The hotel is beautiful and is in a great neighborhood. A real neighborhood, with real Parisians. Not touristy at all. Cute little restaurants - the metro station and a grocery store all within 2 blocks. On Wed & Sun there is a fun local market under the rail tracks. Wed is more clothing and Sun in more food - beautiful produce! Only a five minute walk through the park to the Eiffel Tower. Not inexpensive for sure, but spotlessly clean and very well appointed. I would totally recommend it and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasDrb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ares is a small hotel with contemporary furnishings, small room but good bed and linens, nice bathroom. Staff was helpful and friendly. Location was good, near Eiffel Tower and Metro--which is really easy to use. Lots of restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect first visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCA09
Reviews.Content: Great cozy little boutique hotel. Friendly staff. Rooms are very small but decorated super cute. Walking distance ti several underground stops so easy to get around! Would def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The location is perfect -- in a great neighborhood with fantastic cafes. The metro station is a two minute walk with access to the 6, 8, and 10 metro lines. The staff is immensely helpful (made all our dinner reservations ahead of time) and speak very good English. The rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable great beds with plush linens, wonderful showers and bathrooms. You can also access the contents of the mini-bar (water, soda) for 5 euros a day which also proved convenient. A few cons – the owner is very forward about guests writing trip advisor reviews to market the hotel; while the hotel deserves its rating this seems to distort the review process. Also – the Hermes bath products are wonderful, but they do not provide conditioner. On my next trip to Paris I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Ares Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: denkelleher
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for two nights for a special short city break to celabrate my wife's birthday. We found the hotel no problem. Staff couldn't have been anymore helpful especially as I have terrible French but tried my few words which (i think) were appreciated. I've read comments here that the rooms are small; well yes that's true but you must consider that this is the centre of paris and all boutique hotels have small rooms. Small it might have been but beautifully decorated and finished. In particular the bed clothes, soft furnishings and bathroom fittings are to a very high standard. Hotel was quiet and comfortable. We did not have the breakfast as there are so many places to grab a cafe and eats all around the city. Free WiFi in the hotel is good and was able to use a Mac and printer in the common reception area at no charge. Centrally located with Metro around the corner. All in All a great stay. Would return again

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, standard rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: gida1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was up to date and had a modern and welcoming feel to it. The decor is very nice and exceeded our expectations. The vercace tile is beautiful in the bathroom and the Hermes toiletries are a nice touch. We stayed in a standard room, it was clean, charming and inviting however it was very small. We had two large suitcases and it was difficult to find space for both and still be able to walk around without bumping into them. The bed was comfortable. Staff was helpful and polite and provided us with a shuttle to airport for 36.00 Euro rather then paying a taxi close to double this. Hotel has a great location, 1.5 blocks to the metro which you can catch to any of the sights. Hotel is approx. a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tower where you can also purchase tickets for the "Batobus" which is a hop on hop off boat tour to the main sighs such as the Louvre, Notradame etc. There is tons of excellent bakeries and shopping in the area as well. The hotel offers breakfast for 14.00 Euro however we did not try as we went out and discovered the various bakeries around the hotel. Would stay again however would definitely upgrade to a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and fashionable but very small by American Standards”
Reviews.Author: zeniatrips
Reviews.Content: Asked for Superior room. Was perfectly clean, quiet and well located for travelers who have seen Paris so often before. So that area was new for us. Petit déjeuner was extra but was buffet style and intimate, agreable. For a short stay, it's fine. Noteworthy, reception officers go out of their way to recommend places to eat, to add pillows or whatever your fancy. They care.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel for a romantic getaway.”
Reviews.Author: racerx-dan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "Classic" room for a long weekend to celebrate an anniversary and was VERY happy with our stay. The room was just as shown in the pics on the hotels website and very clean, and well maintained and the usual size of a Paris hotel room. The staff were all friendly (especially the blonde lady), more than happy to speak English and accommodated all our requests. The owner spoke with us after our stay to check that everything had been perfect for us which was nice. The Hotel is in a quiet residential area one street back from the main road, and about 200 meters from the La Motte - Piquet Metro stop. The immediate surrounding area has plenty of cafe's, brassieres, restaurants and patisseries so you will have no problem being fed and watered close to home. The location is great and you are only a 5 min walk from the Eiffel tower or the Seine not to mention heaps of other places to see. Breakfast was a bit steep at €14 per person so we just grabbed a coffee and croissant at one of the many places close by on our way out sightseeing in the morning. On the other hand the mini bar had 8 (not alcoholic) drinks in it and was charged at €5 total per day which is very reasonable... so we helped our self and it worked out cheaper than buying water, juice and coke on the street during the day. The only very very minor things I could say if I was looking to pick fault would be that the only English channels available were CNN & BBC Prime, ideally a couple more would have been good. It would have also been nice to have a menu in the room for wine, beer or champagne. One night we got in after most cafes were closed and would have liked to had a bottle of wine brought up to the room... perhaps they offer this, but it was late and we didn't ask and when we couldn't find a menu in the room we went to bed. We don't usually spend this much on hotels when going away, infact this was the most we have every spent, but for a special occasion it was worth it and I would definitely stay here again for a relaxing/romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “You should take a look at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bo C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ares in Paris from October 1st - 5th, 2009 and loved it. We love the hotel location. It’s in a quiet neighborhood but only a ten-minute walk to Eiffel Tower, and five minutes from sidewalk cafes, bakeries, flower shop and the La Motte Picquet Metro Station on Line 6. We used this station everyday to go to all places in Paris. Hotel staff speak English and were very helpful. The room, although small, was clean and has a very comfortable bed. Its marble bathroom is new and roomy. I love the color schemes on the walls, furniture, and drapes. Our fourth-floor room looks out on the quiet Larminat Street. For travelers who have to work while on vacation like me, the free Wi-Fi service was very appreciated. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet for 14 Euros per person but we never tried it. We preferred to go to neighborhood cafes to have our breakfasts. We paid 280 US dollars per night for the room and it was worth every dollar. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and elegant, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jill_Mpls
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ares Eiffel was everything we expected and more. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the room was sparkling clean and very nicely decorated, and the location was excellent. It was in walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the metro was only a few blocks away. The hotel itself was very clean, and our room was decorated in elegant French colors and designs. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: London338
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is nothing but the best from service, cleanliness, helpful owners and staff. It is centrally located and is 10 minutes walk to the Effiel Tower and it is 2-minute walk from the Metro. The pastry shops in the neighbourhood are amazing. We stayed at their suite which has a round bed and is very spacious. More particularly, we're very impressed with how clean the hotel is kept. We have fresh, perfectly pressed sheets every day and a spotless room.

Reviews.Title: “good as rated by TA”
Reviews.Author: dag1960
Reviews.Content: chose the hotel base on TA reviews. On the money. Clean, large rooms, large bath and free internet. What else can you expect (especially in Paris.). Josh at the front desk would be your best bet when it comes to recommending and your overall needs. Keep in mind that there are no irons in the rooms and the only why to iron is to go downstairs and use the "communal" iron and board, so if you are in a hurry for dinner plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Peaches912
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ares for the last 2 nights of our Honeymoon while in Paris. It was a bit of a splurge as the hotel was a bit costly but you definitely get your money's worth. We stayed in one of their Executive rooms. It was a gorgeous, good sized room with a well sized bathroom as well. The free internet in the room was a great plus. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location was great! A 5 minute walk to the Champs de Mars and the Eiffel Tower. Overall, if you are looking for a hotel in this price range I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: MargeauxLouisiana
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small ,I had a room that sleeps 4 and needed more space . Only three of us were traveling.The hotel was very clean and so were the guestrooms. The saff was very helpful. A true feel of Paris. romance.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: fgto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an hidden secret. I don't think you can find something better in Paris at these rates.
