The hotel is conveniently located, walking distance from the Eiffel Tower and public trasportation. The Staff in incredible. We personally met the owner an he spent hours with us suggesting the best spots, walks and restaurant in Paris. The rooms are very clean and perfectly decorated. I strongly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “All round excellence”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Adams71
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an excellent weekend away staying at the Hotel Ares Eiffel. The hotel is very conveniently located around a 3 minute walk away from a very convenient metro line connecting to the rest of the city. There is also a fabulous chocolatiere/patisserie just around the corner called "la petite chocolatiere". The hotel itself has been tastefully refurbished recently to a very high standard. Many of the previous reviews have mentioned the versace tiles etc. My own highlights were the comfort of the bed, dark wooden floors throughout, well proportioned bathrooms with high quality interiors. My only reason for giving 4 stars is that i booked a superior room with queen bed but on the first night was given 2 singles, this was corrected for the 2nd night. I'd also recommend trying to book the higher floors for better views and less proximity to other rooms on either side.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaCat22
Reviews.Content: The Ares is a fabulous place to call 'home' while in Paris. Our room was squeaky clean and more spacious than I expected [still small compared to American hotel rooms, but spacious by European standards]. The bed linens were luxurious and the street very quiet. The best sleep we got on our entire trip. The bathroom was generously sized, even for my 6'4" husband and beautifully appointed. Plenty of hot water and great water pressure. The entire place, our room and common areas, smelled great. It was just a wonderful experience. I had booked this hotel for us and the other couple we were traveling with based on reviews on this site. The reviews were all accurate and I highly recommend this hotel. Everyone behind the front desk was very helpful and all spoke English. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful hotel, wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: katweller
Reviews.Content: I have to give this hotel 10/10 for everything. Staff- Very helpful, lots of smiles and goes the extra mile (recommending restaurants etc) Location- The location was unbelievable, 5-10 minutes stroll to the eiffel tower (literally just round the corner) with a metro stop 3 minutes down the road. A very central hotel. Rooms- Brand spanking new. Everything is a brand 'Bang and olufsen' and even the bathroom tiles were 'Versace' . Its the small details that made all the difference. We had such a welcoming and warm stay i didn't want to leave. Pillows to die for, slept so well! Location- Unbelievable, 5-10 minutes stroll to the eiffel tower with a metro stop 3 minutes down the road. The hotel is in a very quiet neighbourhood but with restaurants and brasseries just round the corner. I would definately come back here, it is expensive but well worth it!!! Book through another website (thomson hotels/ expedia etc) for cheaper rate!! Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: katzjoe
Reviews.Content: Great location! Will stay here again when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: giaKo72
Reviews.Content: This is the easiest review to write: the Ares Eiffel is simply super! The rooms are quite and very well decorated, the WiFi connection is fast and reliable and the bathroom (Versace tiles!) is gorgeous. The staff is even better: very friendly and ready to help, no matter what you ask. I strongly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive”
Reviews.Author: ConteUs
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not quite what I thought from the pics on their website. Rooms are extremely small, but I guess you are in Paris. We got upgraded and our room was still really small, I can't imagine my original room size! Breakfast was bad. not a lot of choices. Staff was good. Location is really convenient. 10m walk to the Eifel tower and 3m to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Liverpool0879
Reviews.Content: Rooms are lovely, well decorated and clean. Staff very friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants etc. We didn't have breakfast included so felt 14 euros pp was bit steep. Located near to a metro stop and easy to get to to, would reccommed a metro ticket for the length of your stay as not near enough to walk to from main attractions, except eiffel tower ( but that is at least 15-20 min.) Facilities in room are good and a safe in the room. The toiletries were empty on arrival and did not get re-filled, am sure if I had asked though they would definately have done this. Reception is lovely and we sat here for a rest one day, staff kept offering us tea and coffee. Would reccommend this hotel if staying in paris

Reviews.Title: “great location boutique style hotel sensibly priced”
Reviews.Author: reikizenman
Reviews.Content: The Ares Eiffel is 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower and wonderfully placed for seeing the best of Paris. It's spotlessly clean, stylishly decorated and the service is excellent. Superb value for the quality on offer. You could easily pay 100 euros more for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MarkECheltenham
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through Eurostar and previewed the Ares through Trip Advisor and I have to say the hotel did not disappoint. The entire hotel is very stylishly decorated and is very comfortable. We travelled with our 7 and 2 year old daughters and the room was great - a double bed for us, fold out arm chair beds for the girls. The en-suite bathroom was snug but fine for a two night stay with gorgeous Hermes soaps and gels. The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel tower and the surrounding area (Motte-Piquet Grenelle) is prosperous, safe and clean with a decent selection of bistros and bars. I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel Ares Paris to anyone looking to spend a few days in Paris and the owner and his wife (whom we met on our last day with their two daughters) have done a fantastic job at creating a stylish, friendly hotel in the centre of Paris. It would definitely be a return visit for us when we come back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sousoucat
Reviews.Content: I used tripadvisor to review people's comment and chose this hotel for our stay in Paris. Room is small but is enough. Great location and close to the metro. Bathroom is great and the hotel is very clean which is very important to me. (Usually bring my own sheets to hotels). Staff spoke english and were very friendly. Suggested great reastaurent and helped with tips. Bring your hair conditioner if you use one as they don't provide that. If you want to treat your self to wonderful (Super expensive but worth it) dinner, try Les Ombers. Need reservation but it is by the Eiflle Tower.. Enjoy and thanks for the prior reviews for recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: gcol
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a really great place to stay in Paris. Its in a lovely quiet area, but only a short walk from some great areas like the eiffel tower. The staff were very efficient, very friendly and really made you feel at home. Its a little pricey at the moment due to the £/Euro exchange rate, but we got a pretty good deal and woudl definitely stay here again next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a quiet residential area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lissie123
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a deluxe room (sleeps up to 4 people) on the basis that previous reviews hasd described the rooms as being small. I'm glad I did as even the deluxe was a bit on the cosy side. Having said that the decor was beautiful, there was plenty of closet space and I particularly liked the Versace tiles in the bathroom. The room was cleaned to a high standard and at night there was very little noise. The area itself is very quiet, the hotel being just off the fairly busy road, La Motte Picquet Grenelle and literally 5 mins to the metro stop. There are several street cafes and boulangeries nearby as well as a larger supermarket, Monoprix. I would recommend this hotel to people who would like to stay slightly away from the main hustle and bustle of Paris. The eiffel tower is 10mins away and the metro station is served by several different lines making the majority of Paris easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great room and great location!”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor and we weren't disappointed. The rooms are finished to a high standard, the location of the hotel is both great for the Metro and for the Eiffel Tower and the staff are helpful and friendly. We would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “better than on the official side”
Reviews.Author: nic0782
Reviews.Content: we were very nicely surprised at hotel ares all the people working in they wre very gentle and helpful,the hotel is really very well decorated and there is a lot of atention at all details you have free internet wirless onthe tv and inthe lobby with an imac thebreakfast was very goood and not expensive compared at the same level of the hotel .we loved so muh the ares that we hope to come back for end of the year .the eiffel tower is at seven minutes by feet and metro is at hundred meters fromthe hotel .we reccomend strongly this hotel to all the people that want togo for holidays in paris.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: pas21
Reviews.Content: i have been at hotel ares with colleagues and i discver this hotel is wonderfully decorated the service is very gentle and helpful the location is five minutes from eiffel tower and the metro is only hundred meters from the ares. i think i willcome with my family in december because i liked too much paris and the ares.i reccomend rally this hotel

Reviews.Title: “If you like Boutique hotels, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: enigmatic1jen
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel via the nearby metro, I was surprised. I had read reviews that had said it was a "quiet area" which was definitely accurate. My husband and I were in Paris for two nights on our way to Greece so we were not looking for night life, which was good because there was not much around. The hotel itself is very chic, from the Versace tiles in the bathrooms to the Hermes soap and lotion. The bathroom, was lovely and large by Paris standards, however, the room itself was on the small side. It is also a little challenging to find as it is tucked behind a main street and not many people seemed to know where it was. The room was comfortable, and the staff was helpful (probably more helpful to us because my husband spoke French, otherwise it might have been more of a challenge as I tried to speak to them in English several times and seemed to struggle). The location was just a short 5-10 minute walk from the Eiffel tower, and there were several charming cafes near by with delicious food. To get to some of the other main attractions though, can be a good 30-40 minute walk, however, the hotel itself is in a very safe area. We could not see the Eiffel tower from our room, however, we did enjoy seeing it lit up from the street when we walked back each evening. Overall, if you are looking for a boutique style hotel, near the Eiffel tower, and do not need all the extra frills of a larger hotel, then this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunam365
Reviews.Content: Hi! we've just been a week ago, i went with my spouse and friends and loved the hotel. we had the quadruple room and a double room. the hotel itself is literally 5 minutes from the tour de effiel, with lots of shops, mac'd's, a supermarket, lots of cafe's and a metro just 2 minutes walk. the hotel staff were really helpful..providing us midnight water fills to the kitchen and helping us store our luggage on the last day whilst we visited the city. the room was fab! had a mini safe, mini fridge, fab balcony, comfortable beds and a wicked shower! all in all i have already recommended this hotel to lots of my friends and would highly recommend it. i booked with eurostar so from gare du nord it was only 2 trains, roughly 20minutes directly to the hotel and to euro disney it took around 40 minutes by train. the hotel is fabulous..and definantly go!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good sized rooms, nice staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: VDSM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior double room, it was quite large, especially for Paris, very clean and completeley spotless. We will be more than happy to stay again. The staff were always courteous and friendly, helping us with our poor French and making our stay feel very welcome. The local metro station is on three lines, handy for wherever you are in Paris. The metro is only 100 yards or so from the hotel too. Planty of places to eat nearby, and a short stroll and you see the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: tiniccio
Reviews.Content: very well decorated nice service nice location what else?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Paris location near Eiffel Tower -- small room”
Reviews.Author: bigd13
Reviews.Content: This hotel came as recommended -- nice location within an 8 to 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower in a safe, quiet residential area. The hotel is small with few services. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, providing excellent dining, sightseeing and shopping tips. The breakfast was good, with a nice selection. Our room, supposedly "deluxe", was tiny. There wasn't enough room to store our suitcases anywhere. Also, the lobby area was being painted for the 3 days we were there, which was a bit unpleasant. Go for the larger room!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied--just want I wanted”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasTravelhog
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Ares Eiffel recently and were very happy with our choice. We also spent 3 nights at Hotel d'Aubbusson and loved it as well. They are both very different and in very different parts of Paris and I am very glad we did it this way. The Ares Eiffel is very modern and clean. We had a nice corner room on the 6th floor (#65) I think it was one step up from the basic room. (maybe it was called superior) As others have said, the breakfast was not worth the money and we found a nice cafe just a few blocks away. This hotel is for people who want a great room in a nice area but don't need alot of special services--no restaurant, bell hop, large lobby etc. We enjoyed our stay would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kennethwidmerpool
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stylishly decorated with comfortable, air-conditioned rooms and large, well-equipped bathrooms. The location is excellent, conveniently close to a metro station with lines that take you straight to most of the main tourist sites. There is free wi-fi, plus an iMac available for guests to use in the lobby. Generous buffet breakfast available, but a good choice of restaurants near by if you want to eat out. Reception staff are helpful and speak English. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GKam
Reviews.Content: Great place. The hotel is not big but rooms are quiet, clean and beautifully decorated. The staff is helpful and corteous. Stop searching for a good hotel in Paris. This is THE hotel. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A touch of Italian style in Paris”
Reviews.Author: alex1210
Reviews.Content: In this hotel you can find a real exemple of the italian "bon gout", just staying fiew meters near the most known french symbol... The staff is absolutely polite and helpful, the room was clean, relaxing and quiet, with comfortable bed. The breakfast was just delicious ! I have finally got my "coup de coeur" in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Hotel!!! Just Book It!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal80
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this charming hotel...it looks exactly like the pictures on their website...the location is absolutely perfect on a quiet street, but close to all the action and main attractions...the staff is above and beyond wonderful and helpful! When I return to Paris, I will look no further...I found the most perfect hotel!!! Just book it...forget the rest...

Reviews.Title: “ares the top quality”
Reviews.Author: newyorknewyork71
Reviews.Content: paris is always nice but when you find the right adress is more nice and is what is happened to me . it was not the first time that i was in paris and te ares gives the right answers to all my questions the hotel is very stylish and a lot of attention at the details.the hotel is refurbished last year so everithing is new and top quality standard.i had an executive room and was roomy and it was a great bathroom with a big shower and a bath the tiles are signed versace, so the bathroom was very big for paris the bed was really confortable .I Liked so much all the the hotel that i reccomend to allwho are looking for a home in paris for fe days . the location is perfect you have many lines of metros statig les than hundred meters from ares ther are many restaurants nearby .the service is always gentle and helpful all the time.sothis will be my new home wen i will come back

Reviews.Title: “1st in the hotel, lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: karenparisParis
Reviews.Content: My usband has been in this hotel before on a business trip and loved the hotel, he dragged me there and I was very happy, the decoration is a mix of modern italian and some ancient materials such as marble, sumply beautifull, it a few minutes away from the Eiffel Tower, that alone is amazing, the reception area is not very big, but enought if there is not too many persons to relay.

Reviews.Title: “Still incredible”
Reviews.Author: SergeParis001
Reviews.Content: Back in Ares and it was still a great experience, it is one of the closest hotel to the Tour Eiffel, the street is really quiet, the recepetion doesnt speak too well english but is nice. They now have a Imac in receeption which is also good, I regret that there is no Pan cake in the break fast ! :-) as I love pan cakes but the rest is really close to perfect, honnestly the price value is great My wife was delighted and I also ask her to put up a review

Reviews.Title: “Like Being A Resident”
Reviews.Author: fikto
Reviews.Content: After several trips to Paris staying in larger, 4 star hotels, I opted for a more low key and less expensive approach this time. The reviews for the Ares looked promising so I gave it a try. It was as good as advertised, and I found the location quiet, but convenient. The 15th is more residential than other arrondissments but you are within a 5 minute walk of the Metro, dozens of cafes and the Champs de Mars. The building is beautiful and tucked away on a small side street. This made me feel like I was a resident rather than a tourist. The tiny reception area and friendly staff made it feel more so. I booked the basic room and it was indeed very small but nicely appointed with a good double bed and designer bathroom. It was the same size as a typical boutique hotel in New York and couples should probably opt for a larger room. Extremely clean. My only complaint is that they did not include breakfast, as is the case at many French hotels. For the price, they should offer at least coffee and pastries. I liked the mini bar policy, however. You could help yourself to all its contents (soft drinks and water) for only 5 euros a day. The free, fast WIFI was also good. There's probably a cheaper room in the area, perhaps larger, but I doubt it would be as pleasant. After all, you don't just pay for square footage but for the entire experience. If you are looking for a hotel that offers charm and low key luxury, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: bpp122
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very clean and well presented and the staff were extremely helpful BUT having returned 3 weeks later to Paris to stay for a longer time, we realised that we had paid top dollar for a very small room with a hard bed. We opted for a deluxe room based on previous reviews about the size of the rooms but even the larger room was tiny, including the cramped ensuite. It is a good area to stay in as it is not too noisy and packed with tourists but I think you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “OK -comfortable stay but I am sorry to say that I probably would not stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: simone24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for one night last weekend. We chose the hotel based on the trip advisor reviews. We booked the hotel with booking.com. We booked a superior room inc. breakfast which cost us 253 Euros in total. Pros: We arrived early at about 11am and we could check in and go to our room straight away which was very nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is decorated nicely. The bathroom was perfect; shower was very powerful – which we loved! Someone on here also said there is no full length mirror in the room, in our room there was – it was on the inside wardrobe door, which was good enough for me. The beds were fine in my opinion. However, the mattress is a little hard and if you don’t like that you would probably find the bed uncomfortable. There are a lot of nice restaurants and cafés close by and the metro is not far away either. They also offer free wireless internet which was nice! Oh yes, we drove there by car and we could park right outside the hotel for free which was super nice!! Cons: The hotel and rooms are small (but from a Parisian perspective they are probably spacious – most hotel rooms in Paris are small, also keep in mind that a 4 star hotel in Paris is not the equivalent of staying at a 4 star in London or Dublin) There is no bar and the lounge/ lobby is like a small living room. The location is ok; it is about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. The breakfast was terrible I do not recommend you to get it. I am an Irish gal and I love my “fry up” and what this hotel offered as a fry up was horrible. Scrambled egg was very rubbery and the sausages were just disgusting (kind of like salami). The continental breakfast was average. Overall, it was a comfortable stay but I am sorry to say that I probably would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a value for the money”
Reviews.Author: jsilverman
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 weeks in France. I stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of my trip. It is clean, and the location is excellent. There is NO view of the Eiffel tower unless you consider the very top 20 meters in view above buildings blocking your view --as a view. The hotel was very good, pricey - but good. I have to give it a bad rating because of the beds. Worst nights sleep over two nights that I had in France. I was in 5 hotels traveling through France on my vacation - these beds were horrendous. Choose elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish place-pity about the size”
Reviews.Author: naturalb0rntraveller
Reviews.Content: Great beautiful rooms as reported by the viewers here; and though the size of the room wa bigger than I was warned by reviewers here- the rooms could be bigger esp for the price you pay staying here...

Reviews.Title: “as you are living there”
Reviews.Author: fadimurad
Reviews.Content: near to everything and anything, Eifel tower 10 min, laundry, park, big grocery store, café shops restaurants, metro and all 4 min walking. the hotel in a location between residence building so being there gives you the feel of you are as well resident. and this is nice. the staff were amazing and very helpful and joyful me and my family really like them allot. the price little bit high but worth it, i didn't like the breakfast but my wife and my kid liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Finally affordable luxury in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kdet
Reviews.Content: It is so hard to find good hotels in Paris without paying an arm and a leg. This one is not cheap... but at least you get value for your money. The location is perfect: close to the Eiffel Tour and on a quiet street. The hotel is beautiful, the designer has a great eye for details. And the rooms are actually good sized rooms for Paris! Beautiful decor, comfy beds... Versace tiled bathroom with Hermes soap and shampoo. Oddly enough the B&O TV had terrible reception so it was a bit of a waste of a good TV. Breakfast was an expensive disappointment but it so often is in hotels... I'll definitely go back again - without the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennaleeLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ares Eiffel Hotel for 4 nights in the beginning of July, we booked the executive room which fits 3 people. The room was very nicely decorated, the bathroom was fabulous with nice hermes shampoo and soap. Hotel is in great location, I will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean and modernized, with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: algaic
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a bit on a smaller side but I guess thats what expected in Paris. However, the amenities are all modernized, particularly bathrooms. Location is great, just minutes from the Metro, with several nice cafes/bistros around. Staff very helpful - there is no snootiness, or pretentiousness (a big myth by the way). Room was always clean. Only minor nuisance - no iron in the room, had to iron in the utility closet. Also, TV remote wasnt working well. Aside from that, a fantastic place to stay. And the price was definitely manageable.

Reviews.Title: “tredy hotel ares”
Reviews.Author: maverick35
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel very good service and location five minutes from eiffel towers .definetly our home when we'll come again in paris

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMCAP
Reviews.Content: My wife and two daughters (ages 9 and 13) spent four splendid nights at this charming hotel. The room was lovely, the furnishings exemplary, and the service superb. We could not have had a better stay. There were lovely restaurants just outside the door, a host of cafes nearby, and convenient access to the Paris metro. Better still, we were just a ten minute walk to the Eiffel tower and tad bit more the Champs Elysee. Our room included a queen size bed and two pullout chair-beds for the girls. The amenities were lovely. We'd happily return during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resting ground for honeymoon in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sacramentonian
Reviews.Content: Worth every penny. Short walk to the Eiffel Tower, Metro stop, and tons of restaurants and shops. Situated in a great residential neighborhood, for a nice blend of tourism and Parisian life. The staff was incredible, and the rooms were nicely appointed in modern design, but with nods to classical Parisian style. I can't say a bad thing about it--the place really was a memorable part of our honeymoon. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: mito57
Reviews.Content: I spent few days at hotel ares the hotel is really luxury ,the service is veryefficient and veryn helpful , the location is exeptional five minutes by feet from the eiffel tower and hundred fifty meters from the metro the ares is very quiet .so i have had marvellous moments at this hotel. I reccomend the ares to all that are looking for a very elegant an modern place to visit paris

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good place”
Reviews.Author: ppp9
Reviews.Content: High quality and well equipped room inlcuding the bathroom. Typical building and room style for the quiet and nice area. Friendly staff. Our only negative experience was that house-keeping always happened late, during or after lunch, up until 4 p.m. and there was continuously slow or missing supply of lotion, shampoo etc. We stayed there for a full two weeks and found this to be both unnessary and somewhat annoying based on high expectations which otherwise were fulfilled.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor but too expensive for what it offered”
Reviews.Author: terminal2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet street, near an antiques district and 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. Restaurants/cafes within a 2 minute walk, also near a train station. It is beautifully decorated and the receptionist Isabelle was very helful with pre stay questions I had ( emailed back straight away) as well as during our stay. We had a classic room ( internet rate 240 Euros), it had everything you needed but no more. The room was tiny, but guess normal in a period block in Paris. Double bed, 1 chair/small table/flatscreen TV, the bathroom had a shower only. The decor was beautiful, Hermes toileteries etc. There is no mirror in the room other than above the bathroom sink. For 280 Euros a night at their standard rate that is one thing you would expect, in fact it is the first hotel I ever stayed in that had no full lenght mirror. The hairdryer was located in the wardrobe but was not portable. For that amount of money I expect to be able to see myself drying my hair and how I look before heading out the door. Not sure what others hotel in Paris offer as it is a British/American thing but it would have been nice to be able to make a coffee/tea first thing in the morning. The lobby was also beautiful with lots of books/magazines/apple computer for guest use and a small breakfast room. However, if you have the choice to sit in a windowless beautiful room and have your breakfast ( 16 Euro) or sit in a streetside cafe 2 minutes away soaking up the atmosphere for and have a delicious breakfast ( 9 Euro), which would you prefer ? I can not find anything wrong with the hotel at all but I think for the money you could possibly find a place that had more of a buzz. It would be much better to have a bar downstairs that served drinks/coffee but guess maybe planning laws might not allow it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, a little small but manageable”
Reviews.Author: mountainview29
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Hotel Ares my mom, sister, and I were smitten. The location is wonderful although make sure you get directions because we got lost more than once coming back to the hotel. Skip the shuttle (51 euros for 3 people) and get a cab- it's not worth the headache. This hotel is walking distance to so many great cafe's and the metro. The room is on the small side (we had three people in one room) but the amentiies were great. The one complaint I have is with the shower. It leaked every morning and it took quite a bit of clean up after each turn. Other than that, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good things in small packages”
Reviews.Author: waypat
Reviews.Content: Room was a little small but clean and tidy. Hotel location is excellent and staff are very helpful and polite. First impressions were not great but lasting impressions were really good. Only stayed a couple of nights, but would recommend for those staying longer too.

Reviews.Title: “exeptional hotel ares”
Reviews.Author: franky5312
Reviews.Content: ihave been with some collegues in Paris and we spent nice time at hotel ares even if we wre for work .The hotel is really gorgeus all details are at top quality .Thehotel is really very quiet and calm tha is very important after a day of business.the service is very good and the people at reception is very gentle and helpful.the location is great just five minutes to walk to the eiffel tower the metro is at hundred meters .the wifi is free and in the lobby you have internet point and if you are little bit lazy you can have internet on the television in your room for free .the minibar is only five euro per day .and the breakfast is really o.k. for sixteen euro for all you get you can eat as you want. i will reccomend to all thi wonderful hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MaisonBlanc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel, as part of a treat for my Husband's Birthday and our 6 month wedding anniversary. We had found it on the intranet and then looked at the reviews on Trip Advisor which on the whole were good. We had a room on the 6th Floor with a balcony and a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower which was great, the champagne that I had ordered was ready and waiting in the room on arrival. Our room was decorated very tastefully, we had a separate toilet and bathroom with some lovely Hermes toiletries which were replaced daily. The cupboard space was build in but very limited, and the hangers did not fit in properly when you put clothes on them. The other thing we found was that the walls were quite thin and we could hear the shower, toilet etc of the people next door, so take some ear plugs! Having said that the Hotel is elegant, tastefully decorated, staff are really helpful, the breakfast was nice, although expensive we only had it on our last day to save time. The location is a big plus point, situated off the main street, so actually is quiet, but close enough for a big choice of restaurants and the Metro. The Eiffel Tower a stones throw away, and actually a number of places if you like walking are walkable. Although a couple of small niggles we would definitely go back to this hotel again for a city break, due to the location and the style of it.......

Reviews.Title: “A magical visit to Paris with fabulous accommodation”
Reviews.Author: arushe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely comfortable and set in a very quiet and peacful area. Everywhere was easily accessible from the hotel with the metro only a few minutes away. We walked a lot and found getting around very easy also. The Eiffel Tower is five minutes walk away. There are lovely restaurants and cafes all around the area of the hotel and we had a very relaxed stay. I cant recommend this hotel enough. There is absolutely nothing negative that I can say about the hotel. Thanks to all the staff for a most enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Paris - so so”
Reviews.Author: rcrawford
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was incredibly small and noisy, although clean and perfectly located. Bear that in mind when booking.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel,perfect details,elegant decoration,kind staff”
Reviews.Author: esk0
Reviews.Content: short stay but enjoyed the hotel very much after a full week of business meetings & relaxed with confortable & elegant little details & clean & quiet environment. sure we'll be back for another stay there. thanks to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “very nice holyday”
Reviews.Author: kappao
Reviews.Content: i have discovered the hotel through trip advisor and i do not regret ,because the hotel is wonderful a lot of attention to the details .me and my wife have really appreciated the design of this hotel. the service is very good and the people at tdesk is very gentle and helpful .the location is great just five minutes to walk to the eiffel tower and in a real french side .we reccomend the hotel ares to all that want come in paris to spend a holyday.

Reviews.Title: “A Tight Fit”
Reviews.Author: MrSimpkins
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The decor was lovely - the only dissapointment was the space in the bedroom. We were seemingly upgraded but our toilet was in a cupboard and the wardrobe was so narrow - narrower than the width of a coathanger, as we discovered when we could not shut the wardobe door! I did not expect a lot of space but I did expect to be able to hang up clothes and close the wardrobe door. There are great restaurants on Avenue de la Motte-Piquet, 2 mins walk from hotel. We especially liked Goldoni's (Italian) and La Gitane (French). There is also a great but expensive deli called Gou (also on Motte-Piquet) which specialises in wine, cheese, bread, ham and wonderful savoury and sweet concotions made on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: FLA1284
Reviews.Content: The accomadation where great and the location perfect for Metro transpartaion r just walking the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pie2
Reviews.Content: After a two week trip to Europe, we ended our stay at Hotel Ares Eiffel. The location is excellent -- we could safely walk to the Eiffel Tower at night. (about 4-6 blocks away) Lots of good places to eat, a pharmacy, an ATM (BTW: If you're a BofA customer, look for BNP Paribas in Paris -- they will not charge fees for getting cash), and a small grocery store are all around the corner. Rooms are moderate-to-large for a European hotel (but there is not a lot of closet/storage space). The hotel is pretty quite despite the fact that the first or second floor is being completely renovated (though some hotel guests do slam their doors). The bed and linens are very good. The bathroom with shower (no tub) is plenty big for one person (but a little tight for two. Note: The towel hook is behind the mirror, which is a tad awkward). You can access the Internet in room via a keyboard and the flat screen television. My partner tried and it took him a couple of tries to get the knack of it (I used the computer in the lobby/lounge to print our boarding pass, check e-mail, etc.). I believe the hotel has room service but we didn't use it. We ate breakfast (two mornings) at the hotel and despite the fact it was $16 euros each. Croissants, pastries, turkey "lunch meat," sausage, eggs with cheese, cereal, fruit salad, juice, coffee, hot chocolate -- descent spread, with descent food. The staff is friendly and while all are French, speak English, so no need to have any language concerns (though it would be polite to TRY and speak a little French). All in all, a great place to stay, if you looking for a little boutique hotel that's not stuffy or frilly. In many respects, if felt more like we were staying "at home," versus in a hotel (except that you leave your very large room key -- it also controls the room light (though one of the lights by the bed didn't seem to work) -- at the front desk, and you have to be let in by hotel staff after the sun goes down). I do think the hotel might be a tad expensive (versus what you might get in terms of amenties and services in a US hotel) but the price is not over the top (via Orbits, we paid just over $250 per night include tax). Bienvenue!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: amo77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Beautiful decoration. Very clean. Friendly staff. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JP22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Ares Eiffel for five nights during our recent trip to Europe, and had a very nice time. The location is fantastic – you are a quick walk to a major metro stop, just a few minutes (walking) from the Eiffel Tower, and are very close to tons of restaurants and shops. And, despite everything around it, the hotel is actually very quiet and relaxing, as it is tucked away on a non-busy street. We did not really need them to provide us with any extra services, and we did not have breakfast at the hotel, so I cannot comment on either of those areas. Though, the staff was always quite friendly and pleasant, and seemed eager to please. In addition, our room was in perfect condition and very clean, and again, you can’t beat the location. We absolutely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It was a surprising stay”
Reviews.Author: Ed59Roma
Reviews.Content: Although I was in Paris only for biz, I really enjoyed my stay at Ares. Privileged location, comfortable room (everything is new), free wireless internet and, last but not least, helpful and friendly staff make this hotel one of the best I've ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel; wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: mmg65
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous time at the Ares. The room was a good size by European standards. The bathroom was compact but efficiently laid out. Everything is new and very stylishly done. The location was fabulous. Very residential with many bistros/cafes around the corner and excellent metro access. Most importantly (for me) the bed was extremely comfortable and the room was silent at night. I slept very very well. I wouldn't bother with the breakfast (expensive for what you're getting and it's in a windowless room). But that's not at all a problem given the numerous cafes nearby where you sit and enjoy your croissant on a patio! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “feel like at home”
Reviews.Author: romeo24
Reviews.Content: i have been for work in paris and i choose the hotel ares because some friend said to me that was the correct address ad i have to say that i was not disappointed the free internet wireless to work has been appreciated like the internet point in the lobby .the hoteli gorgeus every think is top qualyty you can see on the details my room was a classic i didnt find little also if american standards ar different but i have been in paris several times an i can assure that there are other hotels with really smaller rooms then here. the locatin i very good because you have three lines of metro just hundred meters from the hotel many good restaurants near the hotel and the symbol of paris is is just 7 minutes from the hotel .i'll reccomend to all my friends and to all they wanto go to paris and feel like home in paris

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justinssvc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ares in a superior room for 5 nights and it was great!!! We arrived, checked in easy, got our free wireless internet code and went to our room. Now understand, the room is small compared to American standards, but it was still great. Nice big bed, firm mattress. When we leaned out our window, we had a view of the Eiffel Tower! There is a separate toilet closet and shower so your partner does not have to deal with anything funky coming from the toilet area. LCD tv on the wall, a fridge that provided 2 waters, 2 sparkling waters, 2 cokes, 2 diet cokes and 2 orange sodas, you can have as much as you want for 5 euro total, which is a great deal considering 1 bottled water in Paris is 5 euro. Showers were clean, great water pressure, Hermes bath soaps provided. There was a breakfast each morning included that was continental style, but still had hot eggs, along with meats, cheeses, fruit, pastries, breads, cereal, yogurt, coffee, etc. Location is 10 min walk from Eiffel Tower, 2 min from Metro to anywhere, 4 min to cafes and restaurants. There area is very safe, and quiet as well. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris, we loved every minute and cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: harleymanict
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very pleased with Hotel Ares Eiffel. The location is excellent. It is close to the Eiffel Tower and close to the subway which we used to get everywhere else. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Whenever we get a chance to return to Paris, we will stay at the Hotel Ares Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Some specific room suggestions”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in May 2009. The hotel location was great and the staff was accommodating. Overall a solid establishment. Some rooms are better than others. Our room faced a courtyard and had no view whatsoever. Another in our group had a corner room that on higher floors offered a view of the Eiffel tower. Our rooms were pretty small but the top floor has some suites. If available I'd request them for the additional space. Overall the rooms were clean, comfortable, and in perfect working order. The mattresses could be softer. Book a room! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic, great location, perfect paris experience”
Reviews.Author: dreabobea
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, this place is very nice. Free WIFI, great location just a short walk to the Eiffel Tower and the metro, beautifully decorated room, nice view with balcony. We loved staying here and would do it again in a heartbeat. A great place for someone with high standards :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great city!”
Reviews.Author: strathphil
Reviews.Content: Had a great time with my partner. Great location very close to the Eiffel Tour. All staff were very helpful and friendly! Will definately revisit soom.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever - loved it - tremendous!”
Reviews.Author: Lancebb
Reviews.Content: The location was great, in a neighborhood on a quiet street about 10 min walk to Eiffel Tower, and 3 min walk to Metro. Staff were extremely helpful and very friendly, particularly Seferen (sorry if misspelled!) who went above and beyond in giving us guidance. Bed was very comfortable, room very well kept and quiet. We loved it, and will stay there again upon a return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: ChloeGrace
Reviews.Content: While the price was a bit high, this is a lovely, comfortable and stylish place. Loved it being tucked away on a somewhat quiet street and yet so close to action. You can easily walk to the Eiffel Tower on an evening stroll, taking in the gorgeous view. Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Loved the free Internet service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, small room, but typical of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: FilipoBambini
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I spent three pleasant nights at this hotel. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Breakfast at 16 euros per person was good, including scrambled eggs, small Vienna type sausages, and excellent freshly squeezed orange and grapefruit juice. Pillows were unusually comfortable for a European hotel. Room was immaculate and well equipped. Frigo bar did not chill properly. Bathroom was unusually large and nice for a small hotel in Paris. Great shower head; small glass door--so have to watch splashing. We used to stay at the nearby former Hilton (now Pullman Eiffel), which has much larger rooms and generally better views. Ares Eiffel is well located--Metro, Monoprix, and McDonalds very near; lots of good restaurants around. We especially liked La Gauloise. We probably would stay here again. Main drawback is small room; would be a problem for lots of bags and a long stay. But the bed (two singles together, as is typical of Europe) was as large as a king. It cost about 235 euros per night--not cheap. Free wireless worked very well, except on my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nolpat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very beautiful with comfortable, stylish rooms with good beds and a fantastic, luxurious bathroom. The B&O TV completes the chique look of the room. The staff is very friendly. The location is not as remote as one might think: the Eiffel Tower is on walking distance, the subway is just 2 minutes from the hotel and there are some nice cafés in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location convenient to metro and Tour Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAaron
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris to enjoy the city. With patisseries, boulangeries, and restaurants nearby, we found the location quite convenient. Our only common complain was that for such a nice hotel, we found the mattresses (we had 3 rooms) uniformly hard. To the point of being in pain upon rousing. Firm is fine, but these need a pillow top added. I would strongly encourage a change-over. The staff were courteous, though not always able to answer our questions. I think this was partly due to our limited french language skills. I would recommend this hotel for it's location and amenities, noting of course, the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: bostonweb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in late April/early May. The hotel has been completely renovated and the rooms look great. We booked a superior room with balcony. The room was very small but we didn't mind since we were expecting this and we have stayed in some small rooms in New York. The bathroom was great and our balcony was fantastic. We tried the breakfast one day and it was average. We got there toward the end of the breakfast time so maybe that had something to do with it. There were no eggs left. As others have stated there are plenty of cafes close by where you can get a cheaper breakfast that may taste better. Location is great. Tons of great restaurants close by in the 7th Arrondissement. As others have stated it's an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. Only minor thing my wife didn't like was the hair dryer was in the closet (connected and unable to remove) in the bedroom and not in the bathroom. All in all a great stay and would certainly stay here again. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & trendy”
Reviews.Author: Stefaniaglamour
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel close to the Eiffel towr, one block from the La Motte Piquet Grenelle Metro station, which is four stops from Place de la Concorde and all the main Parisien sightseeings. Fully equipped with ultra modern furnitures and technologic features, complementary WiFi and Internet. My room has been very clean, quiet, with an amazing view on the simbolizing Paris Eiffel tower. The staff has been friendly and welcoming. The breakfast is a buffet including all the best fresh French bakery. I got all a guest can deserve!

Reviews.Title: “Trip advisor 100% accurate again”
Reviews.Author: Ireland90
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, centrally located and just a few minutes from LaMotte Picquet metro (No.10 & No.8 lines). Rooms are nice size and comfortable, with free internet thru TV (a liitle tricky to navigate but works and great for checking on line activities). The mineral bar is only €5 per day for free minerals and great idea and well stocked. I saw on a earlier review that someone complaining about handing in the key each time - if this is the only complaint then we lead sheltered lives. The receptionist was very accomodating and i would rate her 10/10 for service and hospitality. It's easy to get to Hotel and Eiffel was within walking distance. A great spot and well worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNonstop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adorable. We stayed in Room 36 and the decor was so chic. My husband and I both loved it. The bed and bedding was terrific. The place was spotless. A great perk was that they restock the mini bar and for 5 Euro a day you can drink all you want out of it! The hotel is in walking distance to a lot of great eateries and also the Eiffel Tower. And just around the corner from wear Napoleon went to school. I'd stay there again in a heart beat. The staff was really nice and the place was quite. No coffee/espresso maker in the rooms though...

Reviews.Title: “fantastic holidays at ares eiffel in paris”
Reviews.Author: panzobike
Reviews.Content: we have make a break at last days of april and we had a wonderful time in this hotel we did not had the problems that some rewiew is sayng .we found helpful service and very gentle we appreciated the fantastic decor and the extraordinary furniture that are poltrona frau the same factory that is making the interiors of the ferrari cars and bugatti.this boutiquehotel will be our home in paris for the next romantic escapade.the location is real 7 minutes walking to the eiffel towers.three lines of the metro are only few meters from the hotel.we reccomend the ares eiffel to all our friends

Reviews.Title: “the place where i'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: joy1982
Reviews.Content: Ihave been for work and i choice the hotel ares for the many rewiew on tripadvisor and i have to say that iwas not disappointed the hotel is a boutique hotel really new the location is great and 5 minutes to walk from eiffel tower the hotel is near the metro station at 100 meters .From my room icoud see a little bit of eiffel tower the rooms and the hotel are very well decorated with hi standard decoration .the breakfast is very good with the buffet breakfast every thing is good and fresh like the fresh oranjuice and grape fruit at 16 euros that i find not so expensive compared at the price out of the hotel ,i payed in champs elysees 5 euros just for a glass of fresh orange juice and breakfast is as you want the service is gentle and helpful . the wifi is free and if you have no computer you have an imac brand new at the lobby.I certanly will send all my friends here and i suggest to all traveller to discover this little gem

Reviews.Title: “Not an impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLC24
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ares Eiffel was the last stop of our Europe trip where we stayed in 7 other boutique hotels. Hence, we had no choice but to compare it with the other hotels we stayed in. We got lost finding the hotel after taking the Metro and the locals didn't seem to know where it was located. The rooms were OK but quite small. The toiletries were Hermes but the housekeeping staff never replenished the soap & shampoo, you had to ask reception for it if you needed new toiletries the next day. We didn't expect that aircons were not operational for the month of May & we could not sleep due to the terrible noise on the 1st night. The night shift receptionist was very rude and did nothing to address our complaints. The morning shift receptionist was more accommodating and had the aircons switched on that day. Overall, it deserves a rating of 3.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: radhikaIndia
Reviews.Content: we just wanted to spend a gr8 quality time. .as we all know Paris is a honeymoon destination,so it was all beautifull. Service was wonderfull. as we stayed in our rooms for maximum time.so ,service was most important to us. food in the bed was gr8 i just love it

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel - but don't expect any frills!”
Reviews.Author: dizzy42
Reviews.Content: Lovely little boutique hotel in a fantastic central location, close to the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are beautifully decorated and furnished, and the whole place has a luxury feel that can be difficult to find in Paris. As such, you would be hard pushed to find somewhere that offers better value, particularly in comparison with the major four or five star chains. However, don't expect too much - the lounge is very small and open plan, there's no bar or restaurant (serves buffet breakfast only) and while the owners are extremely helpful, other staff were quite abrupt and rude (that's Paris for you!). I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it - but use it as a base for your stay rather than somewhere to spend long periods of time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in April. We were on the 6th floor and had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. Had booked a superior room which was in every way perfect apart from the size. The toilet and bathroom were separate and the wardrobe space was tiny, 4 hangers which was not really enough for 2 people. The rest of the room was of very high quality but just felt very small. The mini bar was excellent value at 5 euro per day and toiletries etc very nice. We didn't include breakfast as we wanted to see what was in the vicinity. We had breakfast near the metro stop on 2 mornings, worked out about 25 euro and we stayed in the hotel on our last morning which was nice. There is a nice little patisserie and a Haagen Dazs shop near the hotel. There is also a supermarket but we didn't use it. We found the location of the hotel to be perfect, seemed to be more residential with very few hotels but that suited us. Just up past the main metro station there is a street with lots of shops, we found this to be less touristy and there were some nice clothes shops especially for young children. The hotel had some nice restaurants nearby and we tended to stay close by rather than take the metro at night. We found a nice Italian which was extremely busy. The Eiffel Tower is a pleasant 5-10 minute walk and we walked that each night after dinner. Paris is expensive and with the strong euro at present it just seemed even worse! However we were on holidays and spent what we needed to. All in all, would recommend this hotel for location, service and quality of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Room was amazing, service was incredible, wish we had more time at hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEMark
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! Room was truly beautiful, staff was amazing. We stayed here as a splurge for our last night of a 10 day trip to Paris and Normandy. The decor in the hotel and room was from out of a magazine. The location is great, a few blocks from the train station, metro, etc. We were headed out to the airport in the morning and were in the lobby waiting for our cab when the receptionist came running up and held out her hand....my wedding rings!!!! I had left them in the room and they had already found them and brought them right to me. I hugged her and thanked her and wished I could have done more. Exceptional everything!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, stylish hotel, but let down by location and room size”
Reviews.Author: Digital_Goldfish
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings on this hotel. They are generally very positive, in as much as the hotel is very stylish (looked like they'd copied Jaques Garcia's La Reserve in Geneva), very friendly, not absurdly expensive, clean, and well maintained; everything you'd want from a hotel really. However, I think it's let down by the very small rooms and its location. 1st, the room size shouldn't really matter that much if all you're doing is sleeping, but it did feel a little claustrophobic and there is very little hanging space. If you were intending to be there for more than 2 days, and with a partner, there is no space for hanging shirts or dresses. 2nd, while we never found issue with the location because the Metro was so effective, it did feel a little removed. Having gone to St Germain, and walked past the Luxembourg Parc hotel (currently number 3), I think we would have preferred that for the price (based purely on location and how it appeared from the outside). I guess it all depends on what you want to achieve while you're there. If the decor of the hotel is the most important thing, and you want to be walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, this is probably ideal; however, if you prefer some trendy night life a short walking distance from you, i'd probably suggest the Luxembourg or something in that area..A couple of other plusses while i think about it - The free Wifi was excellent, and the 5 euro per day mini bar were appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmgw
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, friendly hotel. Rooms small but very nice. Could just about see top of Eiffel tower! Close to metro and lots of restaurants. We had breakfast in local restaurants - cheaper than in hotel. Easy to get to all tourist attractions. Could do with bar in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best place tostay in paris”
Reviews.Author: supergab
Reviews.Content: i have been with my wife in paris at hotel ares i have tosay that is very nice and confortable the service is very good and the location is top .i reccomend to all people that wnt stai in a very nice place in paris .

Reviews.Title: “Terrific room in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: BoredNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Nice lodging in walking distance of the metro and many local attractions. Really nice place to stay. The room was small, but the double bed was a true double (not two twins slid togeher) and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel - stay here too avoid disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ScottForfar_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay at the Ares Eiffel. The only downside, which I'll start with, is that it was a bit pricey. However, we prepared ourselves with this too avoid staying in one of the many fleepits Paris has to offer. So we were over the moon when we arrived. Room was smallish, but served our purposes adequately. Exceptionally clean, lovely decor and an all round nice feel about the place. Staff ex. helpful. The surrounding area, the 15th Arr, is very pleasant and felt very safe, even at night. A wide range of restaurants are at hand if you don't fancy going far and there's a wide range of small shops nearby. The Eiffel Tower is literally around the corner and there is a metro station 2 minutes from the front door. If you've never been to Paris before and are concerned about finding a nice hotel in a nice area, then this a very safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff and location- small family room!”
Reviews.Author: mum-2-2
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The staff are great, especially the front-of-house. The decor and fixtures are gorgeous, contemporary and well maintained. We had a reasonably priced room for a family of 4. The beds were very comfortable but once the 2 arm chairs had been turned into beds for the children there was not much room to do anything! It was great for us as we were there for 3 nights and were out most of the time There was a very very small balcony that you could stand on that overlooked the street. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as it is just as easy to slip out to one of the cafes around for a coffee and croissant. It is a fantastic location within minutes walk of the Eiffel Tower and very close to a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel Ares”
Reviews.Author: pilo201164
Reviews.Content: Very good location, pretty rooms, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: mladww
Reviews.Content: A residential area in the 15th district may not seem an obvious choice but it proved a great location. The immediate environment is very peaceful but it's less than two minutes from a well-connected metro stop and just a short stroll to major left-bank sights in west of city. Friendly and welcoming reception, small lounge stocked with current magazines & guide books. Hotel recently refurbished to a high standard. It's stylish and elegant without being over the top. We had a 'superior' room which was small but light, quiet and very comfortable. Attention to detail is impressive: airy bathroom with great shower and other fittings,.high-end accessories (Bang & Olufsen), and an ultra-rare treat that even 5* hotels usually overlook - bright and well positioned reading lights over the bed. Small gripe: too few clothes hangers in the wardrobe. Breakfast was OK but over-priced. You can get a good breakfast for half the price at any of the nearby street cafes. Room is not cheap at 310 euros per night but the 3 nights-for-price-of-two deal made it good value. Of all the hotels I've stayed at in Paris, this was the most satisfying overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - fantastic location. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Timbaland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently placed literally within 5-10 minutes walk of the Eiffel Tower (where bus/boat tours set off). The hotel itself is very well presented, as was our room and the staff were helpful and pleasant. We didn't try the breakfast that was offered at the hotel but there were plenty of cafe's/restaurants near by. We found that the Metro station (La Motte-Piquet), which was approx 3 minutes away from the hotel, gave good access by rail as well. We travelled to Paris by Eurostar and the Gard du Nord was about 20mins by taxi on a Friday afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, great for couples. Friendly staff. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: BuD_205
Reviews.Content: We went to paris for a long weekend and decided on this hotel after reading favourable reviews online. It was perfect for a romantic weekend. The entire hotel is finished to a very high standard and the staff are very helpful and welcoming. It is located on a quiet side street but is still very close to lots of good restaurants and of course the eifel tower!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familyof4vacationers
Reviews.Content: My husband, two daughters ages 15 and 13, and myself stayed at the Hotel Ares Eiffel April 3rd-5th. The hotel was amazying. Every one was very helpful. Our room was huge and very well kept. The location was perfect. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: George038
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and friendly. The neighbourhood is not so interesting, not the latin quarters, but quieter and more elegant. The room was unbelivable, wooden floors, stylish interiour decour, luxurious bathroom. And by luxurious I mean the style and quality, not space. The room we had was not very big. The breakfast was maybe a bit overpriced. The complimentary internet via tv-set(Bang&Olufsen) was, although very handy, a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotless, pleasant rooms”
Reviews.Author: seattleben
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ares Eiffel based on Trip Advisor reviews, which for the most part were accurate. This smallish hotel is in a quiet location near subway/rail lines and the Eiffel Tower. The area around it is engaging, with Rue de Commerce, cafes, and brasseries. We were three in a room, which was a bit tight, but the room was very clean with nice amenities (free wifi). We had no view -- our window opened out on a circular courtyard -- but as a result was very quiet and we could sleep with the windows open. The staff was polite, albeit reserved, but responsive and helpful in a reactive sort of way.

Reviews.Title: “Not Cheap But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: tommyzoomSurrey
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from staying at this hotel. I did a lot of research and looked at many websites, before deciding to book this one. My main concern was that this hotel did not appear on too may other sites, or in guide books. However having read all of the consistently good reviews on trip advisor we decided that this was the one for us. We were not disappointed. It was very easy to find and is around the corner from La Motte Picquette metro station. The staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. From reading the comments about small rooms I was a little apprehensive about the amount of space, but was pleasantly surprised. We could walk around the bed and found room to put our cases out of the way without falling over them. My only comment would be that the room could do with more coat hangers and a full length mirror. The bathroom was very spacious, with shampoo, shower gel, soap and slippers. Prior to arriving we had booked a restaurant for the Saturday evening, stupidly I forgot to take the address with us and the staff were more than happy to look up the address for us and print out a map of its location. I can't comment on the breakfast as we used some of the many cafes nearby and had breakfast for half the price charged by the hotel. Because of the present exchange rate, this was not a cheap stay for us, but was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lainiejae
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully decorated. Most of the staff was unbelievably helpful. Rooms are not big, but that is typical for Paris. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, very good connected, very nice hospitality”
Reviews.Author: marenaLugano
Reviews.Content: good metro connections close to hotel good commercial/restaurant area close to hotel very cozy and nice rooms spacious bathrooms friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “I expected a lot more...”
Reviews.Author: TheLunchBelle
Reviews.Content: I chose this property b/c of it's outstanding reviews on Trip Advisor and also b/c it held the #1 hotel spot in Paris (on Trip Advisor). I fell in love with the photos that I saw, as I'm a big fan of baroque-contemporary interior design. I'd be a liar if I said that I wasn't concerned about the hotel's location in the 15th arrondissement, because just 3 months ago, I stayed in the hip/chic Saint Germain district. There wasn't much text in travel guides about the 15th, and some friends looked at me like an alien when I said that I was staying in this "quiet" district. However, I was looking forward to experiencing a new neighborhood and being further away from tourists. The hotel arranged for inexpensive shuttle transfers for us to and from the airport, which I greatly appreciated. Upon our arrival, everything was seamless. The hotel is on the small-side, but it was decorated very nicely. We took the small elevator up to our 6th floor room, opened the door, and laughed at eachother b/c of its small size (I live in New York City and STILL found it tiny). The room was decorated richly, had a balcony and was perfectly clean. My problems were the following: No hair conditioner or body lotion is provided Breakfast was 16EUR Our shower leaked to the point that it overflowed our bathroom The a/c did not work, so we had to sleep with our balcony door cracked One of the staff (an older male) was incredibly rude and condescending: When I asked about the a/c not working, then about our shower leak, he said, "I can't wait to see what you complain about tomorrow night!" The neighborhood is literally a restaurant wasteland Things I liked: Cleanliness Decor Located very close to mass transit 7 min. walk from the Eiffel Tower I suppose I was spoiled when I stayed at the K+K Cayre during my previous trip to Paris. The staff was more welcoming and I loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with friendly staff and quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: ktri
Reviews.Content: We are a family with one school-age child and one baby and we stayed in a deluxe room (accommodates up to 4 people) in order to provide enough space for our older daughter to use the pull-out single bed and to have room for our baby's portable crib which we brought (the hotel does not provide cribs). The room was just large enough for us, which is big for Paris standards, but no larger than a typical American motel room. The hotel is lovely (very clean, too, which is not always guaranteed in Paris), the staff is polite and friendly, the location is convenient (restaurants, cafes, and metro stop within a block), and the area is quiet at night (unlike the 6th Arrondisement where we have stayed before). There is even a playground nearby which our children enjoyed. We didn't eat the hotel's breakfast because we thought 16 Euro per person was too expensive, so I can't comment on that, but there are numerous cafes nearby for breakfast. The hotel is a very nice boutique hotel, but I wouldn't call it a luxury hotel. Certainly not in the same league as something like the George V. One small caveat is that we could pretty easily hear noise from the room next door and our TVs even seemed to work on the same remote, so we had to unplug our TV at night in case our neighbors came in and turned theirs on because it would also turn ours on! Not a big deal for us, but maybe for some.

Reviews.Title: “Family-Friendly in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: oldparents
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great spot. The nearest metro station is only about 2 blocks away, and has three lines running through it, so it is easy to get anywhere from there. You can walk easily to the Eiffel Tower (and to the nice playgrounds along the way). We ate at several of the restaurants close to the hotel, including a very nice Indian restaurant (Raja Maharaja) right around the corner from it and the Cafe Piquette, which had good food, music, and service. The rooms are clean, and the bathroom is great. The best part for us was the fold-out bed (twin size) for our son at no extra charge. The staff was very kind to him, and even left him some chocoates on his bed one morning. Very sweet!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Elegance and first class service”
Reviews.Author: J0dieK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Ares Eiffel from January 4th to 9th of this year. It was the most amazing hotel I've ever stayed at. The rooms were gorgeous, well put together and luxurious! The view of the Paris streets wonderful, especially when it snowed! The staff were extremely friendly, recommending places to visit, shops to go to, restaurants and ordering taxi's with sage advice on traversing paris at night :D The Metro is only a five minute work away and the station is La Motte Picquet Grenelle, also the Eiffel tower is also only a ten-fifteen minute walk from the hotel. I would recommend Monoprix Supermarket rather than the smaller ones who don't speak English (lol) and Monoprix is also only a few minutes walk away. There are several great restaurants mere metres from the hotel and the breakfast buffet is superb! We took advantage of the five euro minibar (that was for everything in it daily) until we found the supermarket that is :D Also take advantage of the public transport system, more importantly the Paris Pass for the metro, RER and buses. You can buy daily passes or two daily passes and well worth the euros. I would tell everyone to book this hotel, simply because it was beautiful! The only thing I did not like was having to hand in my key whenever I went out, that was a bit of a bother, but we dealt with it :) Also no one seems to know the street it is on lol, so write down the name! :D

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Tucked Away in the 15th”
Reviews.Author: boraborabob
Reviews.Content: Based on the TripAdvisor reviews I had read, I opted not for the typical 8th District hotel I would normally have chosen and went with the Hotel Ares Eiffel in the 15th. Just a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and 2 blocks from the Metro, with great cafes, restaurants, and shops all around, the location was fantastic. The hotel itself is on a residential street with peek-a-boo views of the Eiffel Tower. Our room was on the 6th floor with big bright windows on two sides and a very large, modern marble bathroom. The main room was a little tight, but perfectly manageable. The high-end finishes like the B&O television, Versace marble tiles, and Hermes bath products were indications that the hotel was willing to go a step beyond to differentiate itself. The staff was very courteous and helpful, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lyssak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for six nights in mid-March. It was a business trip for both of us. We found the hotel on Trip Advisor and the reviews are very accurate. The hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood, in easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the Metro. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made dinner suggestions and reservations for us and the places were just right. Our room, a Standard, for 180 euros/night was quite small, but comfortable and the decor was very chic. We did not spend too much time in the room and did not eat breakfast in the hotel as there are several nice boulangeries on Ave Suffren and LaMotte-Piquet where we would pick up a croissant on the way to work. Overall it was a delightful place to stay and I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Funky!”
Reviews.Author: oneeyeblue
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location near Eiffel Tower and L'Ecole Militaire. Unique and hip decor - e.g., Versace bathroom tile (who knew Versace made bath tile?), Bang and Olufsen television and telephone, etc. Exceptionally clean and comfortable (beds are great!). A true boutique hotel experience. The only downside was breakfast. They are really set up for it. I would recommend walking 5 minutes down the street to one of the numerous sidewalk cafes that serve a better breakfast for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great service, good location, value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ShaneT35
Reviews.Content: but don't go for the standard double it is very small. Also very quiet location so if you want to get a goods night sleep I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - perfect base in the city of romance!”
Reviews.Author: RiaReviewer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a gift for my boyfriend. I was looking for somewhere chic and trendy that would make a great base for exploring Paris and I was not disappointed. We found the hotel easy enough. We took a bus from Gare du Nord (route 42) and then it was about a 5 minute walk from the bus stop. The hotel is in a great location for sight seeing and only about a 10/15 minute walk from the eiffel tower. Check-in was smooth and although I was a little worried as I had forgotten to bring my confirmation of booking there were no problems. We were even upgraded from the classic room that I had booked to a superior room. We were also given a map to help us find our way round the city. The room was decorated beautifully and although not overly big had everything we needed for a weekend away. There were Hermes toiliteries in the bathroom and a TV in the bedroom (we didn't use it but I believe you could also get internet on it.) If I was going to be very picky then the only thing I would add to the room is a full length mirror and a plug socket near to a mirror. The public areas were also decorated and kept lovely. There is a lounge area next to the reception and a Mac that we used (free of charge) to search for a nice restaurant on Top Table. We only saw two members of staff on reception both were very polite although the lady seemed to speak better english. She was helpful although we felt that possibly she could have been a little more forthcoming with recommendations for restaurants. She seemed to have a thing going with a restaurant just round the corner from the hotel as that was the only restaurant she would recommend. On saying that when we did our own research on the Mac and found a restaurant we wanted to go to she had no problem in calling them to make a reservation. All in all we had a fantastic time in Paris and if I visited again I would book this hotel again and would happily recommend it to people.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: luckycraig13
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why this hotel is ranked in the top 5 of all of Paris! The staff is great- very willing to speak English. It's location is within walking distance of the Eiffel tower, restaurants, cafe's, ATM's, metro, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants a true taste of Paris and not a traditional corporate hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: firedove
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful boutique hotel. Stayed there for 3 nights for a business trip. Conveniently located in a very safe and clean neighbourhood. Standard rooms were quite small, but not any worse than most European hotels. Price was slightly on the high side, but it was quite a pleasant stay. Appreciated the free wifi. My only real gripes were that (1) there was no body lotion, which I thought is standard for a 4* hotel and (2) I asked the hotel to fax something for me, but was not informed when the fax did not go through.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place with a little bit more”
Reviews.Author: Guy44
