Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay with our two doughters of 11 and 16. We booked two separate classic rooms which I asked to be adjacent and they were. A very good location close to a metro station which connected us with the whole of Paris. The hotel service was very friendly and helpful. Good tips on restaurants. I'm always looking for something more in a hotel which we found in the well decorated rooms and lounge. One small tip from our side : why not a little bit of music in the lounge and breakfast room ? It might complete the whole atmosphere. Good price/quality (we booked the 3 days package).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohgrl95
Reviews.Content: This is a cute little Paris hotel. Its about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tour and an enjoyable walk. Its also close to restaurants, bars and ATMs. All my taxi drivers had a hard time finding the road though. But at check in they give you a business card with a map with the hotel location on the back. This is essential to take with you if your gonna take cabs. The rooms are very clean and very nice. The free web tv was very nice. I didnt have the breakfast so I cant comment on that. I will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: markdk
Reviews.Content: Just want to echo the views of others on this great hotel, fantastic location, friendly English speaking staff, very clean, modern rooms. Breakfast is a little expensive but there are some great places around the corner you can eat. Recommend Carmine's Italian for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel !”
Reviews.Author: default007
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3day citytrip to Paris. After reviewing the top 10 hotels from Tripadvisor we decided to go for the Ares Eiffel hotel. We stayed 2 nights in a superior room on the 6th floor. The hotel is everything it claims to be. The rooms are very nice and clean. The locations is also very good in a quite street close to the eifel tower. Only disadvantage is the "noise" in the hotel during the night. We also enjoyed the free WIFI which worked perfectely ! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: claudia020
Reviews.Content: I have been for a copple of days for work in paris and i have choosen this hotel by trip advisor reviews and i was nicely surprised from hotel ares every think is like described from the others reviewers .i reccomend to all people that loves paris and nice adresses i'll come back in august with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, feels like your own apartment in Paris”
Reviews.Author: white_orbit
Reviews.Content: New renovated, wonderful stuff. Breakfast is pricy, like everything in Paris, very simple, but convenient with lots of coffee. Great decor, but room is very small, like everything else in Paris. Great stay!!! Free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CrewelFours
Reviews.Content: A perfect compliment to the Parisian experience! We discovered and chose this hotel based on TA ratings and reviews and we could not have been more pleased. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and a block from taxi and Metro stations. It is like staying at a beautiful home in the middle of everything. The decor is beautiful and very clean. We were able to check in early (this may have been by chance that our room was ready and available early) when we arrived in the morning. The hotel also checked our bags between our check out and departure. The beds were one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in and windows open in the rooms and bathrooms. The 5 Euro a day deal for the complete contents of the mini bar was impressive. There are several amazing bistros just around the corner as well. The staff spoke fluent English (which helped with our limited French) and could not have been more genuine and friendly. There is free wi-fi, a computer downstairs for guest use and American and French newspapers. I would highly reccomend this hotel if traveling to Paris. It's beauty and charm made my trip to Paris even more enjoyable. We have already made plans to return to this hotel when in Paris next year. (Carry the address of the hotel with you - a card from the desk- as some taxi drivers are unfamiliar with the street.) Trust the overwhelmingly positive reviews here. You will have a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Take the TA advice”
Reviews.Author: AlegreVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel solely on TA advice. The first trick is compare the internet rate with the one given by the hotel. If that means crossing the lobby to use the lobby computer to book by internet then do it. For me in Feb the difference was 70 Euros. The gal said she had no authority to come off the published rates of 250 Euros for a standard room and 280 for a king bed. The lobby is small and the breakfast restaurant too basic to contemplate. There are lots of restaurants nearby. Everything is nearby. My room was a little crammed with the comfortable duvet covered king-sized bed but it had everything I needed including opening windows in the bathroom and the bedroom. The neighbourhood is dead quiet at night. The mini bar is 5 Euros for all you can consume per night. Sounds good? No liquor because no licence yet. There’s a large LCD screen for internet or TV and the place is wireless. The bathroom tiles are Versace, the toiletries are Hermes. There is a lighted make-up mirror and a full tub/shower. Just outside is the Swiss Village, a location of numerous antique stores. Five minutes further by foot takes you to Parc Joffre, one of the connecting parks to the Eiffel Tower. This is a delightful hotel if the idea of staying on a residential street appeals. I’m happy I took the TA advice.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: nelliew47
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! The decor was modern and inspiring. The hotel was spotless, the staff friendly, and the breakfast satisfying. Free wifi and they also offered a great deal on the (non-alcoholic) beverages in the mini-bar - drink as many as you want (I think there were six bottles of water, cola, etc.) for EUR 5. They also offered (for free) breakfast in bed, though only a continental version of what was offered downstairs. We'll be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Master_Betty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on the 31st Jan. The hotel is beuatifully decorated throughout. All I can say is I wish my house looked like that! I have seen star ratings of 3 and 4, but can only presume this is because it doesnt have certain facilities that are required for the level of accreditation. The attention to detail is awesome too: B&O tv in the room, Versace tiling, lovely bathroom with a huge shower. If you want stunning decor, friendly staff, good location (10 min walk from eiffel tower) and a nice breakfast then this is it. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, Hotel Ares is the one. Trust me.”
Reviews.Author: O_chokochoi
Reviews.Content: When it comes to picking a hotel, I am extremely particular and will spend hours doing my research for the perfect hotel. Although I do not want to break the bank, I am willing to pay a little extra for a nicer hotel. I stayed at Hotel Ares for two nights, and I loved it! I booked the superior room, and it was everything that I expected and more. I loved the feel of the place when you walked in the room. It was clean, cozy, and decorated well...nice lighting, dark hardwood floors, heavy drapes, flat screen tv, double glazed windows, and a nice bathroom. I didn't feel cramped at all and it was home away from home. The best part was that the internet was free! The staff is very welcoming, prompt, and professional. The location is great because it is a 30second walk to the metro, which connects to three main lines. Everything you need is within walking distance, from cafes, bistros, supermarket, etc. THree minute walk to Champ de mars, which you can see the eiffel tour, 15 minute walk from Rue Cler, and 20 minute walk from the best croissant in Paris at Secco. I will definately stay at Hotel Ares again, would recommend it to anyone of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Style & Glamour in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Alexander
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at this hotel only for 2 nights whilst we were in Paris for an interior design trade exhibition's. I had found the hotel on the internet and then as I always do I went straight to Tripadvior to read about it and found it was number 1 in Paris. We booked an executive room at the rate of €260 per night and when arriving at the hotel we found it to be perfect for our expectations and requirements. The entrance area is stylish with a small lounge area and a great reading room with fabulous books then there is the breakfast room. Breakfast is an additional 16 euro per person which some have said is costly but I disagree. It is silly that it is extra and maybe should be just included with the accomodation but anyway it was very good. There was sausages and scrambled eggs, excellent coffee and fresh juices, pastries, cold meats, cheeses cereals and nice touches all over like three types of sugar on the table and mini pots of individual jams etc. We took the hotel breakfast both mornings and had two juices each, 2 coffees, pastries, cereal etc, sausages and eggs... lol try ordering all that in a cafe in Paris for less than 16 euro per person! The room was small but this is to be expected for Paris but was still of good size with a king size bed of 180cm wide and great bedding. The bathroom was huge with double sinks, walk in rain shower and separate bath. Versace fittings and wonderful to come home to after walking for 10 hours at the trade fair. Internet was wi-fi and easy to log in to and the rooms all have LCD Bose TV's and all mod cons.... The thing that surprised me about this hotel was that it was only 3 star!!! We never stay in 3 star hotels normally and opt for 5 always but this has the same luxury, comfort of a 5 star. Ok fine you did not have the gym, pool and room service but little else was missing. The mini bar was even semi complimentary with just a nominal charge of 5 euro per day for all of the contents... We will definitely stay in this hotel it is a true designer gem...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Binnie32
Reviews.Content: My bf & I stayed here for a long w/e at the end of January. We had a 'classic room' which was small however it was perfectly suitable for the 2 of us and my huge suitcase! Seeing as one doesn't spend that much time in the hotel room, the size was really not an issue. The room was beautifully decorated and kept spotlessly clean which is far more important to us. The Hotel Getting to the hotel from CDG is pretty straight forward. Get the RER B to Denfert Rochereau and then change here to the Metro (Line 6) to La Motte Picquet - this stop is literally at the end of the road where the hotel is. This journey cost us 16.80 euros each - works out cheaper and quicker than getting a taxi during the day. It is well located within 10 min walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. All the other main sites such as Notre Dame, L'Arc de Triomphe, etc are also within walking distance (provided you're wearing flats!) We only took the Metro to get to Sacre Couer and when we were heading to Pont Neuf for dinner one evening (you can get a 1 day travel card for 6euros). We spent the rest of the time on foot as you get to see more and stumble across lovely cafes, shops, etc that you would otherwise miss. There is wifi available in rooms for free however if you don't have your laptop you can surf the web on the plasma screen TV in your room or there is a MAC in the lounge for guests to use (free). Everything about the hotel is positive apart from a couple of grumbles including minimal hanging space, no mirror anywhere near the hairdryer and no full length mirror - however none of these grumbles would prevent us from wanting to stay here again. If you're in to running as we are then I'd recommend taking your running kit as the hotel is close to the Seine which is lovely to run along side - also a really good way to see the sights! If you're in town on a Sunday then head to the food market that runs all the way down Blvd Grenelle - the most amazing selection of patisserie, deli, fish, etc stalls - makes your mouth water and makes you wish you lived in Paris! Cafes/Restaurants We didn't have b'fast at the hotel as felt it was overpriced however we found a lovely contemporary cafe/patisserie that sells amazing freshly baked Pain aux Raisins, croissants, etc at reasonable prices (2 Pain aux Raisins & 2 coffees for 6euros) - it's located on Boulevard Grenelle (on a street corner) and is called Secco. We ate locally at Le Suffren one evening which was really nice for a local venue. We had Steak Frites and the most amazing Profiteroles I've ever had (one portion looked like enough to feed a family of four so we really struggled to eat it all between the two of us!) We also ate at Kong which is a Philippe Starck restaurant that featured in the last episode of Sex & the City. Although it was funky and a stunning location (high up above Pont Neuf), it was overpriced for what it was as the food wasn't that exceptional. The service was good until we ended up waiting nearly half an hour for pudding, however after mentioning that we felt this was unacceptable to the manager, we were offered 2 complimentary glasses of champagne which was a nice gesture. In general Paris is expensive (esp with the exchange rate being so rubbish at the mo) however you can get good reasonably priced meals (much the same as London) although you can also get completely ripped off so always check prices before going in! So, all in all our Paris experience was a good one and I would definately go back there and stay at the Ares Eiffel again.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Gustavoh
Reviews.Content: Not much to add, but I'll try. We stayed there December 25-29. It is indeed a lovely hotel, very deserving of its top rating here at Tripadvisor. I just loved it!!! As it is located on a backstreet, it has a very private feel and is very quiet. The Motte-Picquet subway station is, however, right around the corner. Everything is very nicely decorated, and the standard rooms are particularly well appointed. They are small, indeed, but me and my girlfriend managed just fine, with two large pieces of luggage, a large carry-on and a couple of other small bags inside the room with us. The dark-haired lady who runs the front desk during the day was very sweet and helpful. And I was very pleased and even surprised that wi-fi was complimentary, unlike other twice-as-expensive hotels such as the Sofitels, Sheratons, and Four Seasons out there. Can't comment on the breakfast, however, because I opted to have breakfast out on the street everyday.

Reviews.Title: “nice location at a cost”
Reviews.Author: newbolders
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the staff helpful,and the rooms are as decribed and shown in the review photos.However,we would have expected rather larger rooms in this price bracket.Also a single wardrobe and 4 hangers was simply not enough for a 4 night stay. On the positive side though,the hotel is close to the metro,and there are a good range of local shops and restaurants.This feels like the real Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SundanceKidGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful room and lovely communal space. Only criticism is the lack of public facilities - ie a residents' bar, means that you rarely spend any time in the communal space. That said, I would recommend this hotel and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Ares !”
Reviews.Author: FrankM75
Reviews.Content: I had to stay few days in Paris for business and found this hotel on the web. What a nice surprice! The place is just a walk away form the very heart of Paris. Rooms are quite impressive. B&O flat LCD screens and Versace tiles in the bathroom.... and on top of this you got free WiFi ( in case you are w/out your laptop you can surf the net on your TV.) The breakfast is fully satisfactory with just squezzed fruit juices Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little Gem of a hotel, just a little out the centre”
Reviews.Author: genluxx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little slice of gorgeousness in Paris, and exactly the kind of hotel that you want to stay in, whilst in such a romantic city, even if it is on business. The rooms are romantically designed with great little finishing touches. The keys with the little rope tassle, the ultra modern entertainment centre and easy wi-fi connect, the double basin bathroom with separate toilet in it's own room. The versace tiled bathroom, tastefully done and subtley gorgeous and luxe and not garish. The only thing was that this wasn't a part of town that I would have instinctively wanted to stay in, all that was missing was the feel of the left-bank nearby. The area felt more suberban than romantic left-bank, and if this hotel could have been lifted and moved to the left-bank I would have been in heaven. But despite this, I loved it so much that I will stay again and simply metro it over. It's a stones throw from the station, and though I didn't have the view of the Eiffel Tower from my room it was very close on the map, unfortunatley with my work schedule I didn;t have tme to make the trip. But the hotel was so gorgeous, I may have spent the rest of my time in there even if I did.

Reviews.Title: “High rating well deserved”
Reviews.Author: RANCorpusChristi
Reviews.Content: My wife, my two children (ages 7 and 10) and I had a wonderful time in Paris over the Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel was exactly as described in the reviews and in the hotel web site. The room was modern, clean and a good size for Paris. We stayed in a Deluxe room with a queen size bed and two twin size sleeper sofas. The staff spoke excellent English and was quite helpful. A large supermarket and several smaller markets are only a block away. Several good cafes are in the area as well. Metro access is easy as well. The only thing I could comment on negatively was the bed was a bit too firm. This was solved with adding a blanket beneath us for some added cushion. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and look forward to staying again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful romantic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moonflower14
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ares is absolutely great! We loved the romanticly furnished room and the stylish bathroom! Very clean, very friendly, great location! Paris at it's best!

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel.”
Reviews.Author: deerhunter17
Reviews.Content: Through google we reservated a hotel in the XVth precint of Paris. This is by far the most agreable dictrict of Paris. Very less touristst and the real Parisians around. The hotel is good. Parking in front is not only for the 'livraisons' but mainly for the staff, I guess. So they should not leave guests emptyhanded with loose gestures about parking in the neighbourhood. Perhaps create private parking. Anyway, a carpark is just around the corner for just €14,- a day. A bargain really. Their breakfast is just what you need for a day's start in a designers room. And on the end of the day on our return to the room, it was spotlessly cleaned with fresh towels. Au revoir, Edmondt & Hetty

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms quite noisy”
Reviews.Author: Sandridge
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Ares Eiffel in Paris. The location of the hotel as others have noted in their reviews is great , with easy access to all of central Paris from the Metro. The hotel its self is very clean and the rooms of a reasonable size for Paris and much better than those of a 4* chain hotel I have stayed at previously, The only complaint would be the noise, you can hear nearly everything tht goes on in your neighbours rooms and all the comings and goings on the floors and outside.We were on the 5th floor and could still hear street noise so you may wish to ask for a higher room. If you can sleep through noise then this is a great boutique hotel in a perfect location. We did not have the breakfast in the hotel but followed a previous review and grabbed a coffee and bite in a nearby cafe.We did however eat twice at Le Suffren which is just around the corner from the hotel near the Village Suisse entrance to the Metro.We had excellent meals there and the staff were very friendly speaking both English and Spanish.We also had dinner at L'Arome located near the Grand Palais,Saint Philippe du Roule.Which was recommended to us by a French friend, an excellent restaurent not cheap but well worth it for a specail meal.Book early though as its quite small inside.

Reviews.Title: “very chic but lacks hotel services”
Reviews.Author: boatey
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - clean, just refurbished, - it is my own fault but I had assumed that there would be some sort of room service or some facitilites to make tea/coffee in your room, there are not - the only food served is breakfast which you have to go downstairs to eat and there is only a minibar with some water etc in your room - if you want anything hot you have to go out and get it.

Reviews.Title: “Ares was a perfect find in PARIS”
Reviews.Author: TXgalDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on trip advisor and read all the great reviews, etc. Of course never knowing till you get there, I was nervous, but AMAZED upon arrival. Hotel Ares is situated in a perfect quieter district, walking distance to the Eiffel and a great Metro Stop right by the hotel. The staff was great and the rooms were redone incredibly. We would defintely reccommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location at a good value”
Reviews.Author: bobobo17
Reviews.Content: I only spent two days in Ares but there were nothing to complain about, the room service was ok, the rooms ok, and a really good location for this price. Only five minutes from the eiffel tower

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mytravelworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Starting with the reception, our arrival could not have gone any better, friendly staff and easy check in. The Lobby is stylish French decor, and everything is clean and in great order. Happily the room was also well put together, little touches like Hermes soap and shampoo was also great. One slight down side was the bed, we booked a double bed but got a twin imitating a double. I have to say this was my first time seeing something like this in such a nice hotel. They were also a little stiff/uncomfortable compared to some hotels, but this is just my preference. Location was pretty great, we welcomed walking distance to the Eiffel tower and easy access to many Cafe and shops. I recommend brunching at Le Bouquet de Grenelle near the Metro station, since they make great breakfast and coffee. Other than little things like being a bit lonely and quiet, I can recommend this hotel whole heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in spite of limited room size”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTell
Reviews.Content: I booked four rooms for a group of four couples, including me and my wife, after visiting Tripadvisor. At the time of booking, Hotel Ares occupied top rank. Moreover, the room rate was within the group's budget, while mapping the hotel confirmed its central location. Room: The room had attractive state-of-the-art decor. The main problem was the tight room size of about ten square metres (excluding bathroom and lobby). There was absolutely no space for luggage. So this was opened on the bed and then replaced on the floor which made it uncomfortable to manoevre round the bed. Hanging space in the wardrobe was hardlly sufficient for one person. To make matters worse the hair dryer located in that compartment competed for space with hanging clothes. Amenities: An extensive choice of TV channels was available. The internet facility advertised on the Quadriga system turned out to be a joke and effectively unusable in terms of speed and userfriendliness. Service: Reception staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Housekeeping staff were totally inconspicuous, but their performance left nothing to be desired in terms of cleanliness and room turnout. Breakfast: One member of the group tried out the buffet breakfast and reported that the offerring (including eggs only in scrambled mode) was over priced at 15 euro. So we opted for a more varied breakfast for 10 euro at a coffee bar round the corner. General: The central location is indeed a boon. Nearby boulevards Suffren and Motte Piquet are full of shops, restaurants and bars. The Motte Piquet metro station, five minutes away, effectively connects the hotel Ares with the rest of Paris. I recommend Hotel Ares as good value for money, by Paris standards, especially on the strength of its location if not of the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Unexceptionable”
Reviews.Author: Rehau
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Ares from 12 to 16 of November with my family. It was the best holiday in Paris for me: in autumn the city is exciting and the location where we stayed this time (I've been in Paris the last year already) contributed to make the trip simply faboulus. The hotel is well-groomed in any detail; design of urnishings (poltrona frau), tapestry, cleanliness unexceptionable, copious breakfast, courteos and helpful staff at the reception... The place is penetrate of an homely atmosphere but at the same time the neatness never run out. Ares Hotel is located near the Eiffel tower. From the hotel is simply to go in any place of the city with 4 near metro station. Finally: I advise any type of travellers (families, loving couple, single, buisness travellers, group of friends, teen ager etc...) to stay in Hotel Ares for their travel to the "ville lumière".

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ares Eiffel: Will certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: edweidman
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel. Service was particularly outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sparky098
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely week at the hotel - gorgeous hotel and perfect location. We stayed in the Classic room which was small, however the beautiful decor compensated and the room was immaculate. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself couldn't have been in a more perfect locale, walking distance for everything including the Eiffel tower and the metro. The continental breakfast offered by the hotel was nice but a bit expensive, and the hotel does not offer any other room service, however it is not a problem as there are plenty of restaurants and cafes close by. If you are considering a visit to the city we recommend that you stay at The Ares Eiffle you wil not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A really good place”
Reviews.Author: IvanYB
Reviews.Content: I stay in Ares Hotel for 4 days. It was a wonderful week end in Paris with my sister, and the Ares staff it was really professional and fine. The rooms are very refined and really nothing is leave to random. The interior decoration of the hotel room where we stayed, and the other rooms, is very posh. The location is ideal to start your trip in Paris. In fact the Hotel is located 4 blocks far away the Eiffel tower, and more less to the metro station. I trip to Paris on other occasions and this time it was the more pleasure for me. I advise all the tripadvisor reader to go in Ares Hotel for their holiday in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at hotel ares”
Reviews.Author: falfosa
Reviews.Content: i have been for week end in paris at the hotel ares that we have choose for the the comments on trip advisor .l'hotel is really nice andcompletely renewed this year everything was nice . I really liked the room the parquet the wonderful tv bo and the bathroom with versace tiles the lobby is also very nice wirh the white saloon and the other with all boiserie an with a chemine but the breakfast room is my prefferred whith wonderful black marble withe silver designs.The hotelwas very clean an I appreciated the buffet breakfast is wonderful and not expensive for what you find at the next cafe wher you pay 9.50 for just a glass of orange juice a coissant and a coffe,for 15 euro at hotel you get mixed viennoiserie bread two kind of cheese two kind of cornflakes fresh fuit salad fresh orange juice fresh grapefruit coffe thea nespresso mixed yoghurt jam honey and bread for toasts smoked turkey ad sausseges ,and you can have as you want.i will really reccomend the hotel ares to all my friends,and will be my hotel for my next stay in paris.

Reviews.Title: “we will always have Paris...”
Reviews.Author: RuxandraB
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Paris at the end of October (me, husband, 2y8m son). I picked Ares Eiffel based on previous reviews (thanks all of you). Last year we stayed at a romantic 4* hotel, in Opera Garnier area, but there are no rooms for families. The Ares location is fabulous, on a quiet street, near the metro station, close vicinity to Eiffel Tower (10 min nice walk on the av. Suffren), 30 min to the Ch de Gaule Airport (45 min during weekdays), 5-6 metro stations to the Galleries Lafayette and Printemps (15 min), 3-4 Batobus stations (25 min) from Notre Dame, 1 h to Disneyland (1 metro + 1 RER). The metro station La Motte Picquet is 1-2 min away from the hotel. There are 2 exits: Village Suisse is closer, but if you want to buy Paris visite tickets you must got to the other one. There are 3 or 4 metro lines connecting to different areas. You cannot ask for more! On Saturday 25 th Oct. there was an antiques market on the street, under the metro bridge. We didn’t know about it! So pitoresque and surprising! Quite an experience! The Eiffel Tower is indeed very close to the hotel (better avoid visit the tower on weekends) and the top can be seen around the corner. In front of the tower, accros the street, you can fiind the Batobus station. We decided to take Batobus instead of Bateauxmouches or anything else because it really is like a bus and if my son would not enjoy the ride we could descend in one of the 8 stops. You can buy a ticket and travel all day long, getting on and off whenever you like. We booked a triple room, large by Paris standards, with a 1.80 m x 2 m comfortable bed, 4 pillows (2 soft and 2 firm) and an uncomfortable expandable armchair. Furniture is nice and looks new, the TV is an ok Bang & Ollufsen, the windows are large but you must keep it cover because of the wind blowing trough. The bathroom is practical (2 sinks, 1 shower, 1 bathtub, windows), incredible large, but incredible smelly and cold!!! Cleanliness was a little bit desapointing chapter: we stayed 5 days but they never change sheets. We moved a little the sofa bed and we saw a lot of dust, as they never use the vacuum cleaner in that corner. I expected to have more amenities and the used ones to be replaced. The elevator is not as tiny as in other Parisian hotels (it is enough room for two adults, one child, two big suitcases and a small one!), but is the only one and that is not enough. Stairs are narrow and round (winding). Breakfast is expensive, but poor, so you could choose one of the many bistros on the av. La Motte Picquet. Frontdesk is ok, helpful, childfrendly attitude. Check in was fast, check out too. The night staff should learn to answer to somebody’s bon soir! They have few nice umbrellas you can borough if it is raining. If you want to have lunch or dinner in the hotel area, there are plenty o f restaurants and bistros on the av. La Motte Picquet and av. Suffren. For dinner you better make a reservation, especially on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkRob
Reviews.Content: I (like most people tend to) spent a lot of time trying to find a recomended hotel that would be in a good location for the sites, be value for money, and a nice place to stay. I followed the advice of those that had commented on trip advisor about this hotel and booked myself and my wife in for a short stay. Overall the hotel was very well presented. Modern, contemporary and clean. Didnt think much of the staff that worked there who seemed a little disinterested. The room was very contemporary and in style that my wife loved, although typically Parisian in that it wasnt big. Not a hotel for those that want a bar and lots of facilities. Good location near the Eiffel Tower and right next to the metro with quick links to main Metro stations such as Montparnasse. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: BorisYeltsin
Reviews.Content: We had based our selection of this hotel, for our family visit to Paris, on all the very positive reviews that we had seen on Tripadvisor website. As a result, we had high expectations prior to arriving. We got to the hotel from CDG Airport, by train/metro in about one hour, after getting a "Carte Orange" travel pass in the RAPD/RER sales desk in Terminal 2. The nearest stop is La Motte Picquet-Grenelle, about 200m from the hotel. The hotel is located on a quiet side street, off the busy Boulevard de Grenelle. The location is excellent, eg. only a 15mins. walk from the Eiffel Tower. There are many restaurants and shops nearby, including all the usual department chain stores located on Rue de Commerce, such as H&M, Monoprix, Promod, Sara, Pimkie, Celio, Gap, Etam, etc.. In addition there is a supermarket, "Le Marché Franprix" on Avenue de Motte-Picquet. We arrived at 6pm. Our check-in went smoothly. The boutique hotel theme hits one immediately. We stayed in room 32 for the four nights. There were four of us, i.e. my wife, two teenage children and myself. The room felt small for the four of us. The bathroom too was small. The decor was nice however, and very up to date. Versace tiling etc.. One strange thing was that there were some flies in the room. Both my wife and son, woke up after the first night's sleep with multiple insect bites. I swatted all the flies subsequently. The flies may have come in via the air-conditioning system, or the window, which was a little loose and not double glased. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, as we suspected that it was too expensive at €15 per person. We found an excellent boulangerie chain outlet at 10 Rue de Commerce, called "Brioche Doree - Le Fournil de Pierre", opposite the H&M and Sara stores, only 250m from the hotel. Its breakfast was only €3.90, and included an orange juice, a croissant with jam, and a coffee. Before we found this, we also tried "Le Bouquet de Grenelle" across from the Metro stop on the corner of Boulevard de Grenelle and Avenue de Motte-Picquet. It worked out at €10 per person minimum. There were many restaurants in the area, eg. French, Indian, and Italian. There was also a MacDonalds and a Pizza Hut. We tried only one, "Le Suffren" (about 250m in the Eiffel Tour direction, at 84 Avenue de Suffren), as we were on the move each night. It was okay. All in all, we found it a nice hotel, well centered, and nicely decorated, but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Unknown expectation”
Reviews.Author: DustyDaveAuckland
Reviews.Content: We didnt know what to expect because of mixed reviews. We werent disappointed. Location is great, the staff very helpful and walking distance to everything. The Thai restaurant at the end of the street is superb and do yourself a favour and do the segway tour ( they are just around the corner) - it is fanatastic.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, up-to-date, well sized, great location (four stars)”
Reviews.Author: zarma1
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about hotels. Our budget did not allow for more than 310.00 per night - we were willing to pay that much for a nice room in Paris - for less in Paris you'd get a 2 star hotel at most. We usually stay at 4-5 star hotels, but in Paris the budget had to be reduced to 3 stars because we simply refuse to pay 500 or more Euros per night for a four-five star hotel in Paris! The Ares Eiffel is lovely and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. The hotel would be FOUR stars if it was larger and had a full service restaurant. I prefer the three stars for the price and eat elsewhere! The Ares was lovely. Felt like a smaller boutique hotel. Up to date. Not old and stuffy. The weekend receptionist is overly kind!!! The night staff, a gentleman, is very shy and doesn't speak much - not even to say bon soir. That could be improved. You have to leave your keys when you go out and you have much contact with the reception. The metro is about a minute walking distance from the hotel. The Café Suffren was around the corner and very good (both service and food). The Cafe Garnelle has a Crepe guy on the street and is very very kind- and has the best crepes! We did those for breakfast often. Hotel breakfast at 15 Euros buys you coffee and bread, basically. The crepes are 3.50 and very filling. Full Breakfast in the area can be around 8-12 Euros. Much better than the hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: toolmantadgh
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend at this hotel. The room was fantastic. every detail was looked after, with luxurious fittings and features. And the location is superb- quick walk to Invalides and the Eiffel tower. Staff were generally good. We had great help before we travelled sorting out documents for a visa. Check in was easy and quick. There was quite a wait to check out but that sometimes happens with small hotels. The breakfast area is beautiful, everthing has a designer label. But it is a little too small for more than a handful of people and I'd recommend heading out to a local cafe for le petit déjeuner.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: alfredosiralfred
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well placed and there are many transport possibilities. Look carefullly at the map provided by the web it is very clear. This is the sign of the professionalism of the hotel's staff. Reception desk employees are nice persons,very helpful and they provide several suggestions to enjoy Paris. Clean rooms and new towels every day, furniture is new and there is no noise from corridors. The breakfast is not included in base fare, but I advise to taste it: it is in great quantity and the food's quality (international breakfast,buffet) is very high. I was very impressed with this hotel, expecially for the enviroment: it mixs together elegance, design and originality. The relationship from quality and price is very good. I will definitely stay there again. I'm very grateful with the staff and the owners.I really recommened this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJB8854
Reviews.Content: The Ares Eiffel was fantastic -- very chic decor, gorgeous bathroom with fabulous shower, on a very quiet street. The deluxe room had a queen size bed (very firm with great pillows) and two single sofa beds (rather soft but nice), so it would sleep up to four. The front desk was helpful with directions, though declined to recommend any specific restaurants. It's a 10-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and we could see it from the corner -- the view of it lit up at night is incredible. Just one block away is a great patisserie/chocolate shop for breakfast, and the Motte Piquet Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “This Boutique Hotel is a perfect spot for a Paris Holiday.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBubbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 2 granddaughters and it was a very good choice. The Hotel is cozy and friendly, The Metro is very close,a 2 min. walk, there are good restaurants near by, the Eiffel Tower can be seen down the street from the Hotel, and it is a short walk away.The breakfast was very good, you could help yourself to as much as you want of Chocolate Crousants!!!!!! The only negative for us was that there was 4 in one room and it was a little tight , but it would be perfect for two. The bathroom was very modern. There was plenty of room for our clothes to be put away.Also, the free internet is a real plus when you want to communicate with your friends and family. I would stay here again and I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: WesK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 to 10 October 2008. The position of the hotel is not the most picturesque, being in a back street about 1/2 mile from the Eiffel Tower but the hotel itself is superb. As other reviews I have read have said, the rooms, like in most city hotels, are not large but they are finished to the highest standard. It looks as though the hotel has been completely refitted not just a paint job. Everything from the tiles on the walls to the furniture and the linen looked brand new. Everything worked perfectly in the bathroom and the separate toilet, from the large rain shower to the twin washbasins, and the B&O TV was fine, except that there were only two English channels - BBC Prime, showing endless repeats of 'The Family' etc., and CNN news. The bed was reasonably large and very comfortable, although the pillows presented the usual problem of one was too little, two were too much. The only criticism we have of the room is the size of the wardrobe/closet for hanging your clothes. It is tiny - around a foot wide with only three hangers in it (take some of your own). There are also some shelves, a small fridge and a safe built in as well so we could only take a few shirts etc. out at a time to hang up. The area around the hotel had many restaurants and a supermarket and the Metro station (La Motte Picquet Grenelle) around the corner was on three different lines and was very convenient - we went everywhere on the Metro, very cheaply (the only thing that was cheap in Paris!). We thought EUR15 was expensive for breakfast before we got there but we looked around the local restaurants and whilst you could find cheaper options, they generally only included juice, a croissant and a pastry for about EUR9 or 10. The hotel buffet included (very good) fresh fruit, toast, fresh juice, yoghurt, cereals etc. as well as croissants and pastries, so was much better value. The people who staffed the hotel were always friendly and helpful and we enjoyed our stay here, even though we found everything in Paris very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlmcarw
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor was gorgeous and the room and en suite was very clean. From the Versace bathroom tiles, to the personalised greeting on the flat screen TV in your room when you arrive, everything felt very luxurious. The room was quite small but for sight-see-ers this really wasn't an issue, although for those looking to spend longer in the hotel it may become a little cramped. There was a wide range of foods to choose from at breakfast, which was enjoyed in a very modern and wonderfully decorated dining area. I have no complaints and can wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ares”
Reviews.Author: Fred08Sydney
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ares is gorgeous. Recently renovated in a very classy decor. The staff were extremely helpful and it is only 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower and 2 minutes to the metro. With young children it was a safe area to walk at night. Our only issue was the beds being quite hard and the breakfast was quite expensive. I would however recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - Better Value Than Big Chain Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Happywhenonvacation
Reviews.Content: In late August our family spent three fantastic days in Paris at Hotel Ares. It was a great experience all round. if you are into boutique hotels we would recommend this one for sure. The hotel is conveniently located to La Motte Piquet Grenelle Metro station and no more than a 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel is very kid friendly, and we got free internet through the TV and wireless as well (try that in a big hotel). The breakfasts are expensive (like anywhere in Europe) but of high quality. The small dining area can get crowded so you may have to wait a few minutes to get a seat in the morning (they have a nice adjoining reading room). One of the best things we found as a family was that they had a deal going where you could take all the juice and water in the minibar for a flat rate per day ($5 Euro I think). This saved us countless Euros during the day. We had two very well appointed rooms and beautifully decorated. Not large by any standard, but we were not in the rooms often or for a long time. The larger of the rooms comfortably accomodated Grandma and the two kids (one on a "pull out bed" chair). One week later we stayed for 2 days as part of a tour in a well known upscale chain hotel, and while it was nice, it was 3x the costs and I would rather have stayed at the Hotel Ares again. We will definately return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand why this hotel only has 3 stars - it's fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JustMarriedDevon
Reviews.Content: We were really worried about making the right choice of hotel, as this was a special holiday. We visited travel agents who were not very helpful, so we decided to explore booking everything on line. We spent ages reading through reviews of lots of hotels. When we read the reviews for the Hotel Ares, some people said they found the rooms to be small. We disagree. We loved our standard double room, and found it was more than adequate for the two of us. The mini bar was brilliant (but non alcoholic) at 5 euro a day for 8 drinks, and we loved having the use of a room safe. The decor of the rooms was fresh, clean and gorgeous. The bed was very comfortable,and the bathroom was very classy. Our room was cleaned and the bed clean-sheeted every day. The hotel was peaceful, and yet in an excellent location as we were able to walk around the corner and see the Eiffel Tower "sparkle" every night. The staff were very helpful, organising a last minute booking for us for dinner at the Eiffel Tower, and letting us leave our bags with them on the last day as we had an evening flight. We loved it. We had a great stay this summer, and hope to stay with the Hotel Ares when we go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Some nice touches”
Reviews.Author: guakayla
Reviews.Content: I travel to Paris frequently and am constantly searching for hotels that can provide quality and value-somewhere pleasant & comfortable without being outrageously priced. After combing through TripAdvisor, the Ares looked promising and I decided to give it a try for a night or two of my 6-night stay. (I like variety). I can appreciate small Parisian hotels for their charm, but usually I manage to snag a good corporate rate at one of the major chains such as Hilton, Westin, or Hyatt which tend to offer more amenities, so to be fair, the 3-star Ares, no matter how pristine, was probably not going to live up to my usual 4-star experiences. The current exchange rate between the $USD and the euro is hard to swallow, so was it worth $400 a night? My first impression was not great, because I arrived late at night, the door was locked and it took repeated ringing of the bell and knocking to rouse the night attendant. I was grateful my taxi driver waited those moments with me, otherwise I would have been a single woman on a dark street by herself. I do speak French, so what follows is translated…The night attendant said something along the lines of “We didn’t think you were going to show up”. I think it’s my business what time I arrive, especially for a room for which I’ve prepaid (one night deposited was required on their website), and it’s his business to answer the door promptly! Even though I was traveling alone, I had decided to book the Superior double at 260 euros/night when I could have booked a standard single at 230. I think that was a good decision, because I sure would not have wanted the room (#16) to be any smaller. I expect Parisian hotel rooms to be relatively small. What bothered me is that when you visit their website and click on Superior room, it shows a bright corner room with 2 big windows. I got a small dark room with one window. When I saw the room, I was convinced they had given me a standard room by mistake. The night attendant was not qualified to answer any of my questions. I would think the person on duty should at least have been able to say with confidence what type of room it in fact was. He seemed perplexed that I didn’t like to room, and could offer no further assistance as it was simply the room the day shift assigned to me. The hotel was full, so there was no choice in rooms at that late hour. At least he was able to provide me the internet access code and I was appreciative of the free internet. The other great deal of this hotel is that you can take as much as you want from the minibar for only a 5 euro per day fee, but note it only contains water and soda. The bed was large, a queen or maybe even a king. It was comfortable enough, however if the sheets had been a little softer and the pillows feather rather than synthetic, I would have been much more impressed. The other thing that bothered me was there was no place to put my luggage. I had to put it on the only chair and then had nowhere to sit but the bed. I would think it would be in the hotel’s interest to provide a simple luggage rack rather than having people throw their bags on the new furniture. The air conditioning worked well. There was no iron & ironing board in the room, but the next morning when I called for one it was promptly delivered. The room was very clean-immaculate dark wood floor and stylishly tiled bathroom with double sinks, a bathtub with rainshower and Hermes amenities. These quality elements are what drew me to the hotel in the first place. Considering the bathroom was a design element of the room, I was particularly disappointed that there was insufficient hot water. I don’t mean it ran out, it was just was not hot enough. At that point I was exasperated and decided I was going to check out as long as I could find a decent rate for a 4-star which I did. When I checked out (at least they didn’t give me a problem about checking out early) the owner asked me about my stay and expressed great concern when I mentioned the lack of hot water. He seemed caring and responsive and said he’d check into it. I also asked to see a twin room, which turned out to be the spitting image of the Superior room pictured online-the bright corner room with 2 windows that I was looking for. It also had a larger bathroom. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel so I can’t comment on that. The hotel is located in a classy neighborhood and it’s nice and quiet. It’s near the metro and especially near the Eiffel Tower, so if you are perhaps on your first trip to Paris I think you’d be impressed that it’s only a short walk away. One could definitely do worse for the price. So all in all, I would maybe consider the Ares again, but I would be sure to book a twin room which was only 20 euros more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, well-appointed and classy”
Reviews.Author: aejae212
Reviews.Content: Very chic, modern, but without the pretentiousness. Hermes toiletries in the room, towel warmers, Bose TV, very comfortable bed...the hotel even had a very nice baby crib for our 14 mos old when we arrived. Great neighborhood, very quiet side street leading up to the Eiffel Tower. Proximity to nice restaurants and the Motte Piquet metro station was very helpful. The owner (Enrico) has a lovely family, and they treat their guests as one of their own (he went so far as to purchase a US converter for me to borrow). We will certainly return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “5* Hotel for the Price of 3*”
Reviews.Author: Bethian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in a residential area with the Metro, supermarket and local restuarants all within 5 minutes walk. Free internet with keyboard and TV as screen is a bonus and the 5 Euro per day all you can drink mini bar is excellent value for Paris. The room is small but not too small for Paris. Most importantly, it is modern, clean and you can open the windows for fresh air. Hotel was recently refurbished with very posh Versace tiles and B & O TV. The hotel is located in a very safe area and is a pleasant 10 mins walk to the Eiffle Tower. We would strongly recommend this hotel highly to all.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: UkKnights
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at this great place. Ideally situated to explore Paris on foot, by bus or by metro. Staff were really friendly and helpful, booked a delux room as recommended on here and it was worth it. Clean comfortable great. Had breakfast at Suffren on Rue Suffren, for 12 euros really good value for money, cheaper than the hotel. Would recommend this Hotel to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gorm0
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small but so what ? This is a really nice, modern clean hotel. Its in a lovely, quiet, residential area yet only 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower. They threw in a continental breakfast for free because we had just missed a special offer which was very kind in this day and age. All staff were very helpful and informative. All in all, very happy indeed. Free internet (including keyboard) also proved very useful in getting directions or restaurant ideas before we left on our daily adventure. Paris is class by the way, lovely architecture and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: dsully85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights. Room was lovely especially the bathroom. What a shower! Ideal location, ten minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Plenty of bistros and restaurants around and metro is just around the corner. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Probably a bit on the expensive side but it is Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atravellerWales
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiday for 15th September for 4 nights, we chose the hotel because of the good reviews. We were not dissapointed! We had a warm welcome with a brief of the surrounding ares and ammenities, we were given a clear map of paris (which we used to the fullest). The hotel lobby is very clean and stylishly decorated and provides a warm reception after you've been travelling for 8 hours. The room was decorated to a very high standard, we booked a standard double which was a little on the small side but we did not have a problem with that because we were out all day until late (you don't go on holiday to stay in the room all day). The room was clean and fresh and the bed was a good size with crisp white sheets. The bathroom was fantastic! VERY clean and beautifuly decorated (Versace tiles) there were fresh towels every day, the shower we considered to be the best shower we've ever had! The is a mini bar in the room which has soft drinks, at 5 euros a day it will be refilled for you when they clean the room. The only downside to the room was the TV system, only one english speaking channel was available (CNN) the room came with wireless internet access however we did not take our laptop and we wish we did! The keyboard in the room was VERY tricky to get to grips with (trust me one that one). Breakfast is served between 7 and 11 and is a buffet style continental breakfast, situated in a stylish and peaceful room, the breakfast is a bit expensive at 15 euros per person per day but it was included in our package. There was a good selection of food - Croissants, Toast, Bread Rolls, Museli, Yogurts, selection of meats, Tea, Coffe and Juices. The hotel is situated on a quiet street with no noise at night, there is a main road around the corner with lots of shops and resturants. The metro station is just around the corner with connections to all the useful stations around Paris. The hotel is ten minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower which is an amazing site at both night and day. The staff were all pleasant and very helpful and when we go back to Paris we will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Bluejumper
Reviews.Content: Ideally located for the Eiffel Tower and literally a stones throw from the nearest Metro line - Le Motte Picquet Grenelle. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and there was alwyas someone on the desk regardless of the time. Our room was on the 5th floor facing out front so no view of the Eiffel Tower for us, but the room itself was gorgeous and well equipped with quality fittings - only comment would be that the room itself had no mirror - had to use the mirror in the bathroom. Overall fantastic and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Parisian yet modern and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: its-all-about-travel
Reviews.Content: My experience of Parisian hotels has never been a good one, usually over priced, tiny, dirty and noisy holes I was advised to read Trip Advisor for reviews and came across the Hotel Ares Eiffel. I was not certainly not dissapointed!! Upon arriving at this hotel after taking some time to find it (nearest metro station is Dupleix which we discovered after a long walk) we were greeted by some people doing a designer photo shoot of the lobby area, it was that chic. Although the room was small, which is not uncommon in Paris, our room was stylish, modern and yet still aired a traditional Parisian feel. The room was clean and luxurious, even down to the bathroom tiles! The room had most things you'd need, a small mini bar, a safe in the room and a flat screen TV for watching those bizarre late night French movies. The bathroom was small again but perfectly formed with its marbled sinks and designer tiling. The shower was heaven and you were fully catered for with small toiletries and a hairdryer. The staff were very friendly and helpful, albeit a little aloof on occasions. Breakfast was good, a simple continental occasion with yoghurts, pain au chocolates, crossiants, cereals, juices, coffees etc. The one thing that impressed me the most though was how quiet the hotel was. Not on one occasion did we hear another guest or hear a lift buzzing or a door banging. The only dissapointment Id say was that we expected a room with a view of the tower and although we got a view of the tower it was only the top half and the rest was obscured by buildings. Still, we did have a small balcony we could stand (not sit) out on and share a glass of french red wine and look up at the tower all lit up. Quite romantic. We loved this hotel and feel it was worth every penny. We'd stay again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Ares Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: TXtraveller54
Reviews.Content: Incredible hotel in a charming area of Paris. This hotel has very recently been updated and the rooms and public areas are completly charming. A fantastic value compared to other hotels in the area. Because the hotel is on a small street that doesn't show up on most navigation systems (as we learned from taxi drivers) make sure you bring your own directions if taking a taxi from the airport or if you are out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Jenferan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after looking for something reasonably priced but which wouldn't disappoint for our tenth wedding anniversary. We found it on Trip Advisor after much research, and were definitely not disappointed. The hotel looks exactly like the pictures on the website: chic, modern 'hotel' decor, very stylish but no precious antiques etc. The beds are firm-comfortable, pillows down soft but hypoallergenic. The rooms, though small, are imaculately clean with dark wood floors and super modern stylish bathrooms with a good shower - the space saving bath is a bit tight if you are bigger than average or tall. We had a standard double room which was fine for two and the Bang and Olufsen tv with free internet access was useful for local research, although all tv stations are in French except CNN. The aircon is efficient and quiet. In fact this is the quietest hotel I have ever stayed in and I have stayed all around the world from fleapits in London to five star resorts in the US to the Stormont in Belfast. The hotel is hard to find if you rely on local maps as Rue du General - Larminat isn't on any of them. Make sure you get a detailed local map (Google?) before you go, or ask for La Village Suisse, a collection of 150 antique and art shops which most people know. At the edge of this area you can see the hotel sign and indeed the road name. The hotel is in 15th Arrondissment, a quiet area, but its very easy to get around from here. La Motte Picquet -Grenelle metro is just around the corner and Champ de Mars rer station about ten minutes walk away, next to the Seine. We used the RER to transfer from CDG airport and found it easy and relatively quick - about an hour with changes on the way back - a bit longer if your train is not a direct service and makes all the stops. transfer costs 8 euros each way per person. A few minutes up the river at the Eiffel tower is the Batobus river shuttle - a pleasant way to get around the city on a nice day, but at 11 euros for a one day pass it's cheaper and more versatile / quicker to buy a metro carnet pack of tickets. The staff speak good English if you need it and are helpful and polite. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel as we wanted to get out and try other places so can't comment on the quality but the price is high in comparison with other local options. We enjoyed breakfast most at a salon du the just down the road with a stunning array of pastries and good coffee. Local restaurants - avoid La Pierrot it is cheap but poor quality. La Gauloise has excellent food in the traditional French style with very pleasant helpful staff - although ours spoke only French he tried with a dictionary when my tourist French ran out of steam over the less obvious dishes on the menu. I had sot l'y laisse (its chicken - I had to look it up!!) with white truffle risotto and it was divine. Followed by an assortment of desserts 'Assiette Gauloise' which was lovely but made me want to go back and try the larger versions of the tiny sampling portions. The chocolate mousse is very well made.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: tenorone
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay -- the staff was very helpful and nice. The area was interesting and convenient to the metro, and the rooms were clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel with quiet location”
Reviews.Author: DMR
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. It is very close to the metro so you can get around town easily and it is within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Our room was small but very clean, well decorated and quiet. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and the air conditioner worked perfectly. The bathroom was really a treat with wonderful tub, shower, high end fixtures, designer tile, make up mirror and blow dryer. The morning breakfast offered downstairs provides a good amount of food options including cereals, yogurt, meat and cheese, breads, juice and coffee. The front desk staff is very good with providing tourist assitance and restaurant referrals. If you have an extended stay and want to take a break from french food then please try Goldini's Italian Restaurant just around the corner. The staff here was very friendly and spoke good english. The pasta was delcious. Also, if you are staying during the weekend, check out the local farmers market on Sunday morning located under the metro track around the corner. Lots of beautiful fruits, flowers and fun items to purchase or just enjoy a stroll with the locals as they do their weekly shopping. The Ares Eiffel hotel offers a convenient location along with a welcome retreat after a busy day in downtown areas. This place is a class act, as we had a plumbing problem at one point and we were offered other rooms of our own choice. They also provided a bottle of champagne with a nice note to apologize for the inconvenience. I would love to stay at this place again and would encourage others to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tanwscat
Reviews.Content: Excellent recommendation from Trip Advisor. We found our way to the hotel very easily from the airport. The hotel is conveniently located near a metro station served by 3 metro lines. There is a little supermarket, and a couple of cafes nearby the hotel. We have breakfast at a local cafe every morning before boarding the metro to start our day. The modern bathroom is designed by Versace and we loved the Hermes shampoo and body wash. However, no body lotion is available. The room also had Bang & Olufsen TV with FREE internet access. We found the integrated keyboard with mouse difficult to use. In the morning, we did hear running water noise from other rooms. Not sure if this was just a problem with the room we stayed in. Overall, the hotel made our stay in Paris a very pleasant one, and we will stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cattylea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, travelling with our 13 yr. old daughter, can't say enough good things about the Hotel Ares Eiffel. It was recently rennovated and has beautifully appointed rooms and ensuite bathrooms with all the amenities including heated towel racks, lit magnifying mirror, and separate tub and shower. The hotel is centrally located to cafes, stores, and metro station but just enough off the beaten track to be extremely quiet. The staff is courteous,professional and helpful as well as multi-lingual. I would recommend this hotel to all except those travelling w/ young children. Catherine Tally Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen1984
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of reviews on trip advisor and were not disappointed. Set in a great location just 10 minutes walk from the eiffel tower, this truly is a beautiful hotel. The hotel is impeccably designed down to the finest detail - the Versace tiles in the bathroom are a great touch! The rooms are small, but when you're only making a short stay this isnt really a problem. Would highly recommend the hotel to all those who appreciate a bit of glamour! It is a great find and will definitely be recommending to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Amy425
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Ares. The room was small, but nice. I loved the wood floors-it seems so much more clean than icky carpet. The bathroom was small, but the shower was actually pretty nice. Bring your own washcloth and soaps and shampoos though. We ended up using a hand towel as a substitute for a washcloth, and also ended up buying emergency soaps at the grocery store as the hotel's soaps were like cologne. Very pungent. The air conditioning in the room was wonderful (I wasn't expecting European ac to be very effective). One night the ac didn't work at all for about 6 hours, but then miraculously came back on. We had huge windows that opened onto a little patio so there was the option of leaving the doors open too for a little fresh air. The street noise was almost nonexistent except for garbage trucks and the occasional passerby. Towards the end of our six nights we finally noticed we had a view of the Eiffel tower. It wasn't very dramatic, but we could see from the upper observation deck to the top. Pretty cool! You aren't going to be any closer to the metro either-it's right around the corner. All in all, we really loved the hotel and the location. If you want a cheaper stay though, my sister was one metro stop away down by Rue Cler (which has lots of good food choices) at the Mugeut Hotel. The room was smaller and the bathroom miniscule, but it was clean, had a great breakfast sunroom and nice ambience all around. We ate at her hotel as we didn't feel the 15 Euros for a continental breakfast was worth it. Her hotel charged 9 Euros for breakfast and included all the continental fixings plus omelets made fresh. I don't think you'd be disappointed staying at either place. Great finds!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel ares”
Reviews.Author: bouletin
Reviews.Content: we just came back from paris were we spent three days at wonderful hotel ares we resesrved a superior room that was very confortable very well decoratedwith top furniture and television bang olufsen versace tiles .the reception the brakfast room are really lovely the location is is really ok, the metro station is just behind the corner with many lines the receptioist are really nice and helpful , definetly we will reccomend to all our friends and we wilcome back we would like to stay on the junior suite .

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: andjambro
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 'Classic Room' (which is the cheapest) for 2 nights in Aug 2008 after seeing great reviews on Trip Advisor. The location, friendly staff and service and designer feel were all great, we'd stay there again definitely (breakfast until 11am, someone always on the desk etc - always clean and super chic). Only gripe is that the classic rooms are a little small - think about upgrading. e.g. You can get breakfast delivered to your room, but in the classic room that's not that appealling because there's nothing other than the bed in the space. p.s. If you want to keep up the designer style experience you could do worse than eat here: http://www.toptable.co.uk/venues/restaurants/?id=2128&refid=ggl05&gclid=COKAr7XAhZUCFRSO1QodlWhorA (alcazar, 6th)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfchick99
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel located just 10 mins walk from the Eiffel Tower. From the outside it does not look impressive but inside the rooms are decorated beautifully, albeit on the small side - the bathrooms are Versace with Hermes toiletries and we had complimentary towelling slippers (very welcome after a day's walking!!). The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and didnt mock our attempts at French!! The breakfast room is small but welcoming and although the breakfast is quite expensive at 15 euros there is a selction of croissants, cereals, meat and fruit juice (and is available until 11am which again is useful!!). They also have a room you can store your luggage in after you've checked out and the hotel is open 24 hours a day. The hotel is quiet and relaxing and well located - this is the best 3 star hotel you could find in Paris, and although quite expensive is definitely worth the money for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's top 10 spot!”
Reviews.Author: Willeh
Reviews.Content: Why this hotel fell from its former position of #1 to it's current position of #9 (as of 16/08/2008) is beyond me. Maybe #1 was a bit of an exaggeration but it still deserves to be in the top 5 hotels in Paris. Moving on to the actual review, we arrived here on the 4th August at around 9.30 AM, and check in (if I remember correctly) was at 12 PM. We had booked a deluxe room (for 4), a triple room (for 3) and a double room (for 2). The deluxe room was ready which was a bit of a surprise, and the other two rooms required a little more time. As a result, all 9 of us went into the deluxe room, placed our luggage in there and freshened up after having to wake up at 1 AM in the morning to catch our 5 AM Eurostar journey to Paris. The deluxe room wasn't tiny (and neither were the triple and double rooms) but neither was it spacious. With all our luggage in the the deluxe room (9 peoples worth), there was still some room to move around in. The beds were truly comfortable (which was a great advantage as we spent 3 days in Paris and we had to rush to fit everything in therefore we were burnt out by the end of each day), the room decor was excellent and the bathroom was very classy too. They also do a continental breakfast buffet i.e. croissants, pain au chocolat, cornflakes, turkey slices, yoghurt etc. which was 15 euros per person. The breakfast room's decor was also very well done, although the room was smallish. There was a member of staff present, restocking the fresh juices and foods, and she was also very helpful and cheerful. The receptionists (changes in the morning and evenings) were very cheerful and helpful, which was excellent. On two occasions, we got back to the hotel past midnight and the hotel was locked. We knocked and the night time receptionist happily allowed us in. It's also worthy of note that there is an elevator which goes up and down to all floors. The hotel offers a whole range of free services e.g. Wifi internet and it won't do the hotel any justice mentioning them here, it's-see-it-to-believe-it. Overall, it boosted our first trip to Paris from excellent to unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “newest and excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: simona_luciani
Reviews.Content: if you like to live the hotels this is theplace to be. design style mixed with very good service. ares otel was a surprise at first sight! lounge and breakfast room alwayss ready to give you a welcome andthe relaxing library seems to be the private house of a famous designer . we were a groups of 3 rooms ,one different from the other where we discovered amazing furniture just a few step from the tour effeil and the luxurious apartments of famous people. paris seems to be a new fresh touch of modern living. breackfast with fresh fruits and also real italian coffee. a touch of style also n the bathroom with parfumed hermes little bottles. wi-fi connection in all the hotel useful for my job and romantic view fro the bed of the room suite with an original coffee set and a chaise long that has massage ready for the coming back fom my long walkingin pariis. if i can give an advise to itlaina and european people who likes style this is the hotle you can choose:

Reviews.Title: “A great Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeamDragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this boutique hotel with our 8 month old daughter. A cot bed was supplied and ready on arrival. The staff were very welcoming and friendly with a no problem attitude. The hotel has achieved a stunning designer feel in a relatively small space which works from the lobby up. A great location with some lovely restaurants just around the corner, the metro just down the road and shops and bars a 5 minute walk. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel .. not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ClareGLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked our 4 night stay at the Area Eiffel when the hotel was rated #1 in TripAdvisor. By the time we went, the rating had dropped to #8 and I was a little aprehensive, but I have to say that we were not in any way disappointed. The room (superior double no 26) was spotless and felt very luxurious, event though it was (as others have said) a little small. This really didn't matter ithough, for our relatively short stay. The situation is perfect and we ate in the area several evenings. Strongly recommend the nearby Rue Cler for picking up lunch for a picnic or a casual evening meal at one of the outside tables at the excellent value Cafe bon Marche. The Eiffel tower really is 10 mins walk away .. don't miss the twinkling lights on the hour from dusk. There was a special deal on the breakfast buffet when we stayed ... we took advantage .. a perfect continental style buffet but I don't think we'd have paid the 15 euros a person otherwise. We have recommened the hotel to my elderly in laws who are planning a trip to Paris in the autumn

Reviews.Title: “a lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fabpo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ares Hotel a month ago for a week-end. The room itself was very nice, The decor was excellent, the bed was comfortable , and the use of the internet through the TV was great so that I could keep up with current events. I loved the free wireless internet and internet on the B&O television. Seperate WC and spacious bathroom. My room was on the 2rd floor, it was not at all noisy from outside. The road on which the hotel sits is quiet and residential. The breakfast was good, it was included. And if you prefer, You can have breakfast in your room at no extra charge . The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is one of the best thing about the hotel. It is a quiet neighborhood. There is a Metro station just one block behind the hotel! The Eiffel Tower is literally less than 10 minutes of walk. There are several shops, restaurants, cafes, and a great grocery store very close by the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frankie_C71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ares Hotel during the week of Bastille Day. The room itself was very small, but that was to be expected. The decor was excellent. The bed was comfortable enough, and the use of the internet through the TV was great so that I could keep up with current events. Seperate WC and spacious bathroom. The staff was friendly and helpful. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is a quiet neighborhood. There is a Metro station just one block behind the hotel! The Eiffel Tower is literally a 10 min walk. There are several shops, restaurants, cafes, and a great grocery store very close by. I began to feel like a local after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: mr7958
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Paris can be so hit and miss. The Ares Eiffel is definitely a hit. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly, and the room was nicely furnished with a very comfortable bed and excellent show. Parisien hotel rooms are never going to be very large and this room was no exception, but there was room either side of the double bed and the bathroom was far from cramped. I loved the free wireless internet and internet on the B&O television, but it was a pity that certain English language television stations were not working. Only CNN was available. I did not have breakfast at the hotel, so cannot comment on that. Although my room was at the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor, it was not at all noisy from outside. The road on which the hotel sits is quiet and residential. The wooden floorboards meant that there was some noise from above when people walked around with their shoes on. I guess that might have been annoying if I had been there for a long time but for two nights was no big deal. The nearby metro station is very well connected to the network, and although this hotel is not smack bang in the middle of the city it is very easy to get everywhere in Paris that you might want to go. I was very impressed and would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel ares”
Reviews.Author: zazzones
Reviews.Content: i have made europ tour and we spend very nice days in paris and for that i want thank the hotel ares for gentlness and for help of the desk the hotel is very nice and design .very near to eiffel tower and in very parisian quarter full of restaurants and shops the hotel is very quiet so i will remember this vacation for ever .i will reccomend to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “really like on the web site”
Reviews.Author: cater8
