Reviews.Content: i am just come back from paris and want tosay that i have past very nice days at hotel ares eiffel the hotel was very clean and wery well refurbished what ihav apprecieted on the web site is the fact that when you choose the room thatis o.k. for you you know exactly how big is because hte squaer meters are writed on,so you can decide wich category of room is the best for you .the rooms are very well decoreted with very high standard quality like tv bang and olufsen the versace tiles .thestairs are very nice with big flowers on the walls the breakafast room and hte white saloon wher my preferred the rooms amenities are from hermes .the service was very helpful and spoke wery well english . the quarter was very nice and really parisian life on sunday there is a little market under the metro bidge .eiffel tower is only seven minutes towalk and the metro is hundred meters from the hotel and three lines will drive you every where directly in paris the hotel is in very calm little street and the location is great.definetly me and my wife will reccomend this hotel to my friends .

Reviews.Title: “Classy, friendly and an all round great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: uglyduckling26
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Very well run, beautiful rooms and definately worth a visit. Although quite pricey to some i doubt you could find better and worth the money once your their. The staff were extremely helpful with any queries and the hotel is well placed with paris on the doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_G
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from holidays and stayed at 7 hotels in the top 3 on Tripadvisor. This hotel was located in a great area, not to close to the hustle and bustle but close enough to be only a couple of stops on the Metro from anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is beautiful, modern inside the rooms and very clean. The only criticism I have is that they said they had a single suite that would fit 4 adults ( my wife and I and our two adult daughters ) but the room was clearly not big enough for 4 adults with virtually no room to walk around the room . Compared to our stay in the other 6 hotels recommended by Trip advisor the service at the front desk was OK but not outstanding as was the case with the other Hotels we stayed at. Having said all this I still would have no hesitation recommending this Hotel and staying there again but don't try to put 4 adults into one room !

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadTraveller-76
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Hotel Ares for 3 nights as the last stop on a 3-week motorbike tour of Europe. We had got a good deal on an Executive Room which was a beautiful room and looked very luxurious; the bed was huge and the bathroom was large with a fantastic shower. The room itself wasn't huge, so I wouldn't like to think how small the cheaper rooms are. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, instead we thought it would be better value for money to go to one of the many local cafe's for our morning coffee and croissants. There was no parking at the hotel, instead they have some sort of deal with a local supermarket that has an underground car park which we could use for 11 euros a day. We left the bike there for 3 nights and it didn't come to any harm, although it seems most people abandon motorbikes on the pavements in little groups, so in future, I wouldn't bother reserving a parking space and instead do as the Parisians do... it'd be a lot cheaper! The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. We didn't have any problem with room noise or road noise, as other people seemed to have experienced. The hotel is only about a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower which looks stunning when all lit up at night. Turn left out of the hotel for the closest metro; the metro system is very efficient and good value for money. Restaurant recommendation - Le Train Bleu at Gare de Lyon train station. Ignore the fact that this is at a train station - the restaurant is about 100 years old and has a fantastic menu with some excellent food and wine and very attentive, professional service. All in all, our experience was well above that of a regular 3 star hotel in Paris and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room”
Reviews.Author: Mondave
Reviews.Content: Room was beautifully appointed. Clean and modern. New flat screen TV with free internet access, Staff were helpful and spoke English. Location - close to Metro and walking distance to Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Yansoon
Reviews.Content: If your after a nice clean modern room just for sleep and do not expect all the usual hotel amenities then this is the place for you. It all started from the bus service from the airport arranged by the hotel. After making contact with the driver they didn't know who we we're or where the hotel was. An hour and a half later we arrive. After complaining to the hotel all we got was a "sorry". A small gesture would of been nice to make up for the mistake. The room is nice and recently renovated. However no tea or coffee facilites, no food available from the hotel and no shampoo, the TV selection is poor at best. For me It's the small things which i need to recuperate after travelling a long way. The hotel in my opinoin was not good value for money. I would usually book a 4 star minium however based on the trip advisor reviews i chose this hotel. The hotel is no where near a 4 star. On the plus side it is in a great location plenty of nice cafes near by as well as a metro station. Just a 10 minute walk to the effiel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KMAKR
Reviews.Content: Kostas- Athens 9 July 2008 Stayed in Ares for five days in July 08. This is a fine hotel in a quiet area, yet well placed for Metro and bus transports . Excellent renovation in a modern style, nice & clean room, enormous & comfortable bed (we had a double superior), good breakfast with fine croissants. Touches of luxury, there are Hermes "Orange Verte" soaps in the functional bathrooms. Free internet and wifi on B&O multimedia tv. Personnel is very helpful and kind (important in Paris !). This is a 3* hotel but rates much better than many so-called 4*. Prices are reasonable for Paris. Highly recommended for couples/families. Would stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn17
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because at the time of booking it was the number one hotel in Paris on Tripadvisor. Location: Having not been to Paris in 10 years, we had no idea what location to chose and were advised that Opera and Saint Germain were better options because there is great buzz in those places.I have to agree I loved the narrow streets and bustle of Saint Germain and the cute little bars and restaurants but we were 100% satisified with the location we chose. The hotel is situated just off Rue de Grenelle,5 mins walk from Ecole Militaire and 10mins max from Eiffel tower.What we loved about the hotels location was that it was a very residential and local area - so you really got the feel of staying in proper Paris with little restaurants and bakeries full of locals and not too many tourists around. Hotel: We were there for a few nights so picked the cheapest room which was 200eur a night (I'm told this is good for a nice hotel in Paris).The room, as expected was tiny, but beautifully done up and the bathroom was a nice size. The size of the bedroom didn't bother us at all was we were out all day. Very nice flat screen tv with free internet which was great for looking up places to go etc. Although the decor of the hotel was lovely, the atmosphere was almost non existant - there was a small open room inside the main door with books and comfy couches but you'd never really sit there.Reception staff were helpful and friendly but we had very little contact with them and really just spent our stay going straight to room and leaving it, with no interaction with hotel. It was nearly like we were renting a little apartment - there was no bar/place where you'd see other guests. We didn't really mind this as were gone all day anyway and out again at night but if you were looking for a hotel with good bar/buzz I wouldn't pick this one. Didn't have breakfast based on tripadvisor reviews - instead we stopped every morning in a boulangerie around the corner and had breakfast on the go which was always delicious. We are not massive fans of all french food so one of the nights we went to Goldinis restaurant which was recommended by another tripadvisor reviewer. It's an Italian restaurant just down the road from the hotel and we loved it. I would recommend Hotel Ares but I would pay the extra for a bigger room next time, they look amazing on the hotels website.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel we have stayed at in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: EEvans7
Reviews.Content: We read the review on tripadvisor and decided that it was perfect for my 15-year-old daughter and me for our week-long trip to Paris. The hotel has recently been renovated and is really clean and lovely. The bathroom had a modern shower and the room had a small balcony and flat screen television. The staff could not have been more helpful and kind, assisting us in making reservations for every dinner of our trip. The free wi-fi service came in handy for a cell phone-starving teenager. My 15-year-old gave it two thumbs up and anyone with a teenager knows how tough that is to get. The hotel is located two blocks from a metro station with three lines running through it (Motte Piquet) and it's about a seven minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Although it is so close to the Eiffel Tower, the hotel is in an area that is less touristy and the street it is on is very quiet. We would definitely come to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at hotel ares”
Reviews.Author: rita3rome
Reviews.Content: I just came back from paris where i have passed real nice stay at the marvelous hotel ares is just five minute walk from eiffel tower ,the rooms are really very nice and the service is very helpful anything you ask they do them best for you like reserve three star michelin restaurant or a vist of paris . in the rooms you have wi fi and internet on tv with a key board for free great .the minibar is only five euros a day .the breakast was also nice continental breakfast but all fresh like fresh orange juice and fresh juice grape fruit also fresh fruit salad with croissant choclate bread and bread cheese coffee milk and tea and also nespresso for me that iam italian was really great,andyou can have as you want.the public areas are very nice and my preferred was the white room and the breakfast room defenitely iwill come here again and I will strong reccomend to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room, nice reception but unprofessional housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: kelly-babyowl
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated small boutique hotel around Eiffel tower. When I was there, the room had recently painted smell which was not pleasant but the room itself was all decorated with luxurious brands : the bathroom tile was Versace, TV was Band&Olufsen, etc. Room was rather small but the bathroom was spacious and very modern. the Reception was friendly too. The location was very nice, few steps from the metro station and eiffel tower. Very convinient to access other main sightseeing areas. Surounding area is very clean and quiet. The only negative thing was the housekeeping service. The bed sheets were not changed while we were staying there even if there was a small stain on my Mom's. So my Mom asked the lady to change it showing the stain. The lady changed it for here but she didn't seem to be happy to do that. She didn't empty the garbage bin although it was half full. However, she emptied it the next day when it was really full. Overall, it was very satisfying although it's expensive. But in Paris, it is not easy to find such a clean, modern hotel with such a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: charroDublin
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a short break with my wife last week... what a wonderful stay!!! everything was perfect: the room spacious and luxury, the staff very helpful and friendly, the location very close to Tour Eiffel. my only regret: we decided to have breakfast in the hotel the last day... that was a pity! there was a great breakfast buffet with the best croissant I ate in Paris, fresh bread, yogurth, coffee, .... ... I absolutely recomend this nice and elegant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: papemelroti
Reviews.Content: i have read all the great reviews in tripadvisor before booking this room but i felt it was quite a disappointment the hotel itself is just a 3 minute walk from the metro and the interiors of the rooms are fantastic. i like how the hotel was quite small and personal, there was free wifi and the receptionist was friendly.however theres lack of amenities and inadequate service. they dont have housekeeping so any problem you might encounter with your room (i had problems with the sink etc) had to wait until the next day. they never mentioned any tea/ coffee making facilities which is understandable but i wish that they would at least provide a spoon or fork in the room. they did not replinish toiletries too. i had to request it from them when i ran out on the fourth/fifth night.. for other people who are light sleepers the rooms are not that sound proofed so you might hear bits of noise at night but it wasnt a problem for me. i understand that paris rooms are smaller than average so the room size was accepted as is. i did know how large the space would be before booking the biggest problem would be the service. we had a prebooked arrangement from hotel to the airport for free but the driver never showed up. apparently he did show up but the hotel reception told him that we had checked out THE DAY BEFORE. we waited for our ride without having any idea that he already left thanks to the misinformation.like i said the receptionist was friendly but have managed to make us spend an additional 52 euros on taxi due to carelessness.he didnt even offer to help us call a taxi when we said we needed to get a cab in order to make it to our flight. awkward moment of stares and "what do you want me to do" looks ensues. i would probably not stay in this hotel again. i do love the rooms but i dont want to get stressed during my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: MariellaSollini
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern and immaculately clean. We had a small balcony and the room was immaculate with the most white and crisp bedding. The bathroom was very modern and trendy with lovely fluffy white towels. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful without exception. A verg good buffet breakfast was provided each morning. We will stay at this hotel when we return to Paris. Highly recommended for a quiet, relaxing holiday. Surely a FIRST CLASS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChetHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: Just coming back from Paris. Now I'm spending some sunny time in Italy at my cousin's town. I was at hotel Ares 10 days ago. Friendly staff and fantastic location. Just five minutes walking far from eiffel tower, three metro stations and a lot of restourants, bistrot and place where have good time in the evening, My room was spacious and luxury furnished, the breakfast was perfect with croissant, chocolate bread, fresh orange and grapefruit juice, milk, coffee (nescafe also) and tea. The price was reasonable and matched the property. I had great time at Ares. Absolutely recommended. Chet

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeLacy_Cork
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at this hotel in a superior room based on the Trip Advisor reviews. Firstly, I was not disappointed with the cleanliness of the room nor the great location - they were both perfect. Additionally, although very close to the centre of Paris, a good nights sleep was ensured every night, the location straddles that void between being near where you want to be, but in a quiet location. The staff were lovely. The communal spaces such as the dining room and the lounge area were stylish and comfortable. The room, however, was small. There was no where to put my case for packing or unpacking except for on the bed. That was Ok for unpacking, but for packing it was an inconvenience. I stayed three nights, I used all of the tiny bottle of complimentary Hermes shower gel on the first night and it was never replenished. There appears to be no provision to get a cup of coffee in your room in the morning instead of going downstairs and paying 15 Euros for a basic continental breakfast. Admittedly I did not ask, but then again there was nothing in my room on the information sheet to indicate that any sort of room service is available. I am not a mean or penny pinching person, but felt that the price of the breakfast was a little steep for what was on offer. On the last morning of my stay I found a great cafe just around the corner from the hotel which offered a better choice for much less. Would I stay again? Probably, because it was clean, quiet and elegant - but I definitely feel that the breakfast is too expensive for what is it, despite the very smart table settings and decor, and it would be nice if toiletries were replenished as used.

Reviews.Title: “Tea for two in Paris”
Reviews.Author: taffy33
Reviews.Content: Whilst in an excellent location to explore central Paris; on entering our room we found the standard room attractively decorated yet a little too small for comfort. Being typically British, we expected at least a kettle for teas, coffees etc., but unfortunately this wasn't the case and the suggested 15 euro per person breakfast seemed a little too steep. The internet access on the plasma tv was poor; incredibly slow, complicated and no sound. On a more positive note, the mini fridge was well stocked and cheap, only 5 euros for 8 drinks. The bathroom was a joy and the staff were very knowledgable and helpful. We would probably not go there again however we would recommend it if someone wanted to stay close to the eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, correct reviews on trip advisor!”
Reviews.Author: nathaliejane
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, really struggled with finding a decent, reasonably priced hotel in Paris. I used this site for a recommendation, despite being told by lots of people to never book a hotel below four star in Paris so was worried at booking a three star. It was great. Rooms are lovely (I booked a superior room as this was all that was left) and it was really nice, newly decorated and really swanky. The bed was sooooo comfortable and there was very little noise as the hotel is tucked away on a quiet street. Despite this it is very close to the metro,eiffel tower and lots of cafe's and resturants. The staff were very helpful and friendly and happy to assist on tourist info. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel building”
Reviews.Author: aretti
Reviews.Content: I have found the hotel from internet, I stayed at a superior room and furnitures and bathroom was brand new, clean and perfect in terms of decoration. Hotel is very clean and also close to metro station with 3 lines. Eiffel is 10 minutes walk. There is also free internet both on room TV and wireless.
